original: ras dang mar me ma gtogs par snang bar bya ba rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: ras dang mar me ma gtogs par snang bar bya ba rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other substance that is illuminated, except for the cloth and the lamp.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang shes te ha cang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang shes te ha cang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is known that the same is true of feeling, etc., because they are too close.

original: yang dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the sameness of the objective support would be violated.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa yin na ci'i phyir don dam pa shes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa yin na ci'i phyir don dam pa shes par mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is engaged in the aspect of selflessness, why is it not knowledge of the ultimate?

original: gar mkhan gyis shin tu bslabs kyang rgyal po'i rol pa dang 'dra bar mi nus pa ltar de ltar gyur pa la yang shin tu gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gar mkhan gyis shin tu bslabs kyang rgyal po'i rol pa dang 'dra bar mi nus pa ltar de ltar gyur pa la yang shin tu gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like that, because it is not very stable, like the performance of a dancer, even though it is well trained.

original: kun rdzob shes pa de yang nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa de yang nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That conventional knowledge is also afflicted and unafflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The afflicted is also of two kinds.

original: lta ba'i bdag nyid ni lta ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i bdag nyid ni lta ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The view is of the nature of view.

original: lta ba lnga po rnams ni ji skad du bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba lnga po rnams ni ji skad du bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The five views are as they have been taught.

original: lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is not of the nature of view is not of the nature of seeing.

original: the tshom la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with doubt, etc.

original: de ni shes rab nyid yin zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las so //
analyzed: de ni shes rab nyid yin zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las so //
translated: It is wisdom itself, according to the conclusion of the treatise.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Non-defiled wisdom is also of two kinds:

original: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous and unobscured-indeterminate.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four kinds: born of maturation, etc.

original: de ni yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa ma yin pa dang / phyi rol du bltas pa'i rnam pa'i phyir lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa ma yin pa dang / phyi rol du bltas pa'i rnam pa'i phyir lta ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not view because it is not of the nature of thorough searching, and because it is of the aspect of looking outward.

original: dge ba ni gang rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni gang rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig rgyu ba ste /
translated: The virtuous is that which accompanies the five consciousnesses.

original: de ni shes rab nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni shes rab nyid yin te /
translated: It is wisdom itself,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-conceptual.

original: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-greed and non-hatred, because it is associated with non-greed and non-hatred.

original: yid kyis gang yin pa de ni @273a * //
analyzed: yid kyis gang yin pa de ni @273a * //
translated: That which is mental is also of two kinds:

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: This is the mundane right view.

original: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma gzhag pa'o //
translated: This right view is of two kinds: concentrated and not concentrated.

original: mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The not concentrated is of three kinds:

original: skye bas 'thob pa dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye bas 'thob pa dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from birth, arisen from hearing, and arisen from reflection.

original: de la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni ming la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni ming la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Among these, the knowledge arisen from hearing has as its object the name.

original: bsam pa las byung ba ni ming dang don la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba ni ming dang don la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge arisen from reflection has as its object the name and the object.

original: dper na rkyal ma bslabs pa dang / cung zad bslabs pa lta bu ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rkyal ma bslabs pa dang / cung zad bslabs pa lta bu ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a person who has not learned to swim and one who has learned a little, respectively.

original: de la skyes pas thob pa ni khams gsum char na'o //
analyzed: de la skyes pas thob pa ni khams gsum char na'o //
translated: Among these, that arisen from birth exists in the three realms.

original: thos pa las byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang / 'dod pa'i khams na'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang / 'dod pa'i khams na'o //
translated: That arisen from hearing exists in the first meditation and in the realm of desire.

original: gong ma na rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir mi dge ba med do //
analyzed: gong ma na rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir mi dge ba med do //
translated: In the higher realms, there is no nonvirtue because there is no investigation and no analysis.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni mi dag go //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni mi dag go //
translated: The unobscured-non-defined is in all three realms.

original: bsam pa las byung ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid na'o //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid na'o //
translated: The meditation that arises from reflection exists in the realm of desire.

original: de dag ni gang gi tshe bsam par rtsom pa de'i tshe de dag gi bsgom pa 'grub bo ;
analyzed: de dag ni gang gi tshe bsam par rtsom pa de'i tshe de dag gi bsgom pa 'grub bo ;
translated: When one begins to reflect, the meditation is accomplished.🔽The meditation that arises from hearing is the knowledge of one who is not concentrated, i.e., it has as its object the letter and the meaning.🔽The meditation that arises from reflection is the knowledge of one who is not concentrated, i.e., it has as its object the meaning.

original: / mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa ni don la dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: / mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa ni don la dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: The meditation that arises from meditation is the knowledge of one who is concentrated, i.e., it has as its object the meaning.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: This meditation is of four types:

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa ni nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa ni nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa'o //
translated: 1. favorable to retrogressing, favorable to the arising of the defilements;

original: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni dge ba dang mthun pa'o //🔽khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni dge ba dang mthun pa'o // khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: 2. favorable to stability, favorable to the wholesome;🔽3. favorable to advancement, favorable to the stages conducive to penetration;

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni zag pa med pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni zag pa med pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: 4. favorable to penetration, favorable to the pure.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The meditation of the realm of fine-materiality is of the nature of five aggregates,

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the form of the stage that is the following of the meditation is present there.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin te gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin te gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The formless realm is by nature the four aggregates, because it is free from the discernment of form.

original: ci'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa gnas 'dir brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa gnas 'dir brjod ce na /
translated: Why is conventional knowledge mentioned here?

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi sgo rnam par dpyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi sgo rnam par dpyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the door to the noble path and it is the retinue of the noble path.

original: ji skad du mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i kun rdzob shes pa rnams ni bden pa gsum gyi mtha' las rnyed pa ste mi skye ba'i chos can no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i kun rdzob shes pa rnams ni bden pa gsum gyi mtha' las rnyed pa ste mi skye ba'i chos can no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “The conventional knowledges that arise from the end of clear knowledge are obtained from the end of the three truths and are unarisen dharmas.”

original: lam gyi bden pa la ni med de mtha' dag mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la ni med de mtha' dag mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it does not exist in the truth of the path, because the entire path is not clearly known.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'bras bur gyur pa da ltar byung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'bras bur gyur pa da ltar byung ba rnams la'o //
translated: The knowledge of suffering is with regard to the five appropriated aggregates that are the result, which are present.

original: nye bar len pa'i kha na las pa'i phung po rnams @273b ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i kha na las pa'i phung po rnams @273b ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
translated: The appropriated aggregates are the appropriated aggregates that are the result.

original: dper na rgyal po la brten pa'i mi la rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po la brten pa'i mi la rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a person who is dependent on the king is called a king's man.

original: gal te de lta na dgra bcom pa mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len pa'i kha na las pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na dgra bcom pa mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len pa'i kha na las pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the aggregates of an arhat who is not in meditative equipoise would not be appropriated misdeeds.

original: 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault here.

original: de dag kyang nye bar len pa'i kha na las pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang nye bar len pa'i kha na las pa yin te /
translated: Those are also appropriated misdeeds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'phangs pa'i las de'i kha na las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'phangs pa'i las de'i kha na las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are misdeeds of the karma projected by the power of affliction.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa la sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa yod pas bsad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa la sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa yod pas bsad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the killing of an arhat that is projected by previous karma.

original: rnam pa des na de las byung bar brjod par nus te /
analyzed: rnam pa des na de las byung bar brjod par nus te /
translated: In this way, it can be said that they arise from that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar sred pa dang ma rig pa gnyis kyis byis pa'i lus yang dag par thob pa ltar mkhas pa'i yang de bzhin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sred pa dang ma rig pa gnyis kyis byis pa'i lus yang dag par thob pa ltar mkhas pa'i yang de bzhin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the body of a child is obtained through both craving and ignorance, so it is for the wise.

original: yang na de dag yod pas nye bar len pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de dag yod pas nye bar len pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, appropriation arises because of their existence.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing lta bu'o //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing lta bu'o //
translated: like a tree that bears flowers and fruit.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi nye bar len pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi nye bar len pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it produces the appropriating aggregates in another life.

original: mi rtag pa ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi phyir mi rtag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi phyir mi rtag par mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen as impermanent because it is subject to origination and destruction.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal du mthong ngo //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal du mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen as suffering because it is by nature a harm.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: In what way is it by nature suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gsum yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the three kinds of suffering exist in it.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i khams na'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i khams na'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering exists in the realm of desire.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni gzugs kyi khams na'o ;
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni gzugs kyi khams na'o ;
translated: The suffering of change exists in the realm of form.

original: /'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ni gzugs med pa'i khams na'o //
analyzed: /'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ni gzugs med pa'i khams na'o //
translated: The suffering of the formative forces exists in the formless realm.

original: de bzhin du yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa yang ci rigs su rang gi khams su brjod par bya'o //🔽nang na byed pa'i skyes bu med pa'i phyir bdag med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa yang ci rigs su rang gi khams su brjod par bya'o // nang na byed pa'i skyes bu med pa'i phyir bdag med par mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the pleasant, etc. should be appropriately connected with their respective realms.🔽It is seen as insubstantial because there is no inner controller.

original: bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir stong par mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen as empty because there is no self or anything pertaining to a self.

original: kha cig na re bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Some say: There are two kinds of selflessness:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o zhes 'dzer te /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o zhes 'dzer te /
translated: the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos la bdag med pa de ni mdo sde dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa de ni mdo sde dang 'gal lo //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena contradicts the sutras.

original: kun dga' bo ri dags 'dzin gyi ma'i khang bzangs 'di ni glang po dang rta dang ba lang dang lug dang phag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ri dags 'dzin gyi ma'i khang bzangs 'di ni glang po dang rta dang ba lang dang lug dang phag gis stong ngo //
translated: Ananda, the mansion of the mother of Upali is empty of elephants, horses, cows, sheep, and pigs.

original: 'di ni mi stong ba yang yod de /
analyzed: 'di ni mi stong ba yang yod de /
translated: But it is not empty of humans.

original: 'di ltar dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis so //
translated: It is not empty of the community of monks.

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad ni bdag dang bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad ni bdag dang bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Ananda, in the same way, all compounded phenomena are empty of self and what belongs to self.

original: gang 'di ni lhag ma yod pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'di ni lhag ma yod pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What remains here is what exists here.

original: ji ste stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug ce na /
analyzed: ji ste stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug ce na /
translated: If you say that emptiness is sixteenfold,

original: de ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba dang @274a * //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba dang @274a * //
translated: then the terms emptiness and

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba de snga phyi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba de snga phyi 'gal lo //
translated: sixteen are mutually exclusive.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par bshad bzhin du ci'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du brjod ce na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par bshad bzhin du ci'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it called suffering when it is explained as impermanent, etc.?

original: skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called suffering in order to generate disgust.

original: dpal 'dzin gyis bde bar tshor ba med de /
analyzed: dpal 'dzin gyis bde bar tshor ba med de /
translated: Śrīdhara says that there is no feeling of pleasure,

original: gang ci tshor yang de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained that whatever is felt is suffering here.

original: de'i don ni gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i don ni gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to determine the meaning of that,

original: rang bzhin sdug bsngal bar khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin sdug bsngal bar khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: it is said that one should not accept that it is suffering by nature,

original: kun dga' bo de ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa dang / 'gyur ba mi rtag pa la dgongs te bstan to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa dang / 'gyur ba mi rtag pa la dgongs te bstan to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “Ānanda, I taught that with the intention of impermanent conditioned states and changing impermanence.”

original: 'du byed rnams dang 'gyur ba dag / mi rtag par ni mkhyen nas su //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang 'gyur ba dag / mi rtag par ni mkhyen nas su //
translated: Knowing conditioned states and changes to be impermanent,

original: rab mkhyen rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: rab mkhyen rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: the perfect Buddha, the perfect knower,

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal rab tu gsungs //
translated: taught that feeling is suffering.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa ni /
translated: Knowledge of origin

original: nye bar lan pa'i phung po lnga po rgyur gyur pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba de dag nyid 'dres pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: nye bar lan pa'i phung po lnga po rgyur gyur pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba de dag nyid 'dres pa rnams la ste /
translated: The five aggregates that are the effects of the retribution of the actions and defilements that are their causes, and which are mixed with them,

original: 'di ltar las dang nyon mongs pa gnyis las srid pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang nyon mongs pa gnyis las srid pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence proceeds from the two, action and defilement.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni shun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni shun pa lta bu'o //
translated: The defilements are like the husk.

original: las ni 'bras bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: las ni 'bras bu lta bu ste /
translated: Action is like the fruit.

original: dper na 'bras shun pa dang ldan na myu gu 'byin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa las srid pa'i myu gu 'byin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras shun pa dang ldan na myu gu 'byin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa las srid pa'i myu gu 'byin no //
translated: Just as a fruit with its husk produces the sprout, so existence produces the sprout of existence when it is associated with the defilements.

original: rgyu med par smra ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of nihilists:

original: kha cig ni thams cad rgyu med par khong du chud de /
analyzed: kha cig ni thams cad rgyu med par khong du chud de /
translated: some understand that everything is without cause;

original: 'di lta ste med pa pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste med pa pa rnams so //
translated: for example, the Lokāyatas.

original: kha cig ni la la rgyu yod la /
analyzed: kha cig ni la la rgyu yod la /
translated: Some understand that some things have a cause,

original: la la med par te /
analyzed: la la med par te /
translated: but others do not;

original: 'di lta ste tshangs pa chen po ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs pa chen po ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: for example, the great Brahmā is without a cause,

original: gang des sprul pa de dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang des sprul pa de dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: but the emanations of Brahmā have a cause.

original: de bzhin du byed pa med par smra ba'ang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽kha cig na re la la ni byed pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa med par smra ba'ang rnam pa gnyis te / kha cig na re la la ni byed pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Likewise, there are two kinds of nihilists.

original: la la ni byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: la la ni byed pa med pa ste /
translated: Some say that some things have a cause and some things do not have a cause.🔽Some things have a cause and some things do not have a cause.

original: 'di lta ste dbang phyug ni sdig pa gang gis kyang mi gos so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbang phyug ni sdig pa gang gis kyang mi gos so //
translated: For example, God is not defiled by any sin,

original: gzhan dag ni sdig pa dang ldan no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sdig pa dang ldan no zhe'o //
translated: but others are sinful.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen por rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen por rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the antidotes to them are the aspects of cause, origination, strong generation, and condition.

original: yang na gang 'phen par byed pa las dang nyon mongs pa lhan cig rgyu ba de ni rgyu dang kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang 'phen par byed pa las dang nyon mongs pa lhan cig rgyu ba de ni rgyu dang kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which propels is karma and the afflictions that accompany it; that is called cause and origination.

original: gang skyed pa de ni rab tu skye ba dang rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang skyed pa de ni rab tu skye ba dang rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: That which generates is called strong generation and condition.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams la 'gog pa med do zhes snyam pa de'i gnyen por 'gog pa la 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams la 'gog pa med do zhes snyam pa de'i gnyen por 'gog pa la 'gog pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the antidote to the thought that Buddhists have no cessation is cessation is cessation.

original: dbang po gcig 'gag na yang @274b sdug bsngal na dbang po thams cad 'gag pa lta ci smos snyam pa de'i gnyen por zhi ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po gcig 'gag na yang @274b sdug bsngal na dbang po thams cad 'gag pa lta ci smos snyam pa de'i gnyen por zhi ba ste /
translated: The antidote to that is peace,

original: me gsum shi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me gsum shi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the three fires are extinguished.

original: rtag tu dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: It is sublime because it is always virtuous.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad med pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad med pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is definite release because it is free from all suffering.

original: de dang ldan na 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad steng pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan na 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad steng pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one possesses it, one is free from all conditioned things.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus ni lam yang gzings dang 'dra bar 'dor ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus ni lam yang gzings dang 'dra bar 'dor ro //
translated: At the time of complete nirvana, the path is also discarded like a raft.

original: shes pa rnam pa de lta bu ni 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa de lta bu ni 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Such knowledge is called cessation.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams la lam med do snyam pa de'i gnyen por lam la lam mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams la lam med do snyam pa de'i gnyen por lam la lam mo //
translated: The antidote to the thought, “Buddhists have no path,” is the path is the path.

original: lam na rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lam na rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The path is not unreasonable,

original: 'di ltar mi gtsang ba nyon mongs pa de dag lam gyis gzhig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi gtsang ba nyon mongs pa de dag lam gyis gzhig pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the path destroys those impurities, the afflictions.

original: dper na spyad gang gis rma dral ba de yang mi gtsang bas sbags pa bzhin no snyam pa'i gnyen por rigs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na spyad gang gis rma dral ba de yang mi gtsang bas sbags pa bzhin no snyam pa'i gnyen por rigs pa'o //
translated: For example, the wound is also soiled by the filth of the excrement.

original: 'di ltar lam skye bar mngon du gyur pa na nyon mongs pa'i rnyed pa 'gag par mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam skye bar mngon du gyur pa na nyon mongs pa'i rnyed pa 'gag par mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, when the arising of the path is evident, the cessation of the possession of the defilement is evident.

original: dper na mar me byung ba mngon du gyur pa na mun pa 'gag par mngon du 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me byung ba mngon du gyur pa na mun pa 'gag par mngon du 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the arising of the lamp is evident, the cessation of the darkness is evident.

original: gal te mun pa dang mar me gnyis skad cig gcig gi bar du lhan cig gnas par gyur na ni skad cig brgyar yang gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mun pa dang mar me gnyis skad cig gcig gi bar du lhan cig gnas par gyur na ni skad cig brgyar yang gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the darkness and the lamp were to exist together for even one moment, they would exist together for a hundred moments.

original: sgrub pa ni yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Accomplishment is the correct accomplishment.

original: ji ltar na yang dag par sgrub pa 'phags pa'i lam yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na yang dag par sgrub pa 'phags pa'i lam yin zhe na ;
translated: How is the correct accomplishment the noble path?

original: gnas ma yin te go skabs med do //
analyzed: gnas ma yin te go skabs med do //
translated: It is not possible, there is no opportunity for that.

original: gang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag ched du bsams te /
analyzed: gang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag ched du bsams te /
translated: For a person who is endowed with the correct view,

original: bslab pa las 'da' ba dang / ngan song du 'gro ba dang / ma ning du 'gyur ba nas srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa'i bar du gnas med do zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o /
analyzed: bslab pa las 'da' ba dang / ngan song du 'gro ba dang / ma ning du 'gyur ba nas srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa'i bar du gnas med do zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o /
translated: There is no possibility of transgressing the precepts, of going to the lower realms, of becoming a neuter, etc., up to the actualization of an eighth existence.

original: 'dis sangs rgyas rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bas nges par 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis sangs rgyas rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bas nges par 'byin pa ste /
translated: It is the outlet, since it is the outlet for the Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddhas.

original: shes pa rnam pa de lta bu zag pa med pa de ni lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa de lta bu zag pa med pa de ni lam shes pa'o //
translated: Such uncontaminated knowledge is knowledge of the path.

original: de la shes rab ni rtog pa dang / brtag par bya ba dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni rtog pa dang / brtag par bya ba dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is that which is conceptual, that which is to be investigated, and that which has aspects.

original: de ltar shes rab rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, wisdom is endowed with aspects.

original: shes rab gzhan dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gzhan dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is endowed with another wisdom.

original: yul la 'dzin par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages in the apprehension of objects.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rtag par bya ba yin gyi rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rtag par bya ba yin gyi rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Mind and mental factors are endowed with aspects and are to be investigated, but not conceptualization.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa mun pa dang mtshungs @275a * //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa mun pa dang mtshungs @275a * //
translated: Feeling and so on are like darkness.🔽

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because feeling, etc. are like darkness.

original: gzugs dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni brtag par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni brtag par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Form and the non-associated formative forces are to be investigated.

original: de bas na shes rab ni mngon par rtogs pa dang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab ni mngon par rtogs pa dang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, wisdom is threefold:

original: mthong ba mngon par rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / byed pa mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba mngon par rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / byed pa mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: the realization of seeing, the realization of the object and the realization of the function.

original: de dang ldan pa rnams ni dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / byed pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa rnams ni dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / byed pa mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Those who possess it have the realization of the object and the realization of the function.

original: de dang mi ldan pa rnams ni byed pa mngon par rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa rnams ni byed pa mngon par rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Those who do not possess it have the realization of the function alone.

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement: “I have fully understood suffering”

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par ro //
translated: is in the aspects of impermanence and suffering.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement: “I” is because of the conventional usage.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not in the aspects of emptiness and non-self.

original: kun 'byung ba spangs so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du rnam pa bzhi po dag gis so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spangs so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du rnam pa bzhi po dag gis so //
translated: The phrase “the origin of suffering has been abandoned” is also explained in the same way by means of the four aspects.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the truths of cessation and the path.🔽Thus, the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is made up of fourteen aspects.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu bzhi ni zad pa shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu bzhi ni zad pa shes pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.🔽The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.

original: zad pa la zad par shes pas zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa la zad par shes pas zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: mi skye ba shes pa yang de bzhin no //🔽bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa yang de bzhin no // bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te /
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: yang yongs su shes par bya ba med do //
analyzed: yang yongs su shes par bya ba med do //
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.🔽The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: de bzhin du yang bsgom par bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bsgom par bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: shes pa 'di dag nyid ni lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /🔽yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa 'di dag nyid ni lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.

original: shes pa lhag ma brgyad ni lta ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: shes pa lhag ma brgyad ni lta ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: shes pa yin la lta ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: shes pa yin la lta ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.🔽The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.🔽The knowledge of non-arising is also like this.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers because it is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.🔽The knowledge of non-ar

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / the tshom la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / the tshom la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i shes rab po //
translated: the cognition of exhaustion, the cognition of non-arising, and the cognition associated with the group of doubts, etc.

original: lta ba yin la shes pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lta ba yin la shes pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a view that is not cognition.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i bzod pa rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i bzod pa rnams so //
translated: The receptivities that occur at the end of the realization of the truths.

original: lta ba yang yin la shes pa yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lta ba yang yin la shes pa yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a view that is also a cognition.

original: de shes rab bdun dang kun rdzob shes pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de shes rab bdun dang kun rdzob shes pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The seven cognitions and the part of conventional cognition that is view.

original: lta ba lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The five views.

original: lta ba yang ma yin shes pa yang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lta ba yang ma yin shes pa yang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is neither a view nor a cognition.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, and the formations aggregate.

original: zad pa med pa'i shes pa 'di dag ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa gsum po dag na dbang po rtul po ni dka' la mngon par shes pa @275b bul ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: zad pa med pa'i shes pa 'di dag ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa gsum po dag na dbang po rtul po ni dka' la mngon par shes pa @275b bul ba'i lam mo //
translated: These seven cognitions that are not views are the path of slow progress for those of dull faculties in the stage of unrestricted access concentration, the special first absorption, and the three formless realms.

original: dbang po rnon po ni dka' la mngon par shes pa myur ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni dka' la mngon par shes pa myur ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of the sharp faculties is difficult and quick in superknowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can ni shes rab kyi shas che la zhi gnas chung ngo //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can ni shes rab kyi shas che la zhi gnas chung ngo //
translated: The preliminary stage and the special meditative absorption have a greater share of wisdom and less of calm abiding.

original: gzugs med pa gsum ni zhi gnas kyi shas che la shes rab chung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum ni zhi gnas kyi shas che la shes rab chung ngo //
translated: The three formless meditative attainments have a greater share of calm abiding and less of wisdom.

original: dngos gzhi bsam gtan bzhi po dag la dbang po rtul po ni sla la mngon par shes pa bul ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dngos gzhi bsam gtan bzhi po dag la dbang po rtul po ni sla la mngon par shes pa bul ba'i lam mo //
translated: The four actual meditative absorptions are the path of the dull faculties that is slow and quick in superknowledge.

original: dbang po rnon po sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of the sharp faculties is slow and quick in superknowledge.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because calm abiding and insight are combined.

original: dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i lam ni sla ba'i sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa'i lam ni sla ba'i sgrar bstan to //
translated: The path included in the actual meditative absorption is taught by the word slow.

original: dbang po bye brag gis ni bul ba dang mgyogs pa'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: dbang po bye brag gis ni bul ba dang mgyogs pa'i sgra smos so //
translated: The dull and sharp faculties are mentioned by the word slow and quick.

original: kun rdzob shes pa 'khor ba'i mthar lhung ba'i phyir gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa 'khor ba'i mthar lhung ba'i phyir gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Conventional knowledge is exclusively contaminated because it falls into the end of samsara.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of another's thoughts is either impure or pure.

original: kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o ;
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o ;
translated: That which is by nature conventional knowledge is impure.

original: / chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: That which is by nature knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge is pure.

original: lhag ma chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang ; mi skye ba shes pa rnams ni zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang ; mi skye ba shes pa rnams ni zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The remaining knowledges, namely, knowledge of the doctrine, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, knowledge of cessation, knowledge of the path, knowledge of destruction, and knowledge of nonarising, are pure.

original: pha rol gyi sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam shes pa rnams ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam shes pa rnams ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of another's thoughts, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, and knowledge of the path have conditioned things as their object.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of cessation has unconditioned things as its object,

original: 'gog pa 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cessation is unconditioned.

original: lhag ma ni gnyis la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gnyis la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The remaining knowledges have both as their object.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The domain of the knowledge of suffering and origin is impure.

original: spyod yul ni dmigs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul ni dmigs pa la bya'o //
translated: The domain is the object.

original: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa'i spyod yul ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa'i spyod yul ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The domain of the knowledge of cessation and path is pure.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi spyod yul ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi spyod yul ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: The domain of the rest is both.

original: so so bye brag tu 'gyur ba ni gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin no /🔽// / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: so so bye brag tu 'gyur ba ni gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin no / // / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The individual differences are as they occur in the scriptures.

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, on the perfections, in this Ornament of Abhidharma: A Commentary on the Verses.

original: bzod pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: bzod pa ni brgyad de /
translated: The forbearances are eight.

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term “forbearance”?

original: bden pa bzhi la cher bzod pa'i phyir bzod @276a * //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la cher bzod pa'i phyir bzod @276a * //
translated: It is so called because one mainly forbears the four truths.

original: pa'o ; / shes pa'i bye brag nyid du de zag pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'o ; / shes pa'i bye brag nyid du de zag pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught that they are uncontaminated because they are a specific type of knowledge.

original: de ni zhes bya ba bzod pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba bzod pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: “That” is to be connected with “forbearance.”

original: nges pa'i shes pa rnams ni shes pa brgyad de /
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa rnams ni shes pa brgyad de /
translated: The certainties are the eight knowledges.

original: chos shes pa bzhi dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa bzhi po de dag go //
analyzed: chos shes pa bzhi dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa bzhi po de dag go //
translated: The four knowledges of the doctrine and the four subsequent knowledges.

original: skal ba 'dra ba'i rgyur gnas pa dang / gnas yin pa dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skal ba 'dra ba'i rgyur gnas pa dang / gnas yin pa dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the cause of a homogeneous character, because they are the basis, and because they are the condition as direct antecedent.

original: de'i skyed pa ste 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i skyed pa ste 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: They are the generator, the producer, of the knowledge of the doctrine.

original: rnam pa brgyad po de dag ni lta ba nyid do shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad po de dag ni lta ba nyid do shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: These eight aspects are the view, not the knowledge.

original: nges pa'i don ni shes pa'i don to //🔽yongs su zhes bya ba ni kun nas te /
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni shes pa'i don to // yongs su zhes bya ba ni kun nas te /
translated: The knowledge of the meaning of the truth of suffering is the meaning of the truth of suffering.🔽The word “completely” means “in every way.”

original: kun nas tshol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas tshol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “to seek in every way.”

original: shes pa ni nges par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa ni nges par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The knowledge is the very state of certainty.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i las ni gsum du brjod de /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i las ni gsum du brjod de /
translated: The action of the perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering is said to be threefold.

original: khams gsum pa'i rnyed pa rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid spong ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i rnyed pa rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid spong ngo //
translated: It abandons future ordinary personhood, because it interrupts the acquisition of the three realms.

original: log pa nyid spong ste log pa nyid kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: log pa nyid spong ste log pa nyid kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It abandons the three kinds of wrongness.

original: 'gro ba log pa nyid dang / las log pa nyid dang / lta ba log pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba log pa nyid dang / las log pa nyid dang / lta ba log pa nyid do //
translated: 1. the reversal of going, 2. the reversal of action, and 3. the reversal of views.

original: mi 'gro ba dang / mi byed pa dang / kun 'byung ba med pa'i phyir de gsum 'jig rten pa'i bzod pa nyid kyis rgyang bsring mi zin tam /
analyzed: mi 'gro ba dang / mi byed pa dang / kun 'byung ba med pa'i phyir de gsum 'jig rten pa'i bzod pa nyid kyis rgyang bsring mi zin tam /
translated: Since there is no going, no action, and no origination, why are these three not included in the mundane patience?

original: de lta yin yang gnas gsal bas shin tu rgyang ring du byed pa'i phyir de'i tshe spong zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta yin yang gnas gsal bas shin tu rgyang ring du byed pa'i phyir de'i tshe spong zhes bstan to //
translated: Even though that is so, since they are very far away because of the clarity of the state, they are taught as abandonments at that time.

original: de ltar 'byung ba ni mi skye ba shes pa'i bar dag dang / skal ba 'dra ba'i rgyu nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba ni mi skye ba shes pa'i bar dag dang / skal ba 'dra ba'i rgyu nyid du gnas so //
translated: In this way, up to the knowledge of nonarising, they remain as the homogeneous cause.

original: 'gag pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: The cessation is the cessation of the ten afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, beginning with the acquisition.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam par mthong bas skye'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam par mthong bas skye'o //
translated: It arises through seeing the aspect of impermanence.

original: rnal 'byor pa de dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These yogis are of two types:

original: 'dod chags spyod pa dang lta ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa dang lta ba spyod pa'o //
translated: those who practice desire and those who practice views.

original: 'dod chags spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who practice desire are of two types:

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa dang / le lo la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa dang / le lo la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: and the one who is overcome by the pride of the thought “I am” and the one who is attached to laziness.

original: lta ba la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lta ba la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The one who practices the view is also of two kinds:

original: bdag dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: the one who is attached to the belief in “I” and the one who is attached to the belief in “mine.”

original: de la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ngo //
translated: The one who is overcome by the pride of the thought “I am” sees the truth of suffering through impermanence.

original: le lo la mngon par zhen pa ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ngo //🔽bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ni bdag med pas so //
analyzed: le lo la mngon par zhen pa ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ngo // bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ni bdag med pas so //
translated: The one who is attached to laziness sees the truth of suffering through suffering.🔽The one who is attached to the belief in “I” sees through selflessness.

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par @276b zhen pa ni stong pas so //
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par @276b zhen pa ni stong pas so //
translated: The one who is attached to the belief in “mine” sees through emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags spyod do //
translated: The bodhisattva practices through desire.

original: de lta mod kyi stong pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi stong pa nyid du ste /
translated: However, it is through emptiness.

original: dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the sharpness of his faculties.

original: de la da ltar byung ba'i rnam pa ni bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: de la da ltar byung ba'i rnam pa ni bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: Therein, the present aspect is through the two kinds of cultivation.

original: thob pa dang nges par rten pa'i bsgom pas so //
analyzed: thob pa dang nges par rten pa'i bsgom pas so //
translated: They are cultivated by obtaining and by being definitely connected to the stage.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bzhi ni thob pa bsgom pa dag nyid kyis so ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bzhi ni thob pa bsgom pa dag nyid kyis so ;
translated: The four future ones are cultivated by obtaining.

original: / rnam pa thams cad ni skal ba 'dra ste /
analyzed: / rnam pa thams cad ni skal ba 'dra ste /
translated: All aspects are similar in type.

original: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the lineages have not been obtained.🔽The dharma cognition of those is also that.

original: chos shes pa yang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa yang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnyed pa ste /
translated: The obtainment of nirvana of those very ones to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering is the dharma cognition of those.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bral ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bral ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Nirvana has the characteristic of separation.

original: bzod pa ni 'dir bar chad med pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'dir bar chad med pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Patience is the uninterrupted path here.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang sbyar te /
translated: Here means in the path of seeing.

original: 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bzod pa dag gis spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bzod pa dag gis spong ngo //
translated: In this way, the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned by the patiences.🔽The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: bstan bcos las kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu ste /
translated: There are nine types of fetters.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i ris ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i ris ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: The class of fetters is abandoned by the knowledge of the dharma of suffering and by the knowledge of the subsequent dharma of suffering.🔽Similarly, the class of fetters is abandoned by the two knowledges of origin, cessation, and path, and by the knowledge of the path.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa gnyis gnyis dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya'o zhes 'byung na bstan bcos dang mi 'gal lam /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa gnyis gnyis dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya'o zhes 'byung na bstan bcos dang mi 'gal lam /
translated: Doesn't this contradict the treatise?

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the acceptances are the retinue of the knowledges.

original: dper na dmag mis rgyal na rgyal po rgyal po zhes rgyal po la 'dogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na dmag mis rgyal na rgyal po rgyal po zhes rgyal po la 'dogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when the army wins, the king is said to win, and the king is designated as the army.

original: don de dpes khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: don de dpes khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: This meaning should be understood through an example.

original: dper na mi gcig gis rkun po bzung nas phyung ba de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rkun po rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gog go //
analyzed: dper na mi gcig gis rkun po bzung nas phyung ba de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rkun po rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gog go //
translated: For example, just as one person seizes a thief and another person takes him outside, in the same way, the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma of suffering seizes the thief of affliction and stops it.

original: dper na mi cig shos kyis sgo bcad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mi cig shos kyis sgo bcad pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as another person closes the door,

original: chos shes pa la yang bral ba'i rnyed pa thob pas spangs pa rnams de'i rgyud la yang shin tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir gtan pa bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: chos shes pa la yang bral ba'i rnyed pa thob pas spangs pa rnams de'i rgyud la yang shin tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir gtan pa bzhin du gnas so //
translated: Also, when Dharma knowledge arises, the obtainment of freedom is obtained, and since the objects to be abandoned by that knowledge do not arise in its continuum, it is like a burnt seed.

original: de bzhin du rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bco brgyad kyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa skyes nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bco brgyad kyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: Similarly, when subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, the obtainment of the eighteen afflictions associated with the form and formless realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering is relinquished and ceases.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin pa dang / de'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin pa dang / de'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the level of equipoise and because it is its level.

original: sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa dag rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa gcig pus sel ba ltar @277a * //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa dag rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa gcig pus sel ba ltar @277a * //
translated: Just as the single perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering eliminates the afflictions of the higher realms,

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pas kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pas kyang de bzhin te /
translated: so too does subsequent knowledge.

original: ji ltar chos shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chos shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like Dharma knowledge.

original: bzhi po'i dag gis zhes bya ba ni skad gcig gnyis kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / gnyis kyis khams gong ma mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po'i dag gis zhes bya ba ni skad gcig gnyis kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / gnyis kyis khams gong ma mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “by means of the four” refers to the realization of the truth of suffering that pertains to the desire realm by means of two moments and the realization of the truth of suffering that pertains to the two higher realms by means of two moments.

original: mngon par mngon du'o //
analyzed: mngon par mngon du'o //
translated: The term “realization” means “to make evident.”

original: rtogs pa'i don thams cad ni shes pa'i don du grags so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don thams cad ni shes pa'i don du grags so //
translated: The term “to know” is well known to mean “to realize.”

original: des ni 'di'i spyi'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon du khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: des ni 'di'i spyi'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon du khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The general meaning of this passage is that the truth of suffering is realized.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la yang chos shes pa'i bzod pa yang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun gyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la yang chos shes pa'i bzod pa yang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun gyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: In the same way, the receptivity to the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to origination seizes the acquisition of the seven afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origination and then ceases.

original: kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
translated: The knowledge of the Dharma with regard to origination seizes the acquisition of the relinquishment of those very afflictions and then arises.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu gnyis kyi rnyed pa
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu gnyis kyi rnyed pa
translated: So too, in the form and formless realms, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is obtained when the twelve afflictions of the form and formless realms to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin arise.

original: nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: It ceases when the subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin arises.

original: kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag gi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag gi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is obtained when the freedom from those twelve afflictions arises.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun gyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bdun gyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: So too, when perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation arises, the obtainment of the seven afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation ceases.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba na rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba na rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
translated: Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation is obtained when freedom from those seven afflictions arises.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu gnyis kyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu gnyis kyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: So too, the acquisition of the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation ceases when the twelve afflictions of the form and formless realms to be abandoned by the path of seeing are acquired.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation arises when the obtainment of freedom from those twelve afflictions is acquired.

original: de bzhin du lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad kyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad kyi rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: So too, the acquisition of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of the path ceases when the eight afflictions of the desire realm to be abandoned by the path of seeing are acquired.

original: chos shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste skye'o //
translated: Dharma knowledge of the truth of the path arises when the obtainment of freedom from those eight afflictions is acquired.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams la yang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu bzhi ni lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams la yang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu bzhi ni lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnyed pa nas bzung ste 'gag go //
translated: So too, the acquisition of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path ceases when the fourteen afflictions of the form and formless realms to be abandoned by the path of seeing are acquired.

original: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas @277b bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba'i rnyed pa nas @277b bzung ste skye'o //
translated: The cognition of the subsequent class of the path is produced from the acquisition of the detachment from these same stages.

original: de la skad cig bco lnga ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la skad cig bco lnga ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: Fifteen moments are the path of insight.

original: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The moment of the cognition of the subsequent class of the path is included in the path of cultivation.

original: de la rim gyis bsgres pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rim gyis bsgres pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste /
translated: The sixteenth moment is the state of the approacher to the fruit of stream-entry.

original: de ltar thogs na srid pa bdun te /🔽lha'i nang du lan bdun /
analyzed: de ltar thogs na srid pa bdun te / lha'i nang du lan bdun /
translated: The stream-enterer is one who has seven rebirths at most.

original: mi'i nang du lan bdun no //
analyzed: mi'i nang du lan bdun no //
translated: Seven rebirths among the gods and seven rebirths among humans.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Buddhas do not appear, he obtains the state of a self-conquered one.

original: de nyid 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rnam pa bdun nam brgyad spangs na bden pa mngon par rtogs ma thag tu lan cig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral lam /
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rnam pa bdun nam brgyad spangs na bden pa mngon par rtogs ma thag tu lan cig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro // 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral lam /
translated: If, by means of the mundane path, he abandons seven or eight categories, immediately upon the clear understanding of the truths, he becomes a once-returner.🔽By means of the mundane path, he becomes detached from the realm of desire or from the first, second or third absorption.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral lam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral lam /
translated: By means of the supramundane path, he becomes detached from the fourth absorption.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral na bden par mngon par rtogs ma thag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral na bden par mngon par rtogs ma thag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: If one is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness, one is a nonreturner immediately after realizing the truth.

original: gang dag mngon par rtogs pa gcig pur smra ba de dag gi bsam pa btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag mngon par rtogs pa gcig pur smra ba de dag gi bsam pa btsal bar bya ste /
translated: Those who advocate a single realization should be questioned about their opinion.

original: gal te 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pa las bsams nas smras na ni rigs par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pa las bsams nas smras na ni rigs par bsam par bya ste /
translated: If they speak from the perspective of realizing the result, their opinion should be considered reasonable.

original: gang sdug bsngal mthong nas rnyed pa rgyun 'chad pa ni kun 'byung spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal mthong nas rnyed pa rgyun 'chad pa ni kun 'byung spangs pa'o //
translated: The cessation of acquisition through seeing suffering is the elimination of origin.

original: bral ba'i rnyed pa thob pa ni 'gog pa mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i rnyed pa thob pa ni 'gog pa mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The acquisition of separation is the realization of cessation.

original: lam mngon du gyur pa ni lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: lam mngon du gyur pa ni lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: The actualization of the path is the cultivation of the path.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par mthong bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par mthong bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes so //
translated: The full understanding of the truth of suffering is through seeing impermanence and so on.

original: ji ste mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa la bya na ni mi rigs par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ste mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa la bya na ni mi rigs par bsam par bya ste /
translated: If they speak from the perspective of the realization of seeing, their opinion should be considered unreasonable.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par phye ba khyim bdag bden pa rnams ni rim gyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par phye ba khyim bdag bden pa rnams ni rim gyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Fortunate One has distinguished the truths, saying: One penetrates the truths in order.

original: them skas kyi them pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: them skas kyi them pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He gives the example of a staircase.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: This path of insight is the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni lte ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni lte ba lta bu ste /
translated: Right speech, right action and right livelihood are like the hub of this wheel,

original: tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the members of morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu'o //
translated: Concentration is like the circumference.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa 'dren pa ni rtsibs lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa 'dren pa ni rtsibs lta bu'o //
translated: Right view, right thought, right effort and right mindfulness are like the spokes.

original: ci'i phyir 'khor lo rin po che 'di'i chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'khor lo rin po che 'di'i chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are these members similar to the precious wheel of the universal monarch?

original: dper na ni yul gzhan 'dor zhing gzhan gnon to //
analyzed: dper na ni yul gzhan 'dor zhing gzhan gnon to //
translated: The precious wheel of the universal monarch, when set in motion, does not stop, but moves to the east, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'di yang bar chad med pa'i lam gzhan 'dor zhing rnam par grol ba'i lam mngon sum du byed pas gnon to //🔽bden @278a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang bar chad med pa'i lam gzhan 'dor zhing rnam par grol ba'i lam mngon sum du byed pas gnon to // bden @278a * //
translated: So too, this path suppresses by abandoning other uninterrupted paths and manifesting the path of liberation.

original: pa la dmigs pa gzhan 'dor zhing gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa la dmigs pa gzhan 'dor zhing gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a wheel because it suppresses by abandoning other paths that focus on the truths.

original: ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed cing rgyal ba las gnas pa'i phyir 'khor lo rin po che dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed cing rgyal ba las gnas pa'i phyir 'khor lo rin po che dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a precious wheel because it conquers what is unconquered and maintains what is conquered.

original: dper na de ni grong dang grong rdal ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed cing rgyal la gnas so //
analyzed: dper na de ni grong dang grong rdal ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed cing rgyal la gnas so //
translated: For example, it conquers what is unconquered, such as towns and cities, and maintains what is conquered.

original: de bzhin du 'di yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag las ma rgyal ba las ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis rgyal bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag las ma rgyal ba las ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis rgyal bar byed de /
translated: So too, this path conquers what is unconquered by the uninterrupted path, such as the afflicted states of the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: de'i rnyed pa rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnyed pa rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it severs the acquisition of those states.

original: rgyal ba la ni gnas te /
analyzed: rgyal ba la ni gnas te /
translated: It maintains what is conquered

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rnyed pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rnyed pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path of liberation simultaneously arises with the acquisition of freedom from affliction.

original: 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir yang yin te /🔽dper na 'khor lo rin po che kha cig tu ni 'phar /
analyzed: 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir yang yin te / dper na 'khor lo rin po che kha cig tu ni 'phar /
translated: It is also ascending and descending,

original: kha cig tu ni 'bab bo //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'bab bo //
translated: for example, like the precious wheel that sometimes ascends and sometimes descends.

original: de bzhin du 'di yang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi 'og tu bar chad med pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyi 'og tu yang rnam par grol ba'i lam mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi 'og tu bar chad med pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyi 'og tu yang rnam par grol ba'i lam mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the path of liberation manifests after the uninterrupted path, and the uninterrupted path manifests after the path of liberation.

original: ci rigs su sbyar gyi go rims bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar gyi go rims bzhin du ma yin te /
