translated: They are applied as appropriate, not in order.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam mngon sum du 'gyur bas 'phar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam mngon sum du 'gyur bas 'phar ba'o //
translated: Ascending is due to the manifestation of the path of liberation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam mngon sum du 'gyur bas 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam mngon sum du 'gyur bas 'bab pa'o //
translated: Descending is due to the manifestation of the uninterrupted path.

original: yang na 'dod pa la sogs par bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa la sogs par bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, they are ascending and descending because they focus on the truths in the desire realm and so on.

original: de 'di ltar rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ni 'phar ba ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar rjes su rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ni 'phar ba ste /
translated: Ascending is due to subsequent perseverance and subsequent knowledge,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they focus on the form and formless realms.

original: de'i 'og tu chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ni 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ni 'bab pa ste /
translated: Then, by the receptivity and knowledge of the doctrine of the higher realms, one descends.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they focus on the desire realm.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di la yid 'byung ba yid la byed pa dang / shes rab kyi shas che ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rdo gshags pa'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di la yid 'byung ba yid la byed pa dang / shes rab kyi shas che ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rdo gshags pa'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: In this path of seeing, one abandons afflictions in the manner of breaking a bamboo, because one possesses the mental application of renunciation and the predominance of wisdom.

original: rab tu byed pa 'dir ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir gcig gis rim bzhin du bstan te /🔽dper na gzugs can dag dong ngo //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'dir ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir gcig gis rim bzhin du bstan te / dper na gzugs can dag dong ngo //
translated: In this treatise, one is taught in order by way of illustration.🔽For example, it is like saying, “The ones with form go.

original: rgyal mtshan can dag dong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan can dag dong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The ones with victory banners go.”

original: de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
translated: Thus, when one obtains the fruit of stream entry, one abandons the ten afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gzhung las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhung las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained in the treatise.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa bzhi 'dam du sbags pa'i tshul du bsdus nas chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa bzhi 'dam du sbags pa'i tshul du bsdus nas chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the realm of desire, the four defilements, attachment, anger, pride and ignorance, are like mud in which the defilements are submerged. They are distinguished as being weak-weak, etc.

original: @278b de dag gi gnyen po ni shes pa bzhi po sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa gang yang rung las nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: @278b de dag gi gnyen po ni shes pa bzhi po sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa gang yang rung las nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
translated: The four knowledges, the knowledge of suffering, of the origin of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, of the path, and the knowledge of the factors, the knowledge of the path, the conventional knowledge, which are the counteractives of these defilements, eliminate the defilements.

original: gang gis spong ba de nyid bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis spong ba de nyid bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the path of immediate succession and the path of liberation are the same.

original: rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spangs pa ni rigs su skye ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spangs pa ni rigs su skye ba ste /
translated: When three or four categories are abandoned, one is born in the family.

original: tshe'i lhag ma gnyis sam gsum lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe'i lhag ma gnyis sam gsum lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there remain two or three lives.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa drug pa spangs pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bring po'i chung ngu'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa drug pa spangs pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bring po'i chung ngu'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The seventh or eighth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun nam brgyad spangs pa ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun nam brgyad spangs pa ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rnam pa dgu pa ste chung ngu'i chung ngu spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /🔽yang 'jig rten 'dir mi 'ong bar de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa ste chung ngu'i chung ngu spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste / yang 'jig rten 'dir mi 'ong bar de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de ltar sa dang sar bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu rim gyis srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa'i bar gyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa la bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa skyes par gyur ba nyid rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sa dang sar bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu rim gyis srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa'i bar gyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa la bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa skyes par gyur ba nyid rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ste /
translated: The ninth type of affliction is abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The ninth type of affliction is

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir rdo rje dang mtshungs shing 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir rdo rje dang mtshungs shing 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a diamond, similar to a diamond, because it is the antidote to all the defilements.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa mang ste /🔽de la sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag nas bye brag gis sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa mang ste / de la sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag nas bye brag gis sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: There are many kinds of diamond-like concentration.🔽There are four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the origin, thirty-two aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation, and sixteen aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang / lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni rdo rje lta bu lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang / lam la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni rdo rje lta bu lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: The diamond-like concentration has fifty-two aspects: eight aspects of knowledge of the doctrine of cessation and the path, and four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the path.

original: gang dag sa'i bye brag gis lam tha dad pa de dag gi ltar nas bdun gyi lam la nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis lhag par bsnan rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag sa'i bye brag gis lam tha dad pa de dag gi ltar nas bdun gyi lam la nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis lhag par bsnan rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
translated: According to those who maintain that the path is differentiated by the stages, the vajra-like samadhi is the eighty-first, since it is superior to the twenty-eighth of the path of the seventh stage.

original: de dag thams cad 'dir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'dir rig par bya ste /
translated: All of these should be understood here.

original: 'phags pa'i lam chung ngu'i chung ngus nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po spong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam chung ngu'i chung ngus nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po spong ngo //
translated: The smallest of the small noble path abandons the greatest of the great aspects of the afflictions.

original: de la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'phags pa'i lam de ni che ba'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'phags pa'i lam de ni che ba'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The vajra-like samadhi is the antidote to the smallest of the small afflictions of the peak of existence, because that noble path is great.

original: de spangs na dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs na dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is abandoned, one becomes an arhat.

original: @279a * // 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir 'os pa'o //
analyzed: @279a * // 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir 'os pa'o //
translated: It is worthy because it is worthy of worship by all who possess attachment.

original: yang na dgra zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag ste /
analyzed: yang na dgra zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag ste /
translated: Or, enemies are the afflictions such as attachment.

original: de dag 'dis bcom pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dis bcom pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “worthy ones” because they have destroyed those.

original: 'bras bu bzhi po rnams zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir 'bras bu bzhi po dge sbyong gi 'bras bur 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi po rnams zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir 'bras bu bzhi po dge sbyong gi 'bras bur 'gyur /
translated: The four fruits. Why are the four fruits fruits of the spiritual life?

original: 'di lta ste dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The spiritual life is the noble eightfold path, which is included in the uninterrupted path.

original: de'i 'bras bu dag ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dag ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dag ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dag ste /
translated: The fruits of that are the fruits of the spiritual life.

original: de dag ni brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de dag ni brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: They are the eighty-nine.

original: de lta yin du zin kyang rnam pa lngas na rnam pa bzhir bzhag ste /
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang rnam pa lngas na rnam pa bzhir bzhag ste /
translated: Even though that is so, they are posited as four by way of five aspects:

original: zhugs pa'i lam bor ba dang / 'bras bu'i lam thob pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs zin pa rnams kyi bral ba'i thob par ro gcig tu yang thob pa dang / chos shes pa bzhi dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i lam bor ba dang / 'bras bu'i lam thob pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs zin pa rnams kyi bral ba'i thob par ro gcig tu yang thob pa dang / chos shes pa bzhi dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa bzhi ste /
translated: discarding the path of entry, obtaining the path of fruit, obtaining the obtainment of freedom of those who have already abandoned afflictions as one, and the four knowledges of the dharma and the four subsequent knowledges.

original: shes pa brgyad thob pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug yang bsgom pa la la ni mngon du byed la /🔽kha cig ni 'thob pa yod pas rnam pa 'dis na rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //🔽'bras bu de dag gi bar gyi lam la gnas pa rnams zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: shes pa brgyad thob pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug yang bsgom pa la la ni mngon du byed la / kha cig ni 'thob pa yod pas rnam pa 'dis na rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go // 'bras bu de dag gi bar gyi lam la gnas pa rnams zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa nyon mongs pa ma bcom pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa nyon mongs pa ma bcom pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa dag las rnam pa lnga'i bar dag spangs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa dag las rnam pa lnga'i bar dag spangs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: rnam pa bdun nam brgyad spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun nam brgyad spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Some manifest the eight knowledges and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.🔽Some cultivate

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: The first meditative concentration and above🔽

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dag ni dgra bcom pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dag ni dgra bcom pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: From the first meditation up to the vajra-like concentration, one is engaged in the realization of the state of an arhat.

original: de ltar de dag ni 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad yin te /🔽bzhi ni zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad yin te / bzhi ni zhugs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are eight noble persons.🔽Four are those engaged in the result.

original: bzhi ni 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ni 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
translated: Four are those who have attained the result.

original: rigs kyi bye brag gi sa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag gi sa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: There are six levels, distinguished by their lineage.🔽Those who are ordinary beings, but have sharp or dull faculties, are followers of faith on the fifteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i rigs can so so'i skye bo gang yin pa de gnyis mthong ba'i lam la sems kyi skad cig bco lnga rnams la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba can ni de dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can @279b yin pa'i
analyzed: dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i rigs can so so'i skye bo gang yin pa de gnyis mthong ba'i lam la sems kyi skad cig bco lnga rnams la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba can ni de dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can @279b yin pa'i
translated: They are followers of faith because they are by nature followers of faith.

original: phyir ro // yang na rjes su 'brang ba ni rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // yang na rjes su 'brang ba ni rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: Or, following is that which is followed.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Faith is that which is followed by followers of faith.

original: de de la yod pas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba can no //
analyzed: de de la yod pas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba can no //
translated: They have that, thus they are followers of faith.

original: gzhan gyi man ngag gis bden pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi man ngag gis bden pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they follow the truths by means of the instructions of another.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba can ni de chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba can te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba can ni de chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba can te /
translated: One who follows the teaching is one who follows the teaching because he follows the teaching.

original: rang gi rkyen gyi stobs kyis chos rnams la rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rkyen gyi stobs kyis chos rnams la rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he analyzes the teachings by the power of his own conditions.

original: de nyid bsgom pa'i lam la ni gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de nyid bsgom pa'i lam la ni gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: On the path of cultivation, he is as described in the treatise.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba ni dad pas mos pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba ni dad pas mos pa'o //
translated: One who is resolute in faith abandons the defilements to be abandoned by seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa spong bar shes rab kyis mos pa ni lta bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong bar shes rab kyis mos pa ni lta bas thob pa'o //
translated: One who is resolute in view abandons the defilements by means of wisdom.

original: de la bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i gang zag de dag ni phal che ste rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i gang zag de dag ni phal che ste rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the majority are included in the path of cultivation, such as stream-enterers.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni lnga'o //
translated: Those who are not free from attachment are five.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni dgu ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni dgu ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment are nine.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gsum la nyon mongs pa chung zhing lam che ba la la ni skyes ma thag tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rab tu bsgrims te nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gsum la nyon mongs pa chung zhing lam che ba la la ni skyes ma thag tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rab tu bsgrims te nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
translated: Those who attain nirvana with effort are those who abandon defilements with great exertion.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang bsgrims mi dgos par nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni gang bsgrims mi dgos par nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: Those who attain nirvana without effort are those who abandon defilements without exertion.

original: gyen du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gyen du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Those who go upstream are those who leap over, those who leap over half way, and those who are free from all attachment.

original: de la 'phar ba ni gang bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams nas bsam gtan dang por skyes pa las sngon goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan rnams 'dren par byed te 'og min tu skye'o //
analyzed: de la 'phar ba ni gang bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams nas bsam gtan dang por skyes pa las sngon goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan rnams 'dren par byed te 'og min tu skye'o //
translated: Those who leap over are those who, having fallen from the third absorption, are reborn in the first absorption and, through the power of previous practice, lead the absorptions to the peak of cyclic existence and are reborn in the summit of existence.

original: phyed du 'phar ba ni gang gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes nas gnas gzhan bar du bor te 'og min du skye ba'o //
analyzed: phyed du 'phar ba ni gang gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes nas gnas gzhan bar du bor te 'og min du skye ba'o //
translated: Those who go halfway are those who, having been born in the five pure abodes, skip over one abode and are born in Akaniṣṭha.

original: thams cad dang bral ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thams cad dang bral ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who go everywhere are of two types:

original: srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba dang / 'og min du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba dang / 'og min du 'gro ba'o //
translated: those who go to the peak of cyclic existence and those who go to Akaniṣṭha.

original: de la lhag mthong la spyod pa ni 'og min du song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: de la lhag mthong la spyod pa ni 'og min du song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Those who practice insight go to Akaniṣṭha and attain nirvāṇa.

original: zhi gnas la spyod pa ni srid pa'i rtse mor song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la spyod pa ni srid pa'i rtse mor song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Those who practice serenity go to the peak of cyclic existence and attain nirvāṇa.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni la la ni 'grub pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa dang / skye ba'i yul thob pa na ste /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni la la ni 'grub pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa dang / skye ba'i yul thob pa na ste /
translated: Those who attain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state are those who attain nirvāṇa after they have obtained the place of birth but before they have accomplished and manifested it.

original: mdo las me stag la sogs pa dpe gsum brjod pa @280a * //
analyzed: mdo las me stag la sogs pa dpe gsum brjod pa @280a * //
translated: As the sūtras say, they are like the three examples of sparks and so on.

original: bzhin no // gzugs med pa rnams su bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs par gang zag bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin no // gzugs med pa rnams su bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs par gang zag bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for those who attain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state, there are seven types of arhats in the formless realm.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la zad pa shes pa nas skad cig tha ma mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la zad pa shes pa nas skad cig tha ma mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is from the cognition of exhaustion up to the final moment of the arhat who is in the process of passing into nirvāṇa.

original: dbang po rtul po ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba ste ;
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba ste ;
translated: Those of dull faculty are liberated according to circumstances.

original: yul dang dus dang rkyen la ltos nas gang dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rkyen la ltos nas gang dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become arhats in dependence on place, time, and conditions.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is liberation not according to circumstances.

original: de nyid rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: That is of six types:

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa la mi g-yo ba dang / rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //🔽de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa la mi g-yo ba dang / rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no // de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni /
translated: those liable to complete degeneration, those liable to retrogress, those liable to guard, those who are steadfast, those liable to penetrate, and those of immutable nature.

original: gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa dang mi ldan pa dang / dbang po rtul ba'o //
analyzed: gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa dang mi ldan pa dang / dbang po rtul ba'o //
translated: Those liable to complete degeneration are those who are not respectful, not constant, and of dull faculty.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni gus par byed pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni gus par byed pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is subject to retrogressing is not endowed with respect.

original: rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can ni rtag tu byed pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can ni rtag tu byed pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is subject to protection is not endowed with constant practice.

original: bzhi pa ni gnyis dang ldan la dbang po rtul ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gnyis dang ldan la dbang po rtul ba'o //
translated: The fourth is endowed with both but is of dull faculties.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i skal ba can ni dbang po rno la gnyis ka dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i skal ba can ni dbang po rno la gnyis ka dang bral ba'o //
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating is of sharp faculties and is free from the two.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is unshakable is endowed with all.

original: de la gang zag lnga'i sems rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor ba dang 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag lnga'i sems rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor ba dang 'dod pa'o //
translated: The five persons have a liberation of thought which is occasional, in conformity with circumstances, and desired.

original: drug pa'i sems rnam par grol ba ni mi g-yo ba'i //
analyzed: drug pa'i sems rnam par grol ba ni mi g-yo ba'i //
translated: The sixth has a liberation of thought which is unshakable.

original: de la phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs na rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs na rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: When the eighty-eight anuśayas or proclivities are abandoned, one becomes a srota-āpanna or “stream-winner.”

original: de dag las rnam pa drug pa spangs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las rnam pa drug pa spangs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: When six of these are abandoned in addition, one becomes a sakṛd-āgāmin or “once-returner.”

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: When the five fetters which are low are abandoned, one becomes an anāgāmin or “non-returner.”

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fetter that is not noble?

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: It is will for pleasure, malice, the belief in the individual, the belief in the extremes, and doubt.

original: gal te rim gyis ltar na sngar ni gsum spangs la phyis ni kun du sbyor ba gnyis so //
analyzed: gal te rim gyis ltar na sngar ni gsum spangs la phyis ni kun du sbyor ba gnyis so //
translated: If one abandons them gradually, one first abandons three fetters, and later the two fetters.

original: ji ste 'dod chags dang bral la sngar mthong ba'i lam du zhugs na ni /
analyzed: ji ste 'dod chags dang bral la sngar mthong ba'i lam du zhugs na ni /
translated: If one enters the path of insight detached from the realm of desire,

original: sngar kun du sbyor ba gnyis spangs te /
analyzed: sngar kun du sbyor ba gnyis spangs te /
translated: one first abandons the two fetters,

original: phyis gsum mo //
analyzed: phyis gsum mo //
translated: and later the three.

original: de la kun du sbyor ba gnyis ni lcags sgrog lta bu ste phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de la kun du sbyor ba gnyis ni lcags sgrog lta bu ste phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro//
translated: The two fetters are like shackles, because one is not a non-returner.

original: @280b dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
analyzed: @280b dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
translated: The noble ones are the best.

original: dam pa ma yin pa ni dam pa ma yin pa ste ngan pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa ni dam pa ma yin pa ste ngan pa'o //
translated: The non-noble ones are the worst.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: It is the realm of desire.

original: de nyid cha ste khams gsum du bgrangs nas cha'i sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid cha ste khams gsum du bgrangs nas cha'i sgrar bstan to //
translated: That itself is a part, because it is counted as a realm. The word “part” is taught.

original: de dang mthun pa ni dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa ni dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The factors that are in conformity with it are the factors that are in conformity with the unwholesome.

original: de'i dam pa ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na ;
analyzed: de'i dam pa ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na ;
translated: What is unwholesome about them?

original: mdo sde tshad mar yod pa'i phyir te /🔽sems pa ngan pa la rnam par shes pa gnas te /
analyzed: mdo sde tshad mar yod pa'i phyir te / sems pa ngan pa la rnam par shes pa gnas te /
translated: Because the sutras are authoritative.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i srid pa la'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i srid pa la'o zhe'o //
translated: The sutras say: “The consciousness of those who have bad thoughts remains in the existence of the desire realm.🔽In the same way, it remains in the existence of the form realm and the formless realm.”

original: ci'i phyir gcig tu bgrang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gcig tu bgrang zhe na /
translated: Why are they counted as one?

original: spong ba'i grangs kyi phyir te /
analyzed: spong ba'i grangs kyi phyir te /
translated: Because of the number of abandonments.

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs na dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs na dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: When the afflictions of the three realms are abandoned, one becomes an arhat.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of formations that are associated with the mind has been explained.

original: gal te phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pa rgyun du zhugs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pa rgyun du zhugs pa yin na /
translated: If one who has abandoned the eighty-eight proclivities is a stream-enterer,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs par bstan pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs par bstan pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: why did the Bhagavān teach that one who has abandoned the three fetters is a stream-enterer?

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: 'di sgo gcig dang / sgo gnyis dang / sgo bzhi pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'di sgo gcig dang / sgo gnyis dang / sgo bzhi pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: This is because the afflictions are taught as being of one door, two doors, and four doors.

original: nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they illustrate the root.

original: yang na rtsa ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na rtsa ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, they are roots because

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta bu'o //
translated: the view of the transitory collection is the root of the extreme views.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices is the root of the esteeming of views.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: Wrong views are rooted in doubt.

original: yang na de dag nyid thar pa la rab tu bar chad byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de dag nyid thar pa la rab tu bar chad byed pa ste /
translated: Or else, they are roots because they are the principal obstacles to liberation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de la 'jig tshogs la lta bas ni 'gro mi 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de la 'jig tshogs la lta bas ni 'gro mi 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: The Lord has said, “One who has the view of the transitory collection does not desire to go,

original: bar chad kyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad kyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is obstructed by the view of the transitory collection.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i lam mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i lam mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: is the path of the Sāṃkhyas and others,

original: des dag par 'gyur du re bas lam nor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des dag par 'gyur du re bas lam nor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because one hopes for purification through that path, and one goes astray.

original: the tshom gyis ni yid gnyis za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni yid gnyis za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Doubt causes hesitation.

original: dper na mi zhig lam du zhugs te 'gro ba la bar chad gsum yod de /
analyzed: dper na mi zhig lam du zhugs te 'gro ba la bar chad gsum yod de /
translated: For example, a person who has set out on a road has three obstacles:

original: le lo dang / nor pa dang / yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: le lo dang / nor pa dang / yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: laziness, error, and doubt.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood here.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga gang yin pa de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i rgyun la yod de /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga gang yin pa de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i rgyun la yod de /
translated: The five factors that are favorable to the higher realms are present in the stream of the non-returner:

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //🔽mi ldan pa rnams kyi skabs @281a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o // mi ldan pa rnams kyi skabs @281a * //
translated: attachment to the form realm, attachment to the formless realm, agitation, conceit, and ignorance.

original: su bab po //
analyzed: su bab po //
translated: The factors that are not present are now discussed.

original: de dag kyang 'thob pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'thob pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are also attainment, etc.

original: bstan bcos las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las byung ba rnams so //
translated: They are mentioned in the treatise.

original: chos 'di dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di dag ni de dag kyang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos 'di'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di dag ni de dag kyang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos 'di'o //
translated: They are factors because they are endowed with this factor.

original: 'di zhes bya ba thams cad kyi ming 'dis ni de'i yongs su grub pa nyid dang byed pa'i rgyu nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba thams cad kyi ming 'dis ni de'i yongs su grub pa nyid dang byed pa'i rgyu nyid du ston to //
translated: The word this indicates their perfected nature and their causal nature.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽

original: des nges par bsnyad pa la'o //
analyzed: des nges par bsnyad pa la'o //
translated: because it is definitely stated by that.

original: bsnyad par nges pa ni nges par bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: bsnyad par nges pa ni nges par bsnyad pa ste /
translated: The definite statement is the definite statement.

original: 'dis bsnyad par 'gyur bas bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis bsnyad par 'gyur bas bsnyad pa ste /
translated: Because it is stated by this, it is the statement.

original: bsnyad pa gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa yod pa'i phyir 'byung ste de ni 'grel pa las ston to //
analyzed: bsnyad pa gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa yod pa'i phyir 'byung ste de ni 'grel pa las ston to //
translated: That which is stated arises because of the existence of attainment. That is taught in the commentary.

original: 'di na ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba na'o //
analyzed: 'di na ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba na'o //
translated: Here means in saṃsāra.

original: gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gsum las 'khrul pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gsum las 'khrul pa med pa ste /
translated: The word “undoubtedly” is from the three, without error.

original: 'di ltar gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gor ma chag ces bya ba snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gor ma chag ces bya ba snyegs so //
translated: Thus, the word “undoubtedly” is supplied by “without a doubt.

original: gsum po dag gang la gor ma chag pa srid ce na /
analyzed: gsum po dag gang la gor ma chag pa srid ce na /
translated: ” In regard to the three, where is there a possibility of doubt?

original: sems can du bgrang ba'i chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba'i chos rnams la'o //
translated: In regard to phenomena that are counted as sentient beings.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang sems can du bgrang ba nyid la ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang sems can du bgrang ba nyid la ste /
translated: Cessation through deliberation and cessation not through deliberation are also just counted as sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the afflictions of sentient beings is cessation through deliberation.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is absent in the case of the cessation due to deliberation.

original: des na rang gi rgyud dang 'brel pa rnams dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i 'thob pa dang 'thob pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang gi rgyud dang 'brel pa rnams dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i 'thob pa dang 'thob pa med pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is the acquisition and non-acquisition of the factors that are related to one's own stream, of the cessation due to deliberation and of the cessation not due to deliberation.

original: nam mkha' dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po la ni gnyi ga med par dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po la ni gnyi ga med par dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: In the case of space and of the factors that are not capable of being taken as objects, both are absent.

original: de la dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: de la dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa ston to //
translated: The wholesome factors are faith, etc. The words, etc., indicate vigor, etc.

original: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa ston to //
translated: The unwholesome factors are attachment, etc. The words, etc., indicate hatred, delusion, etc.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sems la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sems la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba la sogs pa ston to //
translated: The non-defined factors are the mind that is capable of creating magical creations, etc. The words, etc., indicate the mind that is the ripening of previous action, etc.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni sngar bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni sngar bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “those” refers to what was mentioned previously.

original: gang dag la zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zag rnams dang sbyar te dge ba smos pas zag pa rnams las 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag la zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zag rnams dang sbyar te dge ba smos pas zag pa rnams las 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “those who” refers to the persons, because the word “virtuous” indicates that they are those who are elevated above the contaminants.

original: de dag ni gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni gang zag rnams so //
translated: These are the persons.

original: chos 'di dang ldan pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'i yon @281b tan dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos 'di dang ldan pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'i yon @281b tan dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “endowed with this quality” means that they are endowed with the qualities of faith, etc.

original: de dag gi dngos po ni chos nyid dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po ni chos nyid dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase “the reality of those” means that they are endowed with reality.

original: chos 'di dang ldan pa'i nges par bsnyad pa'i rgyu'i chos gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa ste /🔽rnyed pa dang ldan zhes kyang bya'o zhes bya ba de la skad cig dang po la ni thob pa dang 'thob pa dang rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dang ldan pa'i nges par bsnyad pa'i rgyu'i chos gang yin pa de ni 'thob pa ste / rnyed pa dang ldan zhes kyang bya'o zhes bya ba de la skad cig dang po la ni thob pa dang 'thob pa dang rnyed pa'o //
translated: The quality that is the cause for their being described in this way is their attainment.🔽The phrase “they are endowed with attainment” means that they are endowed with acquisition.🔽Attainment, acquisition, and endowment are synonymous equivalents.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni ldan pa dang rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni ldan pa dang rnyed pa'o //
translated: Attainment is of two types: initial attainment and subsequent attainment.🔽Initial attainment is the first attainment of a quality that has not previously been attained.🔽Subsequent attainment is the attainment of a quality that has been previously attained.

original: de bas na bye brag tu smra ba las kyang ldan pa gang yin pa de thob pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bye brag tu smra ba las kyang ldan pa gang yin pa de thob pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, even the Vaibhāṣikas say, “That which is possession is also obtainment.

original: thob pa nyid la yin la ldan pa ma yin pa yang yod de thog ma'i thob byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: thob pa nyid la yin la ldan pa ma yin pa yang yod de thog ma'i thob byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: Obtainment itself is possession, but there is also possession that is not obtainment, such as the initial obtainment.”

original: de med du zin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de med du zin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that did not exist,

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thob pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thob pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: the term that refers to that is applied to obtainment.

original: thob pa med na 'di ltar sa bon med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa med na 'di ltar sa bon med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If obtainment did not exist, then seeds would not exist.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni gang dag 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni gang dag 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams so //
translated: Āryas who abide in the entanglement of attachment and so on are ārya persons who are not free of attachment.

original: kun nas dkris te 'dug pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris te 'dug pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Entanglement is the manifest state of attachment and so on.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems med pas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur na zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems med pas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur na zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Because they do not have a noncontaminated mind means that when affliction is manifest, a noncontaminated mind is not manifest.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are mutually exclusive.

original: dge slong dag sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud ni re re 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud ni re re 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “Monks, the mindstreams of sentient beings arise individually.”

original: 'phags pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ring ba'o //🔽byis pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ring ba'o // byis pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “They would not be āryas” means they would be far from being āryas.

original: byis pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo rnams te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo rnams te /
translated: “Fools” means ordinary beings.

original: dge ba'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon du 'gyur ba med pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i ngo bo yang khas mi len pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon du 'gyur ba med pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i ngo bo yang khas mi len pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not assert that desire realm beings who possess virtuous minds and indeterminate minds have manifest desire realm attachment and so on and that they have minds that are concomitant with attachment and so on, it would follow that they would be āryas.

original: 'dra na ni zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra na ni zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa ste /
translated: “If they were similar” means if they were the same.

original: 'dra ba smos pa ni 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba smos pa ni 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term “similar” is applied to āryas and ordinary beings.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams la ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thob pa med do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams la ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thob pa med do //
translated: Ordinary beings do not have the obtainment of nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams la yang med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams la yang med do //
translated: Āryas do not have it either because they have not abandoned affliction.

original: khyod kyis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you do not accept it.

original: de la ni 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ni 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, it would be like this:

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa'i khyad par gyis der 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa'i khyad par gyis der 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would be so by the distinction of abandoning or not abandoning the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa de'i mngon rtags su gyur pa'i chos gzhan dgos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa de'i mngon rtags su gyur pa'i chos gzhan dgos so //
translated: It is necessary to have another phenomenon that is a sign of the abandonment or non-abandonment of the defilements.

original: sa bon ni sngar bkag pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: sa bon ni sngar bkag pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The seed has already been refuted.

original: @282a * // ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: @282a * // ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: The term unmixed refers to liberation.

original: thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The term will be liberated means that they will also be liberated.

original: rigs pas 'thob pa bstan nas da ni lung gzhan gyis ston te /
analyzed: rigs pas 'thob pa bstan nas da ni lung gzhan gyis ston te /
translated: Having explained the attainment through reasoning, now it is taught through another scripture.

original: chos kyi rjes kyang zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mda' brnyes pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni chos kyi rje'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes kyang zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mda' brnyes pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni chos kyi rje'o //
translated: The term also of the Lord of Dharma means that because the Blessed One has attained everything, he is the Lord of Dharma.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la mi slob pa'i chos bcu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la mi slob pa'i chos bcu po gang zhe na /
translated: The term these ten dharmas of no-more-learning means: What are the ten dharmas of no-more-learning?

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' de la zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' de la zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang /
translated: The right view, right thought, right speech and right action of the nonlearner are the abandonment of speech and action that arise from aversion and delusion.

original: las kyi mtha'i sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi mtha'i sgrar bstan to //
translated: The right view, right thought, right speech, and right action of the non-learner are taught by the words right speech and right action, respectively, because they abandon speech and action that arise from hatred and ignorance.

original: chags pa las byung ba rnam pa bdun spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa las byung ba rnam pa bdun spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i sgrar bstan to //
translated: The right livelihood of the non-learner is taught by the word right livelihood, because it abandons the seven types of wrong livelihood that arise from attachment.

original: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chags pa'i chos sbyang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i chos sbyang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to purify the phenomena of attachment.🔽The verse says:🔽It is difficult for householders to purify views,

original: rtag tu sna tshogs lta ldan gyi //
analyzed: rtag tu sna tshogs lta ldan gyi //
translated: which always possess various views.

original: khyim pas lta ba sbang bar dka' //
analyzed: khyim pas lta ba sbang bar dka' //
translated: It is difficult for monks to purify livelihood,

original: gzhan la rag las 'tsho ba yi //🔽dge slong gis ni 'tsho sbyang dka' //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las 'tsho ba yi // dge slong gis ni 'tsho sbyang dka' //
translated: which depends on others for life.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the seven types of wrong livelihood that arise from attachment are taught by the word right livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Right knowledge and right liberation are twofold:

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas ni mos pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni mos pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The conditioned is of the nature of resolve.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is nirvana.

original: 'dir ni 'dus ma byas yan lag nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dus ma byas yan lag nyid du bstan to //
translated: Here, the unconditioned is taught as a member.

original: slob pa la rnam par grol ba yod du zin kyang de ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol ba yin gyi /
analyzed: slob pa la rnam par grol ba yod du zin kyang de ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol ba yin gyi /
translated: Even though one in training has liberation, it is liberation by nature,

original: rgyud rnam par grol ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud rnam par grol ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but not liberation of the stream,

original: rgyud ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the stream is bound by the afflictions to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: mi slob pa ni ngo bo nyid dang rgyud rnam par grol ba'i phyir yan lag nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni ngo bo nyid dang rgyud rnam par grol ba'i phyir yan lag nyid du bstan to //
translated: One beyond training is taught as a member because of liberation by nature and liberation of the stream.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: Right knowledge is knowledge of elimination and knowledge of nonarising.

original: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of these two have already been explained.

original: bskyed pa dang 'thob byed dang ldan zhes bya ba'i sgra de dag gis brjod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang 'thob byed dang ldan zhes bya ba'i sgra de dag gis brjod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: The terms “that which is generated,” “that which is obtained,” and “that which is possessed” are used to express these two.

original: yan lag lnga spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams te /
analyzed: yan lag lnga spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dam pa ma yin pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams te /
translated: The phrase “having abandoned five branches” refers to the five fetters that are associated with inferior states.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i @282b phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i @282b phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga ni khams gong ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga ni khams gong ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five fetters that are associated with higher states are abandoned because he is free from attachment to the higher realms.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan te mngon par shes pa drug go zhes rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan te mngon par shes pa drug go zhes rgya cher bshad do //
translated: He possesses six branches, which are the six kinds of supernatural knowledge.

original: yang gang zag 'di ni chos dge ba rnams dang mi dge ba rnams dang yang ldan no zhes kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba ni thob pa de nyid do //
analyzed: yang gang zag 'di ni chos dge ba rnams dang mi dge ba rnams dang yang ldan no zhes kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba ni thob pa de nyid do //
translated: The phrase “this person is also possessed of virtuous and nonvirtuous qualities” refers to the very same obtainment.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyun la dge ba'i thob pa bsags pa dpag tu med pa dag gzigs nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyun la dge ba'i thob pa bsags pa dpag tu med pa dag gzigs nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sutra says, “having seen the immeasurable accumulation of the attainment of virtue in the mindstreams of sentient beings.

original: dpag tu med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they immeasurable?

original: skad cig gcig la thob pa dang / chos dang thob pa'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la thob pa dang / chos dang thob pa'i thob pa'o //
translated: Attainment is obtained in one moment, and the attainment of the dharma and attainment of attainment.

original: de la thob pa skyes nas chos dang thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la thob pa skyes nas chos dang thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When attainment arises, one possesses the dharma and the attainment of attainment.

original: thob pa'i thob pa skyes nas thob pa nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa'i thob pa skyes nas thob pa nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When the attainment of attainment arises, one possesses attainment.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la ni thob pa gsum dang rjes su thob pa gsum mo //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la ni thob pa gsum dang rjes su thob pa gsum mo //
translated: In the second moment, there are three attainments and three subsequent attainments.

original: de bzhin du skad cig phyi ma phyi ma la rnam par 'phel bas rdzas tha dad pa mtha' yas pa dang skye'o //🔽de yang rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so thob pa med pa ni ma rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig phyi ma phyi ma la rnam par 'phel bas rdzas tha dad pa mtha' yas pa dang skye'o // de yang rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so thob pa med pa ni ma rnyed pa ste /
translated: In the same way, in later and later moments, they increase and arise as infinite different substances.🔽Attainment is of two types.

original: dper na thob pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thob pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan lta bu'o //
translated: Attainment that is not obtained is like the qualities of the absorptions and so on that arise from attainment.

original: rnam par nyams pa ni sngon btang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa ni sngon btang ba ste /
translated: Degenerated attainment is previously relinquished.

original: dper na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams nas yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob pa dag skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams nas yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob pa dag skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one regresses from freedom from attachment to the desire realm, one again obtains the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: de nyid rnyed nas skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnyed nas skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Obtaining that, the second moment and so on is called possession.

original: de las bzlog pa ni thob pa med pa ste snga nas med pa'i rnyed pa med cing nyams pa'i rnyed pa yang med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni thob pa med pa ste snga nas med pa'i rnyed pa med cing nyams pa'i rnyed pa yang med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is nonobtainment, which should be understood as the nonobtainment of that which has not previously existed and the nonobtainment of that which has degenerated.

original: thob pa dang thob pa med pa de gnyis kyang rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i chos rnams nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa ma yin pa dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa rnams kyi yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa dang thob pa med pa de gnyis kyang rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i chos rnams nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa ma yin pa dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa rnams kyi yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Both obtainment and nonobtainment are of phenomena that exist in one's mindstream, not of those that exist in the mindstreams of others or of those that are not sentient beings.

original: ci thams cad kyi nges pa 'di yin nam /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyi nges pa 'di yin nam /
translated: Is this rule definite for all?

original: de'i phyir spyir btang ba byas nas dmigs rtsom ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyir btang ba byas nas dmigs rtsom ste /
translated: Therefore, having made a general statement, he composes this chapter.

original: so sor dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba la brtags pa dang 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: so sor dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba la brtags pa dang 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar te /
translated: The terms “deliberation” and “cessation” are applied separately to each of the two kinds of cessation.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog par shes par bya'o //
translated: Cessation through deliberation and cessation not through deliberation should be understood.

original: de gnyis kyang rgyu la mi gnas pa'i phyir logs shig tu smos so //🔽sems can du bgrang ba ma @283a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang rgyu la mi gnas pa'i phyir logs shig tu smos so // sems can du bgrang ba ma @283a * //
translated: They are mentioned separately because they do not exist in the same place.

original: ma yin pa ni sa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa ni sa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “not in the case of what is counted as a sentient being” refers to earth, etc.

original: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i chos de dag dang ldan pa su yang med do //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i chos de dag dang ldan pa su yang med do //
translated: There is no one who possesses those dharmas called “possession.”

original: nam mkha' dang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “nor in the case of space” refers to possession.

original: gang gi phyir de dag dang mi ldan pa de'i phyir de rnams kyi thob pa dang thob pa med pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag dang mi ldan pa de'i phyir de rnams kyi thob pa dang thob pa med pa med do //
translated: Since they do not possess those dharmas, they do not have possession or non-possession.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pa su zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pa su zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the Abhidharma states: “Who possesses the uncontaminated dharmas?

original: sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad do //
translated: All sentient beings.

original: gang dang zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang zhe na /
translated: With what?

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ngo //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ngo //
translated: and cessation not due to deliberation.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang ldan pa su zhe na /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang ldan pa su zhe na /
translated: Who possesses cessation due to deliberation?

original: 'phags pa thams cad dang / so so'i skye bo kha cig go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad dang / so so'i skye bo kha cig go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: All noble ones and some ordinary worldlings.

original: gang yang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa dang ldan par tha snyad btags pa de dang der ldan pa'i sgra ni dbang la bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa dang ldan par tha snyad btags pa de dang der ldan pa'i sgra ni dbang la bya'o //

original: de la thob pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la thob pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Obtainment is like a shadow that accompanies an action.🔽Obtainment is like a shadow that accompanies an action.🔽Obtainment is like a shadow that accompanies an action.🔽Obtainment is like a shadow that accompanies an action.🔽Obtainment is like a shadow that accompanies an action.

original: grib ma rjes su 'brang ba lta bu dang / khyu mchog gi rjes su 'brang ba lta bu dang / be'u rjes su 'brang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: grib ma rjes su 'brang ba lta bu dang / khyu mchog gi rjes su 'brang ba lta bu dang / be'u rjes su 'brang ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: de ni grib ma lta bur rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can no // gzhan yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
