original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi nyid de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi nyid de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise simultaneously with those neutral factors.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni nyam chung ba'i phyir sngar dang phyis skye ba med do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni nyam chung ba'i phyir sngar dang phyis skye ba med do //
translated: Neutral factors are weak and do not arise either previously or subsequently.

original: gnyis pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is as follows:

original: gong nas zhes bya ba la gong ma'i sgra ni gzugs kyi khams dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gong nas zhes bya ba la gong ma'i sgra ni gzugs kyi khams dang sbyar ro //
translated: Above, i.e., in the realm of form, there is no intermediate existence.

original: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang shi 'phos pa de nyid du bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang shi 'phos pa de nyid du bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: Because the intermediate existence is actualized in the very place where one dies.

original: phyi rol gyi sa bon dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa bon dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is similar to an external seed.

original: gang du sa bon btab pa de nyid du myu gu skye'o //
analyzed: gang du sa bon btab pa de nyid du myu gu skye'o //
translated: A sprout arises from a seed in the very place where the seed is planted.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba la sogs pa dad pa la sogs pa dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa skyes nas thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba la sogs pa dad pa la sogs pa dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa skyes nas thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: At the moment of conception, the wholesome factors of the realm of desire, etc., are faith, etc., and the unwholesome factors are attachment, etc.

original: dper na khyu mchog ni ba'i tshogs kyi mdun du 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na khyu mchog ni ba'i tshogs kyi mdun du 'gro'o //
translated: For example, the leader of a herd of cattle goes in front.

original: de bzhin du thob pa rnams sngar skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thob pa rnams sngar skye'o //
translated: In the same way, the acquisitions of the first two wisdoms arise first.

original: gsum pa ni 'di lta ste thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba la tshogs pa rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'di lta ste thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba la tshogs pa rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams dang sbyar ro //
translated: The third is as follows: “The acquisitions of the wisdoms born of hearing, etc., arise together with the wisdoms born of hearing, etc., and with their own acquisitions.

original: de la skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab la brten nas thos @283b pa las byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: de la skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab la brten nas thos @283b pa las byung ba skye'o //
translated: ” The wisdom born of hearing arises in dependence on the wisdom acquired at birth.

original: thos pa las byung ba la brten nas bsams pa las byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba la brten nas bsams pa las byung ba skye'o //
translated: The wisdom born of reflection arises in dependence on the wisdom born of hearing.

original: bsams pa las byung ba la brten nas bsgoms pa las byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba la brten nas bsgoms pa las byung ba skye'o //
translated: The wisdom born of meditation arises in dependence on the wisdom born of reflection.

original: ming la brten nas don go ba ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ming la brten nas don go ba ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The wisdom born of hearing is the understanding of the meaning in dependence on the name.

original: ming dang don la dmigs pa ni bsams pa las byung ba ste /🔽ched 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren to //
analyzed: ming dang don la dmigs pa ni bsams pa las byung ba ste / ched 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren to //
translated: The wisdom born of reflection has as its object both the name and the meaning.🔽Sometimes the meaning is inferred from the name.

original: ched 'ga' ni don gyis yi ge 'dren to //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni don gyis yi ge 'dren to //
translated: Sometimes the name is inferred from the meaning.

original: de la dmigs pa kho na ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa kho na ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The wisdom born of meditation has only that as its object.

original: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par don la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par don la 'jug go //
translated: It is not dependent on the letters, but engages the meaning.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa dang / de ltar byung ba gang yin pa de bkol te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa dang / de ltar byung ba gang yin pa de bkol te /
translated: Except for the innate, means that which is innate to the Dharma that arises from hearing, etc. and that which occurs in that way.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: The other, which is not that, is future.

original: dper na be'u ma'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na be'u ma'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: For example, it should be understood like the calf that follows after the cow.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams la'o //
translated: In that, means in the obtainments.

original: mdor bstan na zhes bya ba ni mdor bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan na zhes bya ba ni mdor bshad pa'o //
translated: In brief, means in brief explanation.

original: 'dod pa smos pas gzugs na spyod pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa smos pas gzugs na spyod pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By mentioning the desire realm, the form realm is excluded.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba smos pas ni 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba smos pas ni 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By mentioning the virtuous and nonvirtuous, the form of the great elements is excluded.

original: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi ni lhan cig skyes pa ste de ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi ni lhan cig skyes pa ste de ltar byung ba'o //
translated: The innate and that which occurs in that way is the indicative form of the vows, the nonvows, and the opposite of both.

original: phyi nas skyes pa ni 'das pa'i ste /
analyzed: phyi nas skyes pa ni 'das pa'i ste /
translated: The past is that which arose previously.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //🔽tshe phyi mas yang tshe phyi ma pa ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin no // tshe phyi mas yang tshe phyi ma pa ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: The future is not.🔽That which is not of the future would be of the future.

original: tshe phyi ma pa ma yin pa yang tshe phyi ma par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma pa ma yin pa yang tshe phyi ma par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not of the future would be of the future.

original: de ltar bye brag tu byas na rnam par smin pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bye brag tu byas na rnam par smin pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having made this distinction, the obtainment of other forms, such as that arisen from the cause of karmic maturation, is established as being simultaneous.

original: ci lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi nges pa 'di yin nam /
analyzed: ci lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi nges pa 'di yin nam /
translated: Is this rule for all neutral phenomena?

original: smras pa ma yin te //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te //
translated: No, it is not.

original: mngon par shes pa'i sems dang sprul pa'i sems ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i sems dang sprul pa'i sems ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the mind of supernatural power and the mind of emanation.

original: de la mngon par shes pa gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: Two of the six supernatural powers are neutral:

original: lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba'o//
analyzed: lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba'o//
translated: the divine eye and the divine ear.

original: sprul pa'i sems kyang yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems kyang yin no //
translated: The mind of emanation is also neutral.

original: sprul pa'i sems de dag kyang bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems de dag kyang bcu bzhi ste /
translated: There are fourteen minds of emanation.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa la sprul pa'i sems gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa la sprul pa'i sems gnyis te /
translated: There are two minds of emanation belonging to the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The first absorption is of two types: of the stage of the first absorption and of the realm of desire.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa la gsum mo //🔽bsam gtan @284a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa la gsum mo // bsam gtan @284a * //
translated: The second absorption is of three types.

original: gsum pa'i sa pa la bzhi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i sa pa la bzhi'o //
translated: The third absorption is of four types.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa la lnga'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa la lnga'o //
translated: The fourth absorption is of five types.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gi thob pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gi thob pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the possession of these superknowledges past and future?

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba'i khyad par las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba'i khyad par las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are obtained through the power of the special preparatory practice.

original: bzo'i gnas las kyang cung zad yin te shin tu goms pa'o //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas las kyang cung zad yin te shin tu goms pa'o //
translated: They are also slightly innate, but not in a state of absorption.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: lha'i bu las sna tshogs pa dang / lha ma yin shes ldan no //
analyzed: lha'i bu las sna tshogs pa dang / lha ma yin shes ldan no //
translated: the son of the gods Viśvakarman and the asura

original: spyod lam pa yang yin te /
analyzed: spyod lam pa yang yin te /
translated: They are also of the stage of correct spiritual practice.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / 'di lta ste /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rta thul lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / 'di lta ste / tshe dang ldan pa rta thul lo //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the venerable Aśvajit

original: de'i thob pa ni 'das pa dang de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i thob pa ni 'das pa dang de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'o ;
translated: The possession of these superknowledges is past, present, and future.

original: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thob pa ni dus gsum ste /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thob pa ni dus gsum ste /
translated: The possession of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is of the three times.

original: dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense-faculties are sharp there.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas gzhan thams cad kyi ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas gzhan thams cad kyi ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The form that is arisen from the cause of retribution and the form that is the deportment and all other forms that are the form of craftsmanship are all innate.

original: bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs kyi ni bsgrib pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs te tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs kyi ni bsgrib pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs te tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na'o //
translated: The form that is the form of the action of obscuration is the form of the action of obscuration in the world of Brahma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis dris na ma shes la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis dris na ma shes la /
translated: When the Venerable Aśvajit was asked about it, he did not know.

original: de 'khor dang 'brel pa'i phyir g-yo byas te lag pa gnyis nas bzung nas byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de 'khor dang 'brel pa'i phyir g-yo byas te lag pa gnyis nas bzung nas byung bar gyur te /
translated: He was embarrassed, so he took the two hands of the questioner and left.

original: de'i g-yo las byung ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs so ;
analyzed: de'i g-yo las byung ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs so ;
translated: The form that is the form of the action of deception arises from deception.

original: / ci'i phyir de lhan cig skyes pa yin zhe na mthu chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ci'i phyir de lhan cig skyes pa yin zhe na mthu chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it innate? Because it is weak.

original: ci'i phyir mthu chung ba nyid yin zhe na sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mthu chung ba nyid yin zhe na sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it weak? Because the application is weak.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs med ce na /
translated: Why is there no form that is the form of the action of obscuration in the realm of desire?

original: kun nas slong ba po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas slong ba po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no instigator.

original: 'di na 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni bsgribs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di na 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni bsgribs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the afflicted view of the self and the extreme views are obscured.

original: de gnyis ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba por mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba por mi 'gyur te //
translated: These two do not instigate indicative form,

original: de gnyis nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage their objects by turning inward.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa'i sems kyis ni rnam par rig byed bskyed do //🔽gal te de lta na log par lta ba las log par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa'i sems kyis ni rnam par rig byed bskyed do // gal te de lta na log par lta ba las log par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The mind that turns outward generates indicative form.🔽If that is so, then how can one interpret the scriptural passage:

original: log par rtog pas log pa'i tshig smra'o //🔽log pa'i tshig las log pa'i las kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: log par rtog pas log pa'i tshig smra'o // log pa'i tshig las log pa'i las kyi mtha'o //
translated: From wrong view, wrong thought arises.🔽From wrong thought, wrong speech arises.🔽From wrong speech, wrong action arises.

original: log pa'i las kyi mtha' las log pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar sbyar /
analyzed: log pa'i las kyi mtha' las log pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar sbyar /
translated: From wrong action, wrong livelihood arises.

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: rgyu 'byung ba @284b ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu 'byung ba @284b ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The arising of a cause is twofold:

original: rgyu 'byung ba dang de'i skad cig la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'byung ba dang de'i skad cig la 'byung ba'o //
translated: the arising of a cause and the arising of that in the present moment.

original: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rgyu kun nas slong ba ste /
analyzed: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rgyu kun nas slong ba ste /
translated: The mind that is to be abandoned by the path of vision is the cause of instigation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it instigates the mind that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni rgyu kun nas slong ba dang / de'i skad cig la kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni rgyu kun nas slong ba dang / de'i skad cig la kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: The mind that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation is the cause of instigation and the instigator in that moment.

original: de ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de brjod pa'i phyir de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de brjod pa'i phyir de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this explanation, because it is a succession of one after another.

original: lhag ma gang zhe na sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gang zhe na sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
translated: What is the remainder? It is the virtuous and nonvirtuous mental factors.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni so sor dus gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni so sor dus gsum pa'o //
translated: The past, future, and present ones have three times each.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yang go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yang go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du'o //
translated: The virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral ones are respectively virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: de la dge ba rnams kyi rnyed pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba rnams kyi rnyed pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: The acquisition of the virtuous is virtuous.

original: mi dge ba rnams kyi ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams kyi ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: The acquisition of the nonvirtuous is nonvirtuous.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of neutral factors is neutral.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of factors belonging to the realm of desire is of the realm of desire.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi ni gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi ni gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of factors belonging to the realm of form is of the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of factors belonging to the formless realm is of the formless realm.

original: dri ma med pa ni khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa ste lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni dri ma med pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa ste lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni dri ma med pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The obtainment of pure factors is of the three realms and is also pure. Pure factors are the truth of the path and the unconditioned.

original: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of non-analytical cessation is of the three realms.

original: 'di'i ni 'di ltar rkyen med pa'i phyir thob bo //
analyzed: 'di'i ni 'di ltar rkyen med pa'i phyir thob bo //
translated: Because there is no condition for it, it is obtained.

original: rkyen med pas de yang khams gsum car na srid do //
analyzed: rkyen med pas de yang khams gsum car na srid do //
translated: Since there is no condition for it, it exists in all three realms.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lam gyis 'thob pa'i ni der gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lam gyis 'thob pa'i ni der gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The obtainment of analytical cessation obtained by the path of form and the formless realm belongs to those realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: It is the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi thob pa dang lam gyi bden pa'i zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi thob pa dang lam gyi bden pa'i zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the acquisition of the uncontaminated path and the uncontaminated truth of the path.

original: gong ma rnam pa lnga ni mdor bsdu na khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma rnam pa lnga ni mdor bsdu na khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The higher five types are, in brief, the three realms.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis mdor bsdu na zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis mdor bsdu na zag pa med pa'o //
translated: These two types, in brief, are uncontaminated.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o ;
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o ;
translated: And that means acquisition.

original: / bsdu na zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: / bsdu na zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu ba'o //
translated: In brief means in summary.

original: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Four types means four types.

original: khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa'o //🔽slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba de la slob pa rnams kyi ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa'o // slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba de la slob pa rnams kyi ni slob pa'o //
translated: The three realms and the uncontaminated.🔽Those of the learner and post-learner are the learner's,

original: mi slob pa rnams kyi ni mi slob pa'o //🔽slob pa yang @285a * //🔽ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams kyi ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyi ni mi slob pa'o // slob pa yang @285a * // ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams kyi ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: the post-learner's, and the neither-learner-nor-post-learner's.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i chos de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those phenomena that are neither learner nor post-learner?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams te bslab pa gsum la mi slob pa'i phyir ro //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa slob pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽mi slob pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams te bslab pa gsum la mi slob pa'i phyir ro // mya ngan las 'das pa slob pa zhes bya ba'am / mi slob pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They are associated with the contaminants because they do not train in the three trainings.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: Nirvana is called “that which is to be trained in” or “that which is not to be trained in” or “that which is neither to be trained in nor not to be trained in.”🔽The treatise declares:

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ngo //
translated: It is neither to be trained in nor not to be trained in.

original: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the result of separation.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa de thams cad ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa de thams cad ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i thob pa'o //
translated: All that is associated with the contaminants, all unanalytical cessations, all analytical cessations obtained by the mundane path, and all uncontaminated states obtained by the mundane path are obtained by that which is neither to be trained in nor not to be trained in.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: Those obtained by the learner and nonlearner paths are obtained by the learner and nonlearner.

original: slob pa'i lam gyis so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'thob pa ni rigs na /
analyzed: slob pa'i lam gyis so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'thob pa ni rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable that the path of learning obtains analytical cessation.🔽But how does the nonlearner obtain analytical cessation?

original: mi slob pas go so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ji ltar 'thob /🔽des kyang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: mi slob pas go so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ji ltar 'thob / des kyang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa 'thob ste /
translated: The nonlearner also obtains analytical cessation.🔽One obtains the obtainment of the obtainment of separation from the four times.

original: dus bzhi po dag na bral ba'i thob pa'i rnyed pa thob pa rnyed de /🔽de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi bral ba'i thob pa'i rnyed pa ni dus bzhi po dag na'o //
analyzed: dus bzhi po dag na bral ba'i thob pa'i rnyed pa thob pa rnyed de / de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi bral ba'i thob pa'i rnyed pa ni dus bzhi po dag na'o //
translated: The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing is obtained in the four times.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni dus gsum po dag na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni dus gsum po dag na'o //
translated: The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in three times.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the form and formless realms is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.

original: gzugs na spyod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi dgra bcom pa'i dus na'o //🔽gang bar ma do'i spong ba de ni 'bras bu'i lam gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi dgra bcom pa'i dus na'o //🔽gang bar ma do'i spong ba de ni 'bras bu'i lam gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in the time of an arhat.🔽The obtainment of separation from objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that occur in the desire realm is obtained in

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / de dang ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / de dang ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i thob pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the eighty-eight negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the feeling and so on concomitant with them.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa bcu po dag dang de dag dang ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa'i sems dang / gang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa de dag thams cad kyi ni bsgom pas spang @285b bar bya ba'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa bcu po dag dang de dag dang ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa'i sems dang / gang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa de dag thams cad kyi ni bsgom pas spang @285b bar bya ba'i thob pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation is the ten afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, the feeling and so on concomitant with them, the maturational resultant, the minds governing demeanor, creativity, emanation and all virtuous contaminated minds.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That which is not to be abandoned is also twofold:

original: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni bsdus te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni bsdus te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The obtainment of the cessation not attained by the āryas and the cessation attained by the mundane path is subsumed by the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: dri ma med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //🔽de ni 'thob pa med pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o // de ni 'thob pa med pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The acquisition of cessation should be explained.

original: de'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of cessation should be explained.

original: thob pa med pa ni thams cad kyang nyon mongs pa can ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa med pa ni thams cad kyang nyon mongs pa can ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Cessation is not to be acquired, for it is not defiled and is not determined.

original: dge ba ma yin te dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba ma yin te dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not wholesome, for the wholesome roots are not cut off when the wholesome roots are cut off.

original: dge ba'i thob pa med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i thob pa med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the acquisition of the wholesome exists.

original: mi dge ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not unwholesome,

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la thob pa med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la thob pa med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the acquisition of the unwholesome does not exist when one is free from the attachment of the realm of desire.

original: mi dge ba'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would possess unwholesome factors.

original: de'i phyir thob pa med pa de ni thob pa bzhin du bye brag mang du med de rnam pa'i khyad par du ma med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thob pa med pa de ni thob pa bzhin du bye brag mang du med de rnam pa'i khyad par du ma med do //
translated: Therefore, the non-acquisition is not distinguished in many ways like the acquisition, that is, it does not have many specific modes.

original: 'on kyang zhig pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhig pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: However, the so-called disintegrated state is a past phenomenon.

original: de ltar gyi dus las rab tu zhig pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus las rab tu zhig pa'i phyir ro // ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams te /
translated: The past is called “disintegrated” because it has disintegrated from the time of the present.

original: de ltar gyi dus su ma phyin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar tshogs na gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu 'byin gyi rdzas kyi 'bras bu ni ma yin no //🔽de la 'das pa spangs pa rnams kyi thob pa med pa ni dus gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus su ma phyin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar tshogs na gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu 'byin gyi rdzas kyi 'bras bu ni ma yin no // de la 'das pa spangs pa rnams kyi thob pa med pa ni dus gsum pa'o //
translated: The future is called “not yet arisen” because it has not yet come into the present.🔽The present is called “enduring” because it is the time of enduring.🔽The obtainment of past and future states that have been abandoned is in the three times.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa ma phyin pa rnams kyi yang dus gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa ma phyin pa rnams kyi yang dus gsum pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of future states that have not been abandoned is in the three times.

original: de ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni dus gnyis pa ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni dus gnyis pa ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of present states is in two times, the past and present.

original: de yang lung du ma bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang lung du ma bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the obtainment of uncontaminated states is neutral.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa rnams kyi ni so sor khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa rnams kyi ni so sor khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of desire realm, form realm, and formless realm states is in the three realms respectively.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi khams gsum pa ni de la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i yon tan ma thob pa rnams kyi dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral bas ma thob pa gzugs na spyod pa'i skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyi dang /🔽thos pa las byung ba rnams kyi dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams kyi dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyi dang / bsgoms pa las @286a * //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi khams gsum pa ni de la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i yon tan ma thob pa rnams kyi dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral bas ma thob pa gzugs na spyod pa'i skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyi dang / thos pa las byung ba rnams kyi dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams kyi dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyi dang / bsgoms pa las @286a * //
translated: The three realms of those belonging to the desire realm are: those who have not obtained the qualities of hearing and reflection, those who have not obtained freedom from attachment, those who obtain through birth in the form realm,

original: byung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: those who obtain through hearing, those who obtain through cultivation, those who obtain through birth in the formless realm, and those who obtain through cultivation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gang zag ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gang zag ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams dang yang ldan no //
translated: A person in the desire realm possesses afflicted phenomena of the three realms.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i gang zag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i gang zag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, a person born in the form realm does not possess the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: dbang po rtul po yang dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa'i dge ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po yang dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa'i dge ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The weak faculties are not associated with the wholesome roots of the sharp faculties.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyang bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyang bsgoms pa las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The wholesome roots acquired through birth in the formless realm are not associated with those acquired through meditative development.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod par yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod par yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the formless realm in accordance with its nature.

original: khams gsum pa'i de ni ngo bo nyid du na gang du skyes pa de nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i de ni ngo bo nyid du na gang du skyes pa de nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The wholesome roots of the three realms are, by their very nature, associated with the realm in which one is born.

original: chos kyi gnas kyi dbang gis ni khams gsum par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos kyi gnas kyi dbang gis ni khams gsum par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established as belonging to the three realms by the power of the realm of phenomena.

original: thob pa med pa la ni dri ma med pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: thob pa med pa la ni dri ma med pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no uncontaminated wholesome root that is not acquired.

original: gal te yod pa lta na zag pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te yod pa lta na zag pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyid du 'gyur ro // so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: If there were, one would be associated with uncontaminated dharmas and would be an ārya.🔽What is the nature of an ordinary person?

original: so so'i skye bo nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is an ordinary person?

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba de la /
translated: He has not obtained the noble qualities.

original: 'phags pa'i chos ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar dag ste /
translated: The noble qualities are from the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering up to the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de dag ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ma thob pa'o //
translated: He has not obtained those.

original: de dag kyang rigs gsum gyi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos ni rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyun dang mi ldan pas de so so'i skye bor 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de dag kyang rigs gsum gyi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos ni rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyun dang mi ldan pas de so so'i skye bor 'gyur ba /
translated: Since they are not endowed with the lineage of the śrāvaka, pratyekabuddha, and tathāgata, the śrāvaka āryas would become ordinary beings.

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa yang so so'i skye bo yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa yang so so'i skye bo yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Similarly, the pratyekabuddha and tathāgata would become ordinary beings.

original: de ni thob pa med pas gang ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thob pa med pas gang ma thob pa'o //
translated: Since they do not obtain those, they are not obtained.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra brjod dgos so //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra brjod dgos so //
translated: The term “itself” must be stated.

original: mi dgos te tshig gcig gis bsnan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mi dgos te tshig gcig gis bsnan pa yang yod de /
translated: It is not necessary, for sometimes one term is added.

original: dper na chu za rlung za zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu za rlung za zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying “one who eats water” and “one who eats wind.”

original: gang dag rgyun la 'phags pa'i chos ma skyes pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid du 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na rgyun la 'phags pa'i chos 'byung ba las 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyun gzhan med de /
analyzed: gang dag rgyun la 'phags pa'i chos ma skyes pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid du 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na rgyun la 'phags pa'i chos 'byung ba las 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyun gzhan med de /
translated: Those who assert that the state of an ordinary being is the nonarising of arya dharmas in the mindstream assert that the state of an ordinary being is not different from the mindstream in which arya dharmas arise.🔽

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir de dag nyid so so'i skye bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir de dag nyid so so'i skye bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who assert that the state of an ordinary being is the nonarising of ārya dharmas in the continuum would reply that the state of an ordinary being is not different from the arising of ārya dharmas in the continuum because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: ji ste ma skyes pa tsam rdzas med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste ma skyes pa tsam rdzas med pa yin na ni /
translated: If the mere nonarising of ārya dharmas is a nonthing,🔽then that contradicts the sutra that states:

original: de lta na go mdo las dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni sdig pa'i las mi byed pa @286b ci yang med do zhes nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta na go mdo las dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni sdig pa'i las mi byed pa @286b ci yang med do zhes nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: Monks, I say that there is nothing that a foolish ordinary being who is not learned does not do.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes ma yin nam 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes ma yin nam 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: But isn't it said that the state of an ordinary being is unobscured neutral?

original: dper na seng ge ma bsgribs shing lung du ma bstan pa'i phug tu gnas te /
analyzed: dper na seng ge ma bsgribs shing lung du ma bstan pa'i phug tu gnas te /
translated: There is no fault because, for example, a lion dwells in an unobscured neutral cave.

original: srog chags rnams la gnod par byed pa de bzhin du so so'i skye bo nyid la gnas te sdig pa dag rtsom mo //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la gnod par byed pa de bzhin du so so'i skye bo nyid la gnas te sdig pa dag rtsom mo //
translated: Just as animals harm one another, so too, ordinary worldlings, while remaining in the state of ordinary worldling, commit evil.

original: thob pa med pa de ni chos gang gis thob pa med pa de'i de rnyed nas rnam par nyams so //
analyzed: thob pa med pa de ni chos gang gis thob pa med pa de'i de rnyed nas rnam par nyams so //
translated: The state of ordinary worldling is not obtained by any path whatsoever.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid khams gsum pa ni 'phags pa'i chos thob nas rnam par nyams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid khams gsum pa ni 'phags pa'i chos thob nas rnam par nyams so //
translated: The state of ordinary worldling of the three realms is lost by obtaining the noble quality.

original: phyi rol gyi lam gyis ni gong du skyes nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lam gyis ni gong du skyes nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams te /
translated: The state of ordinary worldling of the realm of desire is lost by being born in a higher realm.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas spong ngo //🔽de bas na bye brag tu smra ba las kyang 'phags pa ni sngar so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams la phyis spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas spong ngo // de bas na bye brag tu smra ba las kyang 'phags pa ni sngar so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams la phyis spong ngo //
translated: The state of ordinary worldling of the realm of desire is lost by being detached from the realm of desire.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say that the noble ones lose the state of ordinary worldling first, and then abandon it.

original: so so'i skye bo ni sngar so so'i skye bo nyid spangs la phyis rnam par nyams so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni sngar so so'i skye bo nyid spangs la phyis rnam par nyams so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Ordinary worldlings first abandon the state of ordinary worldling, and then lose it.

original: de la thob pa bcad pa ni rnam par nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de la thob pa bcad pa ni rnam par nyams pa'o //
translated: The loss of acquisition is called “falling away.”

original: chos bcad pa ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos bcad pa ni spangs pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the factors is their abandonment.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The attainment of non-perception should be explained.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la 'du shes med pas na 'di ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la 'du shes med pas na 'di ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o ;
translated: It is called the attainment of non-perception because there is no perception in this attainment.

original: / yang na 'du shes med par snyoms par 'jug pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / yang na 'du shes med par snyoms par 'jug pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the attainment of non-perception because one enters into non-perception.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from attachment to the third meditation means free from attachment to the third meditation by being free from attachment to the third meditation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni 'bras bu che bas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni 'bras bu che bas bsdus pa ste /
translated: The fourth meditation is included in the great fruit.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba rnams so //
translated: It is the wholesome factors of thought and thought concomitants.

original: de dag ni mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos te de dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos te de dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: They are the factors that are incompatible with the entry of thought and thought concomitants immediately after them, i.e. they are not associated with them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir sems dang mi mthun pa'i sems 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang mi mthun pa'i sems 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: because a mental factor that is incompatible with mind does not occur.

original: 'di ltar rgyu zad pas 'jig pa'am mi mthun pa'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu zad pas 'jig pa'am mi mthun pa'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir grang na /
translated: If it is asked why, it is because it is destroyed by the exhaustion of its cause or because a condition that is incompatible with it exists.

original: rgyu zad pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu zad pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: The exhaustion of the cause is not logical,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because meditative attainment is contaminated.

original: sems dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen yod pa yang mi 'thad do //🔽de chung @287a * //
analyzed: sems dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen yod pa yang mi 'thad do // de chung @287a * //
translated: The existence of a condition that is incompatible with it is also not tenable.

original: ba'am khyad par can zhig tu 'byung grang na chung ba ni nyam chung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: ba'am khyad par can zhig tu 'byung grang na chung ba ni nyam chung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa mi skyed do //
translated: If it is asked whether it occurs as small or special, small does not generate incompatibility because it is weak.

original: khyad par can ni rigs 'dra ba'i phyir dngos po mi skyed de /
analyzed: khyad par can ni rigs 'dra ba'i phyir dngos po mi skyed de /
translated: Special does not generate a thing because it is similar to its type.

original: dper na me lce bdag nyid 'gag par mi byed de bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na me lce bdag nyid 'gag par mi byed de bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, the flame of a fire does not extinguish itself, because it is contradictory for it to act on itself.

original: de bas na 'gal ba'i chos gzhan gang gis dus gzhan na mi skye ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba'i chos gzhan gang gis dus gzhan na mi skye ba thob pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is meditative attainment that obtains non-arising at another time by another incompatible phenomenon.

original: de snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: That is meditative attainment.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad 'gag go //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad 'gag go //
translated: All mental factors and all thoughts cease.

original: ci'i phyir 'du shes kyi sgo nas bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du shes kyi sgo nas bstan ce na /
translated: Why is it taught from the point of view of ideation?

original: 'du shes gzhig pa'i phyir de skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes gzhig pa'i phyir de skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced in order to destroy ideation.

original: mdo sde las kyang 'du shes ni nad lta bu'o //🔽'du shes ni 'bras lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang 'du shes ni nad lta bu'o // 'du shes ni 'bras lta bu'o //
translated: A sūtra says, “Ideation is like a disease,🔽like a tumor,

original: 'du shes ni gsal shing lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni gsal shing lta bu'o //
translated: like a sword, like an arrow.

original: de ltar 'du shes med pa de ni zhi ba'o //🔽de ni gya nom pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes med pa de ni zhi ba'o // de ni gya nom pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The absence of ideation is peace,🔽it is excellence.

original: dpes ston te /
analyzed: dpes ston te /
translated: ” It is taught by way of example.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the knowledge of the mind of another.

original: de yang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is also wholesome and contaminated,

original: yid du 'ong ba'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces a pleasant existence.

original: rdzas med pa ni dge ba nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rdzas med pa ni dge ba nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to be wholesome and insubstantial.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That which is included in the fourth absorption is the nature of the fourth absorption,

original: sa de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the maturational result of that level.

original: 'phags pa'i rgyud ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rgyud ma yin no //
translated: It is not the continuum of an ārya.

original: ci'i phyir de 'phags pa'i rgyud la med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'phags pa'i rgyud la med ce na /
translated: Why is it not in the āryas’ mindstreams?

original: de'i phyir 'thad pa gzhan brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thad pa gzhan brjod de /
translated: To explain this, another reason is stated:

original: byis pa thar pa'i 'du shes can dag de skyed de /
analyzed: byis pa thar pa'i 'du shes can dag de skyed de /
translated: Fools who have the notion of liberation generate it.

original: 'phags pa dag ni srid pa las 'byung ba'i 'du shes can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ni srid pa las 'byung ba'i 'du shes can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Āryas do not have the notion of emerging from existence,

original: srid pas srid pa las mi 'byung ba dang thar pa dang thar pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pas srid pa las mi 'byung ba dang thar pa dang thar pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they directly perceive existence, nonemergence from existence, liberation, and the path to liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it obstructs the ārya path,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni de ngan song gi gnas lta bur dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni de ngan song gi gnas lta bur dgongs pa'o //
translated: the āryas consider it to be like a place of rebirth in the lower realms.

original: de'i phyir de thob pa ni nges par gyur pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de thob pa ni nges par gyur pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, one who attains it does not enter the state of definite goodness.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa la myong bar nges pas 'di ni myong bar 'gyur bas nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa la myong bar nges pas 'di ni myong bar 'gyur bas nges pa ste /
translated: This is definite in terms of experience because it is certain that its karmic maturation will be experienced.

original: gdon mi za bar 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it definitely produces its result,

original: 'dis ni 'di'i myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid spong ngo //
translated: this passage explains that it is definite in terms of experience.🔽This passage explains that it is indefinite in terms of experience.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba nyid de dus gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba nyid de dus gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is experienced after rebirth, not at another time.

original: 'dis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin gyi 'phen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin gyi 'phen pa ma yin te /
translated: It is perfected by this, but it is not projected,

original: sems med pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems @287b dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i bdag nyid du 'du shes med ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa myong ba de skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i phyir ro // sems @287b dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i bdag nyid du 'du shes med ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa myong ba de skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: because it is devoid of mind.🔽The result of the meditative development of the meditative development of the attainment of cessation is experienced after rebirth, i.e. it is experienced in the next rebirth.

original: 'dis ni 'di'i lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba spong ngo //
translated: This meditative development is relinquished through the attainment of the result of the once-returner, since it is relinquished through the acquisition of the spiritual level that is free from attachment to the sense-desire realm.

original: 'di ni 'bad pas 'thob kyi zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i stobs kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bad pas 'thob kyi zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i stobs kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is attained through effort, i.e. it is accomplished through the power of application.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis 'thob pa ma yin te ma goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis 'thob pa ma yin te ma goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not attained through the absence of attachment, i.e. it is not attained merely through the absence of attachment to the third meditative absorption, because it is not cultivated.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pas na 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pas na 'gog pa'o //
translated: The attainment of cessation is so called because of cessation.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni dgag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni dgag par bya ba'o //
translated: The mental factors and the mind are to be stopped.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdzas yin te snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas des ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yang dag par 'gag ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdzas yin te snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas des ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yang dag par 'gag ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is a substance, because by that substance of meditative attainment, the mind and mental factors are completely stopped in the future.

original: 'byung ba mi rnyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung ba mi rnyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that they are not found.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness means free from attachment to the third formless realm.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi sa pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi sa pa'o //
translated: The summit of existence means the level of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: ji ltar na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: How can it be a meditative attainment without mind?

original: smras pa / 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du byed pas so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du byed pas so //
translated: It is said: Because it makes the great elements equal.

original: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid ni gcig tu mkhregs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid ni gcig tu mkhregs par gyur pa ste /
translated: The equality of the great elements is the single state of solidity.

original: de'i phyir rdo rjes kyang shigs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rjes kyang shigs par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be destroyed even by a diamond.

original: je phra je phra nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems kyi 'og tu rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: je phra je phra nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems kyi 'og tu rnyed pa yin te /
translated: It is found below the mind of the summit of existence, having become progressively more subtle.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo pa ste dge ba dang skye gnas pa dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo pa ste dge ba dang skye gnas pa dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is called the summit of existence, which is virtuous, the birthplace, and not definitely experienced in a future life.

original: dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is virtuous and contaminated.

original: skyes nas myong ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: skyes nas myong ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can no //
translated: That experienced after rebirth is that of a non-returner who does not regress.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi'o //
translated: That experienced in a future life is that of a non-returner who regresses.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung bas skyo nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir de la 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung bas skyo nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir de la 'jug ste /
translated: In order to abide happily in this life means that, having become weary due to the arising of mind and mental factors, one enters that meditative attainment in order to abide happily in this life.

original: bde ba 'thob par bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa snyoms par @288a * //
analyzed: bde ba 'thob par bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa snyoms par @288a * //
translated: The yogi enters into meditative attainment in order to obtain happiness.

original: 'jug go // de med pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug go // de med pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because of the absence of that” refers to the absence of the noble path.

original: chad kyis 'jigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la thar pa'i 'du shes med pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'gog pa la byis pa dag chad par sems te skrag go //
analyzed: chad kyis 'jigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la thar pa'i 'du shes med pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'gog pa la byis pa dag chad par sems te skrag go //
translated: “Because of the fear of annihilation” means that because they do not have the notion of liberation, the foolish fear the cessation of mind and mental activities, thinking that it is annihilation.

original: chos gzhan zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa tsam la 'du shes med pa par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: chos gzhan zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa tsam la 'du shes med pa par mi 'dod do //
translated: The phrase “another factor” indicates that they do not consider the mere cessation of mind and mental activities to be the state of composure without conception.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bus btags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bus btags pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “arisen from the cause of retribution” means that the result is designated by the name of the cause.

original: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la rnam par smin pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la rnam par smin pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Here, the cause of retribution is referred to by the word “retribution.”

original: de las byung ba ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from it is “arisen from the cause of retribution.”

original: de nyid dpyad pa'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid dpyad pa'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to analyze that, he says: “the maturational result of the meditative attainment of non-perception.”

original: bsam gtan dang po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “One part of the first meditative concentration” means

original: bsam gtan thog ma'i phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan thog ma'i phyogs gcig ste /
translated: one part of the first meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i phyogs gcig nyid la bsam gtan khyad par can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i phyogs gcig nyid la bsam gtan khyad par can zhes bya'o //
translated: One part of the first meditative concentration is called the “special meditative concentration.”

original: 'du shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'du shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the perception.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i dus las gzhan gyi dus na'o //🔽yun ring du gnyid kyi sa log pa las langs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i dus las gzhan gyi dus na'o // yun ring du gnyid kyi sa log pa las langs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: “At other times” means at times other than the time of death and rebirth.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di las langs pa rnams kyi bya ba mi gsal bar ston to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di las langs pa rnams kyi bya ba mi gsal bar ston to //
translated: “Like one who has arisen from a long sleep” shows that the activity of those who have arisen from this meditative attainment is unclear.

original: 'dod pa'i khams rnams su skye ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir der skyes pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams rnams su skye ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir der skyes pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show the cause of birth in the desire realm, he says: “for those born there.”

original: 'bras bu che ba rnams su skyes pa rnams la lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba rnams su skyes pa rnams la lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they have karma to be experienced in a third life.

original: te zhes bya ba ni de lan grangs kyang yin la gzhan yang yin pas lan grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: te zhes bya ba ni de lan grangs kyang yin la gzhan yang yin pas lan grangs gzhan no //
translated: The term “third” means another life.

original: de 'dod pa yang yin la lan grangs gzhan na myong bar 'gyur ba yang yin pas 'dod par gtogs pa lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa yang yin la lan grangs gzhan na myong bar 'gyur ba yang yin pas 'dod par gtogs pa lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is desire realm karma to be experienced in a third life because it is desire realm karma and it is karma to be experienced in a third life.

original: tshe gnyis la sogs pa na spyod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshe gnyis la sogs pa na spyod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is karma to be experienced in the second life and so on.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'dod pa'i khams su rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'dod pa'i khams su rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage indicates that karma to be experienced in the desire realm is projected in the desire realm.

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of life force?

original: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is life force in the three realms.

original: khams rnam pa gsum ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: khams rnam pa gsum ni khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The three types of realms are the three realms.

original: @288b 'gro ba'i phyir tshe zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @288b 'gro ba'i phyir tshe zhes bya ste /

original: shin tu myur du 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu myur du 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that they proceed very quickly.

original: ji skad du tshe'i 'du byed ni lha'i bu 'gro ba'i snying po can rnams kyi shugs pas kyang ches myur du 'gag go zhes mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du tshe'i 'du byed ni lha'i bu 'gro ba'i snying po can rnams kyi shugs pas kyang ches myur du 'gag go zhes mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sngon gyi las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshe rabs snga ma dag na las gang byas pa des 'phags pa ni bskyod de btang ba'o //

analyzed: de gang zhe na /

analyzed: skye mched drug po mig la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i sgra ni srog gi dbang por bstan to //
translated: Here, the term “maturation” refers to the faculty of life force.

original: rigs pas srog gi dbang po rdzas su yod par bstan par 'dod nas srog gi dbang po ma gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rigs pas srog gi dbang po rdzas su yod par bstan par 'dod nas srog gi dbang po ma gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate by reasoning that the faculty of life force is a real entity, the root text states, “apart from the faculty of life force.”

original: dbang po gzhan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “other faculties” refers to the eye faculty, etc.

original: de dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams na med pa'i phyir khams gsum pa la khyab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams na med pa'i phyir khams gsum pa la khyab pa ma yin no //
translated: These faculties are not universal in the three realms because they are not present in the formless realm.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po khams gsum pa la khyab pa yin du zin kyang nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba na de dag med pa'i phyir tshe'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa ma yin no //🔽tshe ni khams gsum pa la'ang khyab pa la skye ba rgyun mi @289a * //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po khams gsum pa la khyab pa yin du zin kyang nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba na de dag med pa'i phyir tshe'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa ma yin no // tshe ni khams gsum pa la'ang khyab pa la skye ba rgyun mi @289a * //
translated: Even though the faculties of faith, etc., are universal in the three realms, they are not the cause for the uninterrupted continuation of life because they are not present in all states of mind, such as those that are afflicted.

original: 'chad par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Life force is universal in the three realms and is the cause for the uninterrupted continuation of birth.

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang po gzhan dag las don gzhan rdzas su yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang po gzhan dag las don gzhan rdzas su yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is a real entity that is distinct from the other faculties.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs la dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs la dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those born in the formless realm, etc. means that the virtuous mind is manifest, such as faith, etc.

original: bsgribs pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The obscured mind is manifest, such as the mind of attachment, etc.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ni srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ni srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The uncontaminated mind of a lower level is manifest, such as the uncontaminated mind of the base of nothingness level of one born in the peak of cyclic existence.

original: 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu'i chos nyid 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu'i chos te srog gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu'i chos nyid 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu'i chos te srog gi dbang po'o //
translated: The reality that is the cause of designating migration is the cause of designating migration, which is the faculty of life force.

original: med du zin na zhes bya ba ni gal te srog gi dbang po med par gyur na de'i tshe gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dge ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na 'jig pa dang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med du zin na zhes bya ba ni gal te srog gi dbang po med par gyur na de'i tshe gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dge ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na 'jig pa dang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, then at the time of the virtuous, etc. states of the formless realm, it would follow that there would be death and birth.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / de'i rgyun 'chad pa gnyis kyis skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba brtag par nus la /🔽gzugs med pa na ma yin pas de'i phyir gzugs med pa brjod do /🔽// / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / de'i rgyun 'chad pa gnyis kyis skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba brtag par nus la / gzugs med pa na ma yin pas de'i phyir gzugs med pa brjod do / // / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
translated: One can investigate birth and death through the two: obtaining the body faculty and so on in the desire and form realms and the cessation of its continuum.

original: bam po lnga pa ste tha ma /🔽skal pa mnyam pa nyid ni sems can rnams kyi don gcig la 'dod pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /🔽sems can rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems can zhes brjod pa ma yin pa rtsa la sogs pa sel to //🔽de ni don kyang yin la gcig kyang yin pas don gcig ste /🔽de ni bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bam po lnga pa ste tha ma /🔽skal pa mnyam pa nyid ni sems can rnams kyi don gcig la 'dod pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /🔽sems can rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems can zhes brjod pa ma yin pa rtsa la sogs pa sel to //🔽de ni don kyang yin la gcig kyang yin pas don gcig ste /🔽de ni bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: But this is not so in the formless realm, and therefore the formless realm is described.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The cause of desire is homogeneity.

original: de la brten pa mthun pa ni skal ba mnyam pa ste spyod pa mthun pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa mthun pa ni skal ba mnyam pa ste spyod pa mthun pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Homogeneity of support is the similarity of the nature of the activity of those who have the same support.

original: de'i dbang po ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid de 'gro ba gcig tu skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus dang dbang po dang dbyibs dang spyod pa dang kha zas la sogs pa 'dra ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid de 'gro ba gcig tu skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus dang dbang po dang dbyibs dang spyod pa dang kha zas la sogs pa 'dra ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the similarity of the faculties is homogeneity. It is the cause of the similarity of the bodies, faculties, shapes, activities, food, etc. of sentient beings who are born in the same destiny.

original: phan tshun mngon par dga' ba 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / bdag la chags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la sred pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun mngon par dga' ba 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / bdag la chags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la sred pa'o //
translated: Mutual affection is the meaning of the term “affinity.” Attachment to self is craving for the self.

original: kha zas ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha zas ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of food:🔽morsel food, contact, mental volitions, and consciousness.

original: kham gyis za ba de rags pa dang phra ba'o //🔽rags pa ni kham du byas nas za ba'o //
analyzed: kham gyis za ba de rags pa dang phra ba'o // rags pa ni kham du byas nas za ba'o //
translated: Morsel food is gross or subtle.🔽Gross morsels are eaten after being made into balls and swallowed.
