original: phra ba ni bkru ba dang bsku ba dang gtor pa la sogs @289b pa ste ;
analyzed: phra ba ni bkru ba dang bsku ba dang gtor pa la sogs @289b pa ste ;
translated: Subtle morsels are those that are drunk or sprinkled or bathed in.

original: de ni dri dang ro dang reg bya'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni dri dang ro dang reg bya'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: They are by nature odor, taste, and the tangible.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the contact that arises from the union of the object, sense faculty, and consciousness.

original: yid kyis kun du sems pa ni yid kyi las te /
analyzed: yid kyis kun du sems pa ni yid kyi las te /
translated: Mental volition is mental action.🔽As the Presentation on the World explains:

original: gdags pa las ji skad du sgo nga gang dag ma la dran pa brjed pa med pa de dag rul bar mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gdags pa las ji skad du sgo nga gang dag ma la dran pa brjed pa med pa de dag rul bar mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: If the mother does not forget the eggs, they will not rot.

original: / rnam par shes pa ni gang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa ni gang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is that which establishes existence.

original: de la kham gyis za ba ni dbang po rnams rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la kham gyis za ba ni dbang po rnams rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Among those, the food of morsel by mouth is that which increases the faculties.

original: reg pa ni rten pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni rten pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Contact is that which increases the consciousness that is the support.

original: de gnyis kyis btsas par 'gyur ba la phan par byed pa'i phyir ma ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis btsas par 'gyur ba la phan par byed pa'i phyir ma ma lta bu'o //
translated: Those two are like a wet nurse because they benefit the embryo.

original: yid kyis kun du sems pa ni yang srid pa 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis kun du sems pa ni yang srid pa 'phen pa'o //
translated: Mental volition is that which propels existence.

original: de ltar 'phangs par zad la thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'phangs par zad la thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that existence is obtained merely by that propulsion.

original: rgyun la yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir yang srid par skye bar rnam par shes pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun la yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir yang srid par skye bar rnam par shes pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: The potential of consciousness to be born in existence is infused in the continuum.

original: de gnyis ni skyes pa'i ma lta bu ste ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni skyes pa'i ma lta bu ste ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: These two are like the mother of a man, and are to be applied in the appropriate manner.

original: kha zas 'dod par sems can so sor mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems can skal ba mnyam pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin par sdud do //
analyzed: kha zas 'dod par sems can so sor mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems can skal ba mnyam pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin par sdud do //
translated: The phrase “the individual similarity of sentient beings who desire food” indicates the similarity of sentient beings, which is not different.

original: so sor zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyab par 'dod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyab par 'dod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word “individual” is a term of extension.

original: sems can sems can zhes so sor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sems can zhes so sor gnas pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are individually situated as sentient beings.

original: gal te gcig par gyur du zin na ni sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba 'dres par 'gyur ro //🔽tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ni sems can khams la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams kyi so so pa ste rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i spyod pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gcig par gyur du zin na ni sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba 'dres par 'gyur ro // tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ni sems can khams la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams kyi so so pa ste rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i spyod pa ston pa'o //
translated: If they were to be one, the migrations of sentient beings would be mixed.🔽The phrase “the individual of those sentient beings who are different in terms of realm and so on” indicates the individual karmic maturation of those who are different in terms of realm and so on.

original: dge slong la sogs pa'i bye brag gi tha dad pa de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa ston to ;
analyzed: dge slong la sogs pa'i bye brag gi tha dad pa de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa ston to ;
translated: The phrase “the individual of those who are different in terms of the distinctions of monk and so on” indicates the individual natural result.

original: / don gcig la 'dod pa'i nges pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad la thams cad 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / don gcig la 'dod pa'i nges pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad la thams cad 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that all sentient beings desire everything.

original: dper na bram ze rnams ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i cho ga 'dod kyi /
analyzed: dper na bram ze rnams ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i cho ga 'dod kyi /
translated: For example, Brahmins desire the rites of sacrifice, etc.,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: but others do not.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The cause of the differentiation is the homogeneity of sentient beings.

original: de med du zin na ni 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na ni 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, there would be no difference between noble ones and non-noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams la med de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams la med de /
translated: The homogeneity of noble ones does not exist for non-noble ones.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa ma yin pa 'phags pa'i grangs su mi chud do //🔽so so'i skye bo nyid ni so so'i skye @290a * //🔽bo rnams kyi yin gyi 'phags pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa ma yin pa 'phags pa'i grangs su mi chud do // so so'i skye bo nyid ni so so'i skye @290a * // bo rnams kyi yin gyi 'phags pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-noble ones are not counted as noble ones.🔽The state of being an ordinary being is for ordinary beings, not for noble ones.

original: so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang so so'i skye bo rnams nyid kyi yin gyi 'phags pa rnams kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang so so'i skye bo rnams nyid kyi yin gyi 'phags pa rnams kyi ma yin te /
translated: The homogeneity of ordinary beings is for ordinary beings, not for noble ones.

original: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the state of an ordinary man.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi skal ba mnyam par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽don gcig la 'dod pa'i nges pa'i rgyu'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi skal ba mnyam par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir / don gcig la 'dod pa'i nges pa'i rgyu'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The homogeneity of ordinary men is the state of an ordinary man.🔽In order to demonstrate the state of an ordinary man, he says:

original: mthun pa'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i byed pa'o //
translated: The cause of the determination of the desire for the same object.

original: de zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The same object is the object of the desire for the same object.🔽The cause of the determination of the desire for the same object is the cause of the determination of the desire for the same object.🔽The state of an ordinary man is the cause of the determination of the desire for the same object.

original: med du zin na zhes bya ba ni yod par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: med du zin na zhes bya ba ni yod par ma gyur na'o //
translated: If it did not exist, the state of an ordinary man would not exist.

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams te /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams te /
translated: The noble ones are the Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddha.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du song bas 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du song bas 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called noble ones because they have gone far from sinful, non-virtuous dharmas.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: The non-noble ones are the ordinary men.🔽If the state of an ordinary man did not exist, the noble ones would not exist.🔽If the noble ones did not exist, the non-noble ones would not exist.🔽If the noble ones and the non-noble ones did not exist, the world would not exist.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la gnas pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems yod pa rnams 'dres pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na 'chi 'pho zhing skye la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la gnas pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems yod pa rnams 'dres pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na 'chi 'pho zhing skye la /
translated: If the world did not exist, the world-transcending would not exist.

original: de skal ba mnyam pa nyid mi 'dor ba yang yod de /
analyzed: de skal ba mnyam pa nyid mi 'dor ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also one who does not discard the same status,

original: gang du shi ba de nyid du skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang du shi ba de nyid du skye ba'o //
translated: but who dies in that very place and is born there.

original: 'chi 'pho ba yang med cing skye ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba yang med cing skye ba yang med la /
translated: There is also one who does not die and is not born,

original: de skal ba mnyam pa nyid mi 'dor ba yang yod de nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de skal ba mnyam pa nyid mi 'dor ba yang yod de nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: but who does not discard the same status, namely, one who has entered the fixed condition.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid bor te /
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid bor te /
translated: He discards the same status as an ordinary being

original: 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: and obtains the same status as an ārya.

original: 'chi 'pho zhing skye la skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor ba ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas lha'i nang du skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho zhing skye la skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor ba ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas lha'i nang du skye ba'o //
translated: One who dies and is born and discards the same status is one who dies among humans and is born among gods.

original: 'chi 'pho yang med cing skye ba yang med la skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang mi 'dor zhing /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho yang med cing skye ba yang med la skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang mi 'dor zhing /
translated: One who neither dies nor is born and does not discard the same status,

original: 'thob pa yang med pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'thob pa yang med pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: but who does not obtain it, is one who is excluded from the above.

original: bstan bcos las nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa ni so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor zhing 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob po zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos las nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa ni so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor zhing 'phags pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'thob po zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir /
translated: The treatise declares: “One who has entered the state of certainty abandons the universal similarity of the ordinary person and acquires the universal similarity of the ārya.”

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid la tha dad du byed pa ci yod ces dris so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid la tha dad du byed pa ci yod ces dris so //
translated: Therefore, the question is asked: “What is the difference between being an ordinary person and the universal similarity of the ordinary person?”

original: 'dod pa mthun pa ni 'dod pa 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa mthun pa ni 'dod pa 'dra ba ste /
translated: Similarity of desire means similarity of desire.

original: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bshad do //
translated: This is explained as universal similarity.🔽The universal similarity of the ordinary person is the source of all harm.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni gnod pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni gnod pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs su gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the term “family.”

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this very meaning,

original: dge slong dag byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the text says: “Monks, the ordinary person is a source of all harm.”

original: gzhan nas kyang gal te 'dir 'ong na ni zhes 'byung ba ni 'jig rten 'dir @290b 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan nas kyang gal te 'dir 'ong na ni zhes 'byung ba ni 'jig rten 'dir @290b 'ong ba ste /
translated: And in another text, it says: “If he comes here,” meaning if he comes to this world.

original: lha'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid bor nas lha'i nang nas shi 'phos nas mi'i skal pa mnyam pa nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: lha'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid bor nas lha'i nang nas shi 'phos nas mi'i skal pa mnyam pa nyid 'thob po //
translated: Having abandoned the homogeneity of the gods, having died in the realm of the gods, one obtains the homogeneity of humans.

original: de ltar skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni thob cing 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni thob cing 'dor ro //
translated: Thus, homogeneity is obtained and abandoned.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzhan thob pa'am /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzhan thob pa'am /
translated: The state of an ordinary worldling is not obtained through the obtaining of another homogeneity,

original: thob pa 'dor ba 'am /
analyzed: thob pa 'dor ba 'am /
translated: nor through the abandonment of the obtained,

original: ma thob pa 'thob pa med de /
analyzed: ma thob pa 'thob pa med de /
translated: nor through the acquisition of the non-obtained.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid 'dus byas thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid 'dus byas thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of an ordinary worldling is the universal of all conditioned phenomena.

original: de ni rigs mthun pa nyid btang bas gtang ba med de /
analyzed: de ni rigs mthun pa nyid btang bas gtang ba med de /
translated: It is not abandoned through the abandonment of the similarity of types.

original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa nyid dang / so so'i skye bo nyid bye brag cher yod par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa nyid dang / so so'i skye bo nyid bye brag cher yod par shes par bya'o /
translated: Thus, homogeneity and the state of an ordinary worldling should be understood to be very different.

original: // / mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bab ste /
analyzed: // / mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bab ste /
translated: The chapter on the characteristics is finished.

original: chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The internal members of the arising of a factor.

original: skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa skye bar mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa skye bar mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Arising is the future factor tending toward the conditioned.

original: de ni skye ba'ang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos skye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni skye ba'ang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos skye ba'o //
translated: It is both arising and a factor, thus it is the arising of a factor.

original: chos kyi sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos kyi sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: The term “dharma” refers to form, etc.

original: de ni rang yang yin la nus pa yang yin pas rang gi nus pa ste /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i chos skyed nus pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang yang yin la nus pa yang yin pas rang gi nus pa ste / ma 'ongs pa'i chos skyed nus pa'o //
translated: It is a cause because it is a cause of the obtainment of its own result.🔽It is a cause of the obtainment of its own result because it is a cause of the obtainment of its own capability.

original: rang gi nus pa 'thob pa ni rang rang gi nus pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa 'thob pa ni rang rang gi nus pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of its own capability is the acquisition of its own capability.

original: de'i rgyu ni rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of that is the cause of the obtainment of its own capability.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos da ltar byung ba'i gnas su 'byin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos da ltar byung ba'i gnas su 'byin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of the future dharma’s emergence into the present.

original: de ni nang gi yan lag kyang yin la rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pas nang gi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de ni nang gi yan lag kyang yin la rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pas nang gi yan lag ste /
translated: It is an internal cause because it is both internal and a cause of the obtainment of its own capability.

original: rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of the obtainment of its own capability.

original: thun mong gi rgyu ma yin pas nang gi yan lag ste /🔽chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi rgyu ma yin pas nang gi yan lag ste / chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is an internal cause because it is not a common cause.🔽The meaning is that it is the cause of the obtainment of the capability of the internal cause of the arising of a dharma.

original: chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni skye ba'o //
translated: The cause of the obtainment of its own capability, which is the internal cause of the arising of a dharma, is birth.

original: phyi'i yan lag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams te 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi'i yan lag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams te 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The external members are the causes and conditions, which will be explained below.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni phyi'i yan lag rgyu'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni phyi'i yan lag rgyu'i dngos po ste /
translated: The causes and conditions are the external members, which are the causal entities.

original: de dag gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba'i thun mong gi rgyu yin bas gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba'i thun mong gi rgyu yin bas gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: They are not the principal ones, because they are the common causes of the arising of form, etc.

original: rigs pas yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pas yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate their existence by means of reasoning, he says:

original: de med du zin na bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de med du zin na bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If they did not exist, then action, etc.🔽If arising did not exist, then, even though the causes and conditions exist, the dharmas would not arise, like space.🔽And space, etc.

original: skye ba med du zin na rgyu dang rkyen rnams yod kyang nam mkha' bzhin du chos skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye ba med na /🔽gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa yang 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba med du zin na rgyu dang rkyen rnams yod kyang nam mkha' bzhin du chos skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye ba med na / gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas nyid yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa yang 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as arising does not exist, so also cessation does not exist.🔽If arising and cessation did not exist, then the conditioned would be identical with the unconditioned.

original: skye ba med du 'dra na ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dus byas yin la /
analyzed: skye ba med du 'dra na ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dus byas yin la /
translated: If arising and cessation did not exist, then the conditioned would be identical with the unconditioned.🔽If the conditioned were identical with the unconditioned, then all human effort would be in vain.🔽If the conditioned were identical with the unconditioned, then all human effort would be in vain.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin pa de bas skye ba nyid du grub po //🔽gnas pa'i @291a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin pa de bas skye ba nyid du grub po // gnas pa'i @291a * //
translated: but not space, etc. Therefore, arising is established.

original: mtshan nyid dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: To analyze the characteristics of duration, he says:

original: 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The projection of another effect, etc.

original: 'bras bu 'di las 'bras bu gzhan ni 'bras bu gzhan no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di las 'bras bu gzhan ni 'bras bu gzhan no //
translated: Another effect from this effect is another effect.

original: 'bras bu gzhan gyi 'phen pa ni 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan gyi 'phen pa ni 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'o //
translated: The projection of another effect is the projection of another effect.

original: 'phen par byed pas 'phen pa ste /
analyzed: 'phen par byed pas 'phen pa ste /
translated: The one who projects is the projector.

original: chos skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o//
analyzed: chos skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o//
translated: It is the grasping of the arising of a dharma.

original: de'i dbang gis chos skye ba'i skye ba la bgegs su ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis chos skye ba'i skye ba la bgegs su ma gyur pa'o //
translated: By its power, the arising of the arising of a dharma is not obstructed.

original: 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus de'i gnas ni 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus kyi gnas te dus ji srid du 'bras bu gzhan 'phen nus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus de'i gnas ni 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus kyi gnas te dus ji srid du 'bras bu gzhan 'phen nus par gyur pa'o //
translated: The duration of the time of the projection of another effect is the duration of the time of the projection of another effect, for as long as the ability to project another effect exists.

original: gnas par ma gyur na 'bras bu 'phen mi nus so //
analyzed: gnas par ma gyur na 'bras bu 'phen mi nus so //
translated: If it does not endure, it cannot project an effect.

original: gnas par 'gyur ba de'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur ba de'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the cause of its endurance is called duration.

original: gang gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi mthus so //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi mthus so //
translated: By whose power?

original: rga ba'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba de brjod de 'bras bu gnyis pa 'phen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rga ba'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba de brjod de 'bras bu gnyis pa 'phen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The characteristic of aging is stated, and it is said that it projects a second effect, etc.

original: 'bras bu gnyis pa 'phen nus pa la gnod pa'i rgyu ni nyam chung bar byed pa ste rga ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis pa 'phen nus pa la gnod pa'i rgyu ni nyam chung bar byed pa ste rga ba'o //
translated: The cause of harm to the power to project a second effect is aging, which weakens it.

original: de lta na ni skad cig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni skad cig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be momentary.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos de skad cig du mar yang 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos de skad cig du mar yang 'dug pa'o //
translated: That is, it would remain for many moments.

original: rga ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu gcig 'phen pa'i nus pa yongs su nyams na 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus su gnas pa mi thob bo //
analyzed: rga ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu gcig 'phen pa'i nus pa yongs su nyams na 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus su gnas pa mi thob bo //
translated: If the power to project a single effect were weakened by the force of aging, it would not obtain the duration necessary to project another effect.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bab nas /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bab nas /
translated: Since the topic of impermanence has been introduced,

original: gnod pa byed nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa byed nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
translated: this is stated: “The ability to harm, etc.”

original: rga bas 'bras bu gnyis pa la sogs pa 'phen pa la gnod par byed nus /
analyzed: rga bas 'bras bu gnyis pa la sogs pa 'phen pa la gnod par byed nus /
translated: Aging has the ability to harm the projection of a second effect, etc.

original: chos 'das pa'i dus su 'phen pa'i rgyu ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos 'das pa'i dus su 'phen pa'i rgyu ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Impermanence is the cause of the projection of a phenomenon in the past.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus te tshogs nas byas pas 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus te tshogs nas byas pas 'dus byas so //
translated: The term “conditioned” means that which is produced by the aggregation and combination of causes and conditions.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po ste gang dag gis gzugs la sogs par rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po ste gang dag gis gzugs la sogs par rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the entities of form, etc., and those that determine the understanding of form, etc. are called the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i don 'di la khungs su mdo sde 'byin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i don 'di la khungs su mdo sde 'byin te /
translated: The sūtra is the source for the meaning of the term “conditioned characteristics.”

original: gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sūtra states: “These three are the characteristics of the conditioned.”

original: gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ste rga ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ste rga ba'o //
translated: The phrase “enduring and undergoing change” means enduring and undergoing change, i.e., aging.

original: gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba de ni mtshan nyid gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba de ni mtshan nyid gcig tu bstan to //
translated: Enduring and undergoing change are taught as a single characteristic.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gnas pa ni kun du chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gnas pa ni kun du chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because enduring is the basis of attachment.

original: rga bas gnas pa zin na de la kun du chags pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rga bas gnas pa zin na de la kun du chags pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When enduring is seized by aging, attachment to it ceases.

original: dpal can ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sna nag ma zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgud pa bstan to //
analyzed: dpal can ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sna nag ma zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgud pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the glorious one” and so on. The word “black-nosed” indicates misfortune.

original: de skad @291b du 'byor pa thams cad kyi mtha' ni rgud pa zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad @291b du 'byor pa thams cad kyi mtha' ni rgud pa zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the end of all prosperity is misfortune.

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Dharma” refers to form and so on.

original: bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ni don gzhan du gyur pa dag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ni don gzhan du gyur pa dag go //
translated: “Not itself” means “other than that.”

original: de ni 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa nyid skye ba la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gzugs la sogs pa nyid skye ba la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is to say that form and so on are not birth and so on.

original: gal te bdag nyid du gyur na ni gzhan yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid du gyur na ni gzhan yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were themselves, they would be other than that.

original: 'dis ni gzhan ma yin par smra ba'i nyes pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan ma yin par smra ba'i nyes pa brjod do //
translated: This states the error of the theory of nondifference.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of characteristics is form and so on.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristics are birth and so on.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni gcig pa'o //
translated: Nondifference means identity.

original: de ltar na ni rga ba dang gnas pa yang gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni rga ba dang gnas pa yang gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, aging and enduring would be identical,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: because they are not different.

original: de ni ma mthong ste 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma mthong ste 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because that is contradictory.

original: mi skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te yod par ma gyur na chos skye bar ji ltar 'gyur te rgyu med par 'bras bu 'byung ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te yod par ma gyur na chos skye bar ji ltar 'gyur te rgyu med par 'bras bu 'byung ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: If it were not to exist, how could the factor arise? For it is not seen that a result arises without a cause.

original: de la skye bas ni chos skyed /
analyzed: de la skye bas ni chos skyed /
translated: Birth causes the factor to arise.

original: gnas pas ni gnas par byed /
analyzed: gnas pas ni gnas par byed /
translated: Enduring causes it to endure.

original: rga bas ni rga bar byed /
analyzed: rga bas ni rga bar byed /
translated: Aging causes it to age.🔽Impermanence causes it to disintegrate.

original: mi rtag pas ni rnam par 'jig par byed na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang lhan cig skyes pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ji ltar bya ba byed /🔽de'i tshe 'di skye 'am /🔽gnas sam / rga 'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pas ni rnam par 'jig par byed na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang lhan cig skyes pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ji ltar bya ba byed / de'i tshe 'di skye 'am / gnas sam / rga 'am /
translated: But how could the characteristics function with respect to the basis that possesses the characteristics and which is simultaneous with them?

original: rnam par 'jig gam /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig gam /
translated: At that time, would it arise, endure, age, or disintegrate?🔽How could it be?

original: ji lta bu zhig / smras pa ma 'ongs pa'i skye bas bya ba byed de /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig / smras pa ma 'ongs pa'i skye bas bya ba byed de /
translated: It is said that future birth performs its function.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa la bya'o //
translated: Function means capability.

original: de la chos gsum ni ma 'ongs pa'i bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de la chos gsum ni ma 'ongs pa'i bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Three factors are asserted to perform their function in the future:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mar me dang skye ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mar me dang skye ba'o //
translated: the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering, a lamp, and birth.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba'i tshe na so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par spong ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba'i tshe na so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par spong ngo //
translated: When the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness arises, the state of ordinary man is abandoned.

original: skyes pa'i tshe ni rnam par spangs so //
analyzed: skyes pa'i tshe ni rnam par spangs so //
translated: When it has arisen, it has been abandoned.

original: mar me skye ba'i tshe ni mun pa sel to //
analyzed: mar me skye ba'i tshe ni mun pa sel to //
translated: When the flame arises, it dispels the darkness.

original: skyes pa'i tshe ni bsal to //
analyzed: skyes pa'i tshe ni bsal to //
translated: When it has arisen, it has dispelled it.

original: skye ba skye ba'i tshe ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams la skye ba dang mthun pa'i dngos pos bskyed par bya ba skyed do //
analyzed: skye ba skye ba'i tshe ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams la skye ba dang mthun pa'i dngos pos bskyed par bya ba skyed do //
translated: When the arising of arising arises, it produces the things that are to be produced by the power of the arising of arising.

original: skye ba skyes pa'i tshe ni skyes so //
analyzed: skye ba skyes pa'i tshe ni skyes so //
translated: When the arising of arising has arisen, it has produced them.

original: skyes par gyur pa ni skye bas bskyed do //
analyzed: skyes par gyur pa ni skye bas bskyed do //
translated: Having arisen, it is produced by the arising of arising.

original: gnas pa'i dbang gis ni gnas so //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dbang gis ni gnas so //
translated: By the power of duration, it endures.🔽By the power of duration, it endures.

original: gnas pa'i dbang gis gnas pa na rga bas ni rga bar byed /
analyzed: gnas pa'i dbang gis gnas pa na rga bas ni rga bar byed /
translated: By the power of aging, it ages.🔽By the power of impermanence, it perishes.

original: mi rtag pas ni rnam par 'jig gi / rgas nas ma yin rnam par zhig nas ma yin te rga'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pas ni rnam par 'jig gi / rgas nas ma yin rnam par zhig nas ma yin te rga'o //
translated: It does not age or perish when it has already aged or perished.

original: 'jig go // de'i phyir da ltar gnas pa la sogs pa dus gcig tu bya bar 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'jig go // de'i phyir da ltar gnas pa la sogs pa dus gcig tu bya bar 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the simultaneous activity of the present and so on.

original: gnas pa ni rga bas rga bar byed /
analyzed: gnas pa ni rga bas rga bar byed /
translated: Duration causes that which endures to age.

original: mi rtag pas rnam par 'jig go //
analyzed: mi rtag pas rnam par 'jig go //
translated: They are destroyed by impermanence.

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnams kyi skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba'i skye ba'o //🔽sogs pa gang dag gi yin pa de dag skye @292a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnams kyi skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba'i skye ba'o // sogs pa gang dag gi yin pa de dag skye @292a * //
translated: As for the characteristics of the characteristics, etc., the arising of the arising is the arising of arising.

original: ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those that have the arising of arising are the arising of arising, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yongs su sdud do //
translated: The phrase “etc.” includes the enduring of enduring and the impermanence of impermanence.

original: bzhi po de dag ni mtshan nyid rnams kyi rjes su 'gro bas rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni mtshan nyid rnams kyi rjes su 'gro bas rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: Since these four are the characteristics of the characteristics, they are secondary characteristics.

original: gal te rga ba la yang rga ba 'dod na de lta na ni de'i yang gzhan te thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rga ba la yang rga ba 'dod na de lta na ni de'i yang gzhan te thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that aging also has aging, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: de bas na 'di las thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di las thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “There is no infinite regress in this case.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is there no infinite regress?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid dag ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid dag ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: He says: In this way, the fundamental characteristics, i.e., the characteristics of the dharmas,

original: chos brgyad po dag la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi dngos por gnas so //
analyzed: chos brgyad po dag la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi dngos por gnas so //
translated: are applied to the eight dharmas, i.e., they are present as causal entities.

original: rtsa ba'i chos dang mtshan nyid gsum po rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po rnams la'o zhes bya ba de lta bu brgyad po dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i chos dang mtshan nyid gsum po rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po rnams la'o zhes bya ba de lta bu brgyad po dag la 'jug go //
translated: The fundamental dharmas and the three characteristics are applied to the four secondary characteristics, i.e., they are present as causal entities. In this way, they are applied to the eight.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni re re la'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug go zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni re re la'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug go zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The secondary characteristics are applied to each of the three characteristics, i.e., they are present as causal entities.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba nyid kyi yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽mtshan nyid rnams ni rtsa ba'i chos la gnas so //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba nyid kyi yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // mtshan nyid rnams ni rtsa ba'i chos la gnas so //
translated: He says: the arising of arising is of arising itself, etc.🔽The characteristics are present in the fundamental dharmas.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni mtshan nyid rnams la gnas so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni mtshan nyid rnams la gnas so //
translated: The secondary characteristics are present in the characteristics.

original: 'di ltar de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis thug pa med pa'i skyon med pas ji skad du smras pa rigs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis thug pa med pa'i skyon med pas ji skad du smras pa rigs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Thus, by this “because” he shows that the fault of infinite regress does not arise, and that what was said is reasonable.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa brjod par bya ba de brjod de /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa brjod par bya ba de brjod de /
translated: The collection of names, etc., which are to be expressed, have been expressed.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs yongs su sdud do //
translated: By the statement “the collection of names, etc.,” he includes the collection of words and the collection of syllables.

original: mi ldan pa de dag kyang don go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa de dag kyang don go bar byed pa'o //
translated: And those which are not associated are also expressive of meaning.

original: ci'i phyir sgra don go bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgra don go bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is sound not expressive of meaning?

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not able to be.

original: yi ge'i 'bru 'am tshig yongs su bcad pa'i sgra don go bar byed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru 'am tshig yongs su bcad pa'i sgra don go bar byed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the sound which is the delimitation of a syllable or word were expressive of meaning,

original: dper na goo zhes bya ba nyid kyi sgra ni don dgu la 'jug ste tshig dang / phyogs dang / sa dang / 'od zer dang / rdo rje dang / mig dang / phyugs dang / mtho ris dang chu rnams don dgu la 'jug ste /
analyzed: dper na goo zhes bya ba nyid kyi sgra ni don dgu la 'jug ste tshig dang / phyogs dang / sa dang / 'od zer dang / rdo rje dang / mig dang / phyugs dang / mtho ris dang chu rnams don dgu la 'jug ste /
translated: for example, the sound “go” is used for nine meanings: a word, a direction, the earth, a ray of light, a diamond, an eye, cattle, heaven, and water.

original: goo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mkhas pas gzung ngo //
analyzed: goo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mkhas pas gzung ngo //
translated: The word “ghoṣa” is to be understood by the wise.

original: de la yi ge'i 'bru ni don go bar byed pa ma yin te yi ge'i 'bru so so la don med pa dang / cig car du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yi ge'i 'bru ni don go bar byed pa ma yin te yi ge'i 'bru so so la don med pa dang / cig car du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, a single phoneme is not a meaning-revealer, because each single phoneme has no meaning and does not occur simultaneously.

original: tshig yongs su bcad pa'i sgra yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig yongs su bcad pa'i sgra yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the sound of a complete word,

original: de la yang tshig gi sgra gzhan brjod pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yang tshig gi sgra gzhan brjod pa 'byung ste /
translated: because in that case, the sound of another word would occur.

original: de la yang sgra gzhan brjod pa 'byung bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang sgra gzhan brjod pa 'byung bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, the sound of another word would occur, so there would be an infinite regress.🔽Just as a word is able to express a meaning, so a phoneme is able to express a meaning.

original: ji ltar tshig gis @292b ming brjod nus pa de bzhin du don kyang brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med do zhes bya ba de'i phyir sus yi ge 'bru gcig po de thos pa des don de nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tshig gis @292b ming brjod nus pa de bzhin du don kyang brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med do zhes bya ba de'i phyir sus yi ge 'bru gcig po de thos pa des don de nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because sounds do not occur in an assemblage, whoever hears that single phoneme will understand that meaning.

original: 'di ni skyon du mi 'gyur te chos rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni skyon du mi 'gyur te chos rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par snang ngo //
translated: This is not a fault, because the power of phenomena is seen to be individually determined.

original: dper na rva las mda' rgyu skye'i de las tsandan mi skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rva las mda' rgyu skye'i de las tsandan mi skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, an arrow is produced from a reed, but sandalwood is not produced from it.

original: gang tshogs pa med pas sus gcig po de thos pa des don de nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de dang sgras don rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang tshogs pa med pas sus gcig po de thos pa des don de nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de dang sgras don rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: And just as you say that the meaning is understood by the one who hears the word that is not in the collection, so too, the meaning is understood by means of the word.

original: de'i phyir go bar byed pa ni don du gyur pas byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir go bar byed pa ni don du gyur pas byed do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is the function of the word.

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge rnams so ;
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge rnams so ;
translated: In this regard, “those” refers to names, phrases, and letters.

original: / ngag rnams la rag las te skye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / ngag rnams la rag las te skye ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are produced in dependence on speech.

original: ngag gi bdag nyid kyi sgra ni ngag go //
analyzed: ngag gi bdag nyid kyi sgra ni ngag go //
translated: Speech is sound that has the nature of speech.

original: ngag dag ngag la rag las te skye ba de dag ni ngag la rag las te skye ba dag go //
analyzed: ngag dag ngag la rag las te skye ba de dag ni ngag la rag las te skye ba dag go //
translated: Those that are produced in dependence on speech are produced in dependence on speech.

original: rag las pa ni kha na las pa'o //
analyzed: rag las pa ni kha na las pa'o //
translated: “In dependence” means “in relation to.”

original: de ni 'di skad du ngag yod na 'di dag 'byung ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ngag yod na 'di dag 'byung ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is to be explained as follows: “If speech exists, these are produced.”

original: shes pa bzhin du don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu zhes bya ba la don ni gzugs la sogs pa ste yul lo //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu zhes bya ba la don ni gzugs la sogs pa ste yul lo //
translated: Like consciousness, they are the mode of the object’s appearance. The object is form, etc., the object-field.

original: tshul ni rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshul ni rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mode is the intrinsic nature, the essential nature.

original: don gyi tshul gyi gnas ni ngag la don gyi tshul 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi tshul gyi gnas ni ngag la don gyi tshul 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mode of the object’s appearance is the appearance of the object’s mode in speech.

original: don gyi tshul gyi gnas dang 'dra bas don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: don gyi tshul gyi gnas dang 'dra bas don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu'o //
translated: Since they are like the mode of the object’s appearance, they are like the mode of the object’s appearance.🔽Therefore, the mode of the object’s appearance is the mode of the object’s appearance.

original: des na 'di ltar don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam pa dag ste /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag don gyi tshul gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam pa dag ste /
translated: They are like the mode of the object’s appearance.

original: don lta bur snang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don lta bur snang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are like the appearance of the object.

original: shes pa dang mtshungs pas shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang mtshungs pas shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Like consciousness, they are similar to consciousness.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul gyis bsgyur ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ltar de dag kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul gyis bsgyur ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ltar de dag kyang de bzhin te /
translated: For example, just as consciousness arises transformed by external objects such as blue, so too are they.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i ming la sogs pa ni mgul gyen du 'dug pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i gzugs brnyan nyid do //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i ming la sogs pa ni mgul gyen du 'dug pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i gzugs brnyan nyid do //
translated: The name, etc. of a pot, etc. is the reflection of the form of the pot, etc.

original: de bas na shes bya rnams kyang shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na shes bya rnams kyang shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the objects of knowledge are like consciousness.

original: rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The function of the understanding of one's own aim.

original: de ni rang yang yin la don yang yin pas rang gi don te /
analyzed: de ni rang yang yin la don yang yin pas rang gi don te /
translated: It is one's own aim because it is one's own and an aim.

original: phyi rol gyi yul lo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul lo //
translated: It is an external object.

original: khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa ste nges zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa ste nges zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Understanding is the realization, the ascertainment, of that.

original: rang gi don khong du chud pa nyid byed pa gang yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: rang gi don khong du chud pa nyid byed pa gang yin pa de dag go //
translated: Those who have the function of the understanding of one's own aim.

original: de ni 'di skad du ming la sogs pa ni skad cig pa'i phyir byed pa dag kyang de las gud na med de //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ming la sogs pa ni skad cig pa'i phyir byed pa dag kyang de las gud na med de //
translated: This is stated as follows: Since name, etc. are momentary, the function is not separate from them.

original: de dag gi skye ba tsam ni byed pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba tsam ni byed pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere arising of those is the function.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad @293a * //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad @293a * //
translated: All formations are momentary.

original: cig pa // mi brtan byed pa ga la yod //
analyzed: cig pa // mi brtan byed pa ga la yod //
translated: How can the unstable have a function?

original: gang dag 'byung ba de byed de //
analyzed: gang dag 'byung ba de byed de //
translated: That which arises is the function.

original: byed pa'o zhes de la bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru zhes rnam grangs gzhan brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed pa'o zhes de la bya // zhes gsungs so // 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru zhes rnam grangs gzhan brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the agent.🔽The other synonyms of the object of expression are:🔽idea, speech, and letter.

original: 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams ni 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams ni 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams so //
translated: Idea, speech, and letter are the other synonyms of the object of expression.

original: de ni rnam grangs kyang yin la gzhan kyang yin pas rnam grangs gzhan te /
analyzed: de ni rnam grangs kyang yin la gzhan kyang yin pas rnam grangs gzhan te /
translated: It is a synonym and it is another, hence it is another synonym.

original: ming gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams nyid rnam grangs gzhan yin pas 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru'i rnam grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: ming gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams nyid rnam grangs gzhan yin pas 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru'i rnam grangs gzhan no //
translated: It is a different name, that is the meaning.🔽The other synonyms of idea, speech, and letter are the other synonyms of idea, speech, and letter.

original: 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru'i rnam grangs gzhan dag gis brjod par bya ba dag ni 'du shes dang / ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: 'du shes dang ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru'i rnam grangs gzhan dag gis brjod par bya ba dag ni 'du shes dang / ngag dang yi ge'i 'bru'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba dag go //
translated: The objects of expression by means of the other synonyms of idea, speech, and letter are the objects of expression by means of the other synonyms of idea, speech, and letter.

original: gang dag ce na de dag ces bya ba rnams te ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag ce na de dag ces bya ba rnams te ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i 'bru rnams so //
translated: What are they? They are the names, phrases, and syllables.

original: de dag kyang grangs 'di bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o /
analyzed: de dag kyang grangs 'di bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o /
translated: And they should be understood in this order.

original: des na ming dang 'du shes ni gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: des na ming dang 'du shes ni gcig tu brjod do //
translated: Therefore, name and discrimination are described as one.

original: tshig ni ngag go //
analyzed: tshig ni ngag go //
translated: Phrase is speech.

original: yi ge ni yi ge'i 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge ni yi ge'i 'bru rnams so //
translated: Syllable is the individual letters.

original: sngar smos pa'i don de nyid dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar smos pa'i don de nyid dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate the meaning of the above statement by means of an example, he says:

original: dper na mig la sogs pa la rag las te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa la rag las te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, the eye, etc. are mentioned,

original: mig la sogs pa la rag las te rnam par shes pa de dag skye ba ni gnyi ga'i kha na las te rnam par shes pa 'byung mod kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pas dbang po rnams kyis brjod do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la rag las te rnam par shes pa de dag skye ba ni gnyi ga'i kha na las te rnam par shes pa 'byung mod kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pas dbang po rnams kyis brjod do //
translated: because consciousness arises in dependence on the eye, etc. It is said that the eye, etc. are mentioned because they are the uncommon causes of consciousness, although consciousness arises in dependence on both.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa sdud do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa sdud do //
translated: The words “form, etc.” include sound, etc.

original: tshul gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba gang dag ce na /
analyzed: tshul gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the aspects that are like the bases of the modes?

original: rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: They are the consciousnesses.

original: rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa khong du chud par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa khong du chud par byed pa dag go //
translated: The understanding of one’s own object is the understanding of form, etc.

original: ngag gi sgras ni don brjod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngag gi sgras ni don brjod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is not expressed by the sound of speech.

original: ngag nyid sgra yin pas ngag gi sgra ste /
analyzed: ngag nyid sgra yin pas ngag gi sgra ste /
translated: The sound of speech is speech itself.

original: ngag gi sgra des don brjod par mi 'gyur te bsnyad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gi sgra des don brjod par mi 'gyur te bsnyad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is not expressed by the sound of speech, it is not communicated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽“The sound of speech is a designation.🔽The object of designation is a name.🔽The meaning is neither the object of designation nor the designation.🔽If the sound of speech were the object of designation, then it would be burned up by the fire at the end of the eon.

original: me zhes brjod pas tshig par gyur ta re /
analyzed: me zhes brjod pas tshig par gyur ta re /
translated: But the meaning is not burned up by that fire.

original: 'di la ngag gi sgra ni mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la ngag gi sgra ni mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the sound of speech is a designation.

original: brjod par bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: The object of designation is a name.

original: don ni brjod par bya ba yang ma yin par brjod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni brjod par bya ba yang ma yin par brjod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is neither the object of designation nor the designation.

original: gal te ngag gi sgra brjod par bya ba don du gyur na ni de'i phyir tshig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ngag gi sgra brjod par bya ba don du gyur na ni de'i phyir tshig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sound of speech were the object of designation, then it would be burned up by the fire at the end of the eon.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di la sgras don phrad nas 'dzin tam ma phrad par 'dzin /
analyzed: 'di la sgras don phrad nas 'dzin tam ma phrad par 'dzin /
translated: Does the word grasp the object by coming into contact with it or by not coming into contact with it?

original: de la @293b ma phrad par don 'dzin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la @293b ma phrad par don 'dzin par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not reasonable that the word grasps the object by not coming into contact with it,

original: sgra ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because the word has resistance, like the hand and so on.

original: lag pa la sogs pa ni ma phrad par reg pa 'dzin pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa ni ma phrad par reg pa 'dzin pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The hand and so on do not have the power to grasp what is not in contact with it.

original: ci ste sna la sogs pa bzhin du phrad nas don 'dzin par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste sna la sogs pa bzhin du phrad nas don 'dzin par 'dod na /
translated: But if it is claimed that it grasps the object by coming into contact with it, like the nose and so on,

original: de lta na ni me dang phrad pas sgra tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni me dang phrad pas sgra tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: then the fault arises that the word is burned by coming into contact with fire,

original: sgra ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word is the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles.

original: de bas na ngag gis don brjod par mi 'gyur bar grub po //
analyzed: de bas na ngag gis don brjod par mi 'gyur bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the word does not express the object.

original: gal te don brjod par bya ba ma yin na gang yin snyam pa la de'i phyir ngag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te don brjod par bya ba ma yin na gang yin snyam pa la de'i phyir ngag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: If the object is not to be expressed, what is it? Therefore, it says “the word.”

original: ngag gi sgras ni ming brjod do //
analyzed: ngag gi sgras ni ming brjod do //
translated: The word sound expresses the name.

original: ming gis ni don go bar byed de //
analyzed: ming gis ni don go bar byed de //
translated: The name makes the object understood,

original: de'i blo skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i blo skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces the cognition of that.

original: ming ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pas brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ming ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pas brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: since a name is not a verbal expression, it is not expressible.

original: ming gis rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i phyir ming gis don khong du chud par byed pa ni rigs kyi sgras ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ming gis rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i phyir ming gis don khong du chud par byed pa ni rigs kyi sgras ni ma yin te /
translated: A name does not cause one to understand an object, as does consciousness, etc., because it is not impeded. A sound causes one to understand an object, but not a name,

original: mig la sogs pa ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impeded, like the eye, etc.

original: de las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sgra las gzhan du ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sgra las gzhan du ste /
translated: Apart from that is apart from sound.

original: sangs rgyas pa la rtag par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la rtag par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established as permanent in the Buddhist system.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i sgra dang / bum pa'i ming dang / bum pa'i don dang bum pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i sgra dang / bum pa'i ming dang / bum pa'i don dang bum pa shes pa'o //
translated: These four dharmas are the sound of pot, the name of pot, the object of pot, and the consciousness of pot.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na ni ngo bo du ma yang ngo bo gcig pa dang 'dra bar tha dad pa med pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na ni ngo bo du ma yang ngo bo gcig pa dang 'dra bar tha dad pa med pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: When one is engaged in verbal activity, one understands that the many natures are not different, as if they were one nature.

original: rnam par phye na ni tha dad par rtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par phye na ni tha dad par rtogs so //
translated: When one analyzes, one understands that they are different.

original: ming gi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ming gi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate the name, he says,

original: de la ming ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la ming ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Name is that which is called name and so on.

original: don rnams la tshig gis gzhol bar byed pas ming ste /
analyzed: don rnams la tshig gis gzhol bar byed pas ming ste /
translated: Name is that which causes one to engage in the meaning of words.

original: don gyi yul la gzhol bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gyi yul la gzhol bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it causes one to engage in the object of meaning.

original: 'di lta ste gzugs sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, form, sound.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni 'dis brjod par 'dod pa'i don rtogs par byed pas tshig ste ;
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni 'dis brjod par 'dod pa'i don rtogs par byed pas tshig ste ;
translated: Word is that which causes one to understand the meaning one wishes to express, therefore it is called word.

original: khong du chud par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khong du chud par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it causes one to comprehend.

original: 'dod pa'i don ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning one wishes to express is the meaning one wishes to speak.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni yongs su chud par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'dir / sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni yongs su chud par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dir / sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: To be completed is the meaning of to be understood.🔽Here,

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: All evil should not be done is an example from one's own tenets.

original: gnyis pa lha sbyin ba dkar mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa las dper bkod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa lha sbyin ba dkar mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa las dper bkod pa'o //
translated: The second, Devadatta's white cow and so on, is an example from the world.

original: yi ge zhes bya ba ni de yod na don gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dis 'byed par byed pas na yi ge'o //
analyzed: yi ge zhes bya ba ni de yod na don gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dis 'byed par byed pas na yi ge'o //
translated: “Syllable” is so called because when it exists, the meaning becomes clear, and because it divides.

original: 'di lta ste aa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste aa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like this: “a”.

original: so so na zhes bya ba gcig cig ming so so na 'dug pas so so'o //
analyzed: so so na zhes bya ba gcig cig ming so so na 'dug pas so so'o //
translated: “Individually” means that each one is individually a name.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba'i @294a * //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba'i @294a * //
translated: The word “collection”

original: sgra ni mang po'i don te /
analyzed: sgra ni mang po'i don te /
translated: means “many”.

original: des na ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there are collections of names, collections of words, and collections of syllables.

original: 'dir drang srong chen pos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lung las 'byung ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dir drang srong chen pos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lung las 'byung ba ston to //
translated: Here, “the great sages also” and so on show what appears in the scriptures.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathagatas appear or not,🔽the collections of names, words, and syllables exist in reality.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams shes pa nyid yin na de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas shes so zhes bya ba de la dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams shes pa nyid yin na de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas shes so zhes bya ba de la dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention here is that they are known when the Tathagatas appear.

original: phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa'i ming dang tshig gi tshogs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas shes so zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa'i ming dang tshig gi tshogs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas shes so zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The collections of names and phrases, etc., of the aggregates, sense-spheres, etc., are known when the Tathagata arises.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhi ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhi ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The four fruits beginning with the fruit of the stream-winner are called the fruits of the spiritual life.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: Dependent origination is as follows: with ignorance as condition, there are the formative forces;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: with the formative forces as condition, consciousness;

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: with consciousness as condition, name-and-form;🔽with name-and-form as condition, the six sense spheres;

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: with the six sense spheres as condition, contact;🔽with contact as condition, feeling;

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: with feeling as condition, craving;

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /🔽len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: with craving as condition, clinging;🔽with clinging as condition, existence;

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: with existence as condition, birth;

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Due to the condition of birth, there is old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and turmoil.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, there is the arising of this entire great mass of suffering.

original: 'du byed kyi dngos po ni 'di snyed do zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi dngos po ni 'di snyed do zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par brjod pa'o //
translated: The statement “There are this many entities of the formative forces” is a reference to the complete enumeration of the aggregate of the formative forces.

original: ji ltar bstan pa de ltar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa de ltar bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation should be understood in the manner in which it has been taught.

original: de'i phyir da ni rnam par shes pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir da ni rnam par shes pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says: “Now, consciousness should be mentioned.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement “The entities that are objects such as form” indicates that consciousness is not without an objective support.

original: dngos po smos pas ni rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa ma yin no zhes de skad ston to //
analyzed: dngos po smos pas ni rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa ma yin no zhes de skad ston to //
translated: The word “entities” is mentioned in order to show that consciousness is not without an objective support.

original: gang zla ba gnyis mthong ba yang yin nam /
analyzed: gang zla ba gnyis mthong ba yang yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that two moons are seen?

original: de ni zla ba'i gzugs la sogs pa de nyid la dmigs nas 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni zla ba'i gzugs la sogs pa de nyid la dmigs nas 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The consciousness that arises in regard to the moon’s reflection, etc. is a consciousness that is in error in regard to the very same moon, etc.

original: gal te dmigs pa la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa 'byung na /
translated: If consciousness were to arise without depending on an object,

original: de ltar gyur na ni gnas la mi ltos par yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni gnas la mi ltos par yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would arise without depending on a basis.

original: de lta na ni rnam par shes pa drug rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rnam par shes pa drug rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, the six consciousnesses would not be established.

original: mdo las gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo las gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would contradict the sūtra that states, “Consciousness arises in dependence on two.”

original: tsam zhes bya @294b ba smos pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid bsal ba'i don to //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya @294b ba smos pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid bsal ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of excluding a universal characteristic.

original: des na rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bas don der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bas don der 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the object of all consciousnesses is a particular characteristic.

original: so sor zhes bya ba'i tshig ni khyab par 'dod pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba'i tshig ni khyab par 'dod pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “each” means “respectively.”

original: don dang don so sor dmigs pa ni so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: don dang don so sor dmigs pa ni so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: The object and the individual object are the object of perception.🔽If the object of all consciousnesses is the intrinsic identity of the object, then how is it that the Abhidharma states:

original: chos mngon pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po'o zhes rnam par shes pas so zhes 'byung ba de ji lta bu /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po'o zhes rnam par shes pas so zhes 'byung ba de ji lta bu /
translated: “One who possesses mental consciousness knows blue through consciousness”?

original: 'du shes dang ldan pas de skad du ston to //
analyzed: 'du shes dang ldan pas de skad du ston to //
translated: One who possesses discrimination teaches that.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang skyon 'di ji ltar mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang skyon 'di ji ltar mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: How is it that this error does not occur for visual consciousness and so on?

original: 'du shes zhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes zhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because discrimination is weak.

original: de nyid kyi don ni 'grel pa las ston te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don ni 'grel pa las ston te /
translated: The meaning of that is taught in the Autocommentary:

original: mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang / snang ba la sogs pa gang du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang / snang ba la sogs pa gang du byung ba'o //
translated: “The eye and so on are coemergent causes” means that feeling and so on arise from the eye and so on, and light and so on.

original: des yongs su zin na 'byung ba ni dper na gzugs brnyan 'byung nus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des yongs su zin na 'byung ba ni dper na gzugs brnyan 'byung nus pa lta bu'o //
translated: “When it is possessed, it arises” means that it is able to arise, like a reflection.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la dngos po tsam khong du chud pa'i chos gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la dngos po tsam khong du chud pa'i chos gang yin pa ni /
translated: The Dharma that is understood as the mere thing of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects,

original: rang gi sems nyid tsam khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid tsam khong du chud pa'o //
translated: is understood as the mere nature of one's own mind.

original: de bye brag khong du chud pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bye brag khong du chud pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not understood as a particular.

original: bye brag khong du chud par byed pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag khong du chud par byed pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: The particular is understood as the basis of the dharmas such as feeling.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi skad cig tsam la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi skad cig tsam la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said, It observes the mere moment of the present time.

original: 'du byed thams cad kyang da ltar gyi dus kyi skad cig tsam la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad kyang da ltar gyi dus kyi skad cig tsam la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: All formations observe the mere moment of the present time.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa bye brag tu smos /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa bye brag tu smos /
