translated: Why is consciousness mentioned separately?

original: 'di la ni da ltar gyi skad cig skal ba mnyam pa ma yin pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di la ni da ltar gyi skad cig skal ba mnyam pa ma yin pa yod de /
translated: Here, the present moment is not of the same fortune.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i dus na ste gzugs ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i dus na ste gzugs ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: At the time of the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, form is not like that.

original: zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs la yang skal ba mnyam ba ma yin pa'i skad cig yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs la yang skal ba mnyam ba ma yin pa'i skad cig yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is there not a non-informative form included in the uncontaminated restraint which is not of the same type?

original: de lta yin du zin kyang de yod na ni yod par rnam par shes pa gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang de yod na ni yod par rnam par shes pa gtso bo yin no //
translated: Even if that is so, when it exists, the consciousness exists.

original: yang na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa'i skad cig pa gcig ste /
analyzed: yang na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa'i skad cig pa gcig ste /
translated: Or else, at the time of parinirvāṇa, there is a single moment of consciousness.

original: gzugs ni rgyu mthun ba ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs ni rgyu mthun ba ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: But form is not a natural outcome, so there is no contradiction.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams rnams kyis rgyas par sems so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams rnams kyis rgyas par sems so //
translated: The mind is nourished by the wholesome and unwholesome elements.

original: shes pas na yid do //
analyzed: shes pas na yid do //
translated: It is the mind because it knows.

original: sna tshogs shes pas rnam par shes pa ste /🔽dper na lag pa dang 'thor byed dang / @295a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs shes pas rnam par shes pa ste / dper na lag pa dang 'thor byed dang / @295a * //
translated: It is consciousness because it knows various things.

original: 'thung byed ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'thung byed ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the hand, the foot, and the anus.

original: yang na gang 'das pa de ni yid do //
analyzed: yang na gang 'das pa de ni yid do //
translated: Or else, what is past is the mind.

original: gang da ltar byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang da ltar byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: What is present is consciousness.

original: gang ma 'ongs pa de ni sems so //
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa de ni sems so //
translated: What is future is the mental factor.

original: dang po'i sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi gdags pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dang po'i sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi gdags pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of the designation of the substance of sentient beings at the beginning is the cause of the designation of sentient beings.

original: dang po'i sems can gyi rdzas gang yin pa de ni thog ma'i sems can gyi rdzas te /
analyzed: dang po'i sems can gyi rdzas gang yin pa de ni thog ma'i sems can gyi rdzas te /
translated: The substance of sentient beings at the beginning is the substance of sentient beings at the outset.

original: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mang la du ma zhugs na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mang la du ma zhugs na /
translated: Ananda, if consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb,

original: khu chu dang khrag mer mer por chags par 'gyur ram zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag mer mer por chags par 'gyur ram zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: would the semen and blood of the mother and father congeal and form amala?

original: yang na sems can nyid rdzas yin pas sems can gyi rdzas so //
analyzed: yang na sems can nyid rdzas yin pas sems can gyi rdzas so //
translated: Alternatively, since sentient beings are substances, they are the substances of sentient beings.

original: 'dogs pas na gdags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dogs pas na gdags pa ste /
translated: Designation is imputation.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with mundane convention.

original: sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa de'i rgyu ni byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa de'i rgyu ni byed rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the designation of the substance of sentient beings is the active cause.

original: dang po ni gtso bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang po ni gtso bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The first is synonymous with primary.

original: de ni sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i rgyu yang yin la dang po yang yin pas sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i dang po'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i rgyu yang yin la dang po yang yin pas sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i dang po'i rgyu'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the designation of the substance of sentient beings and it is the first, it is the cause of the designation of the substance of sentient beings at the beginning.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it says.

original: mig la sogs pa yang sems can du gdags pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang sems can du gdags pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the eyes, etc. are the cause for the designation of sentient beings,

original: 'on kyang dngos su na rnam par shes pa nyid de gdags pa'i rgyu yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos su na rnam par shes pa nyid de gdags pa'i rgyu yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: nevertheless, in reality, consciousness itself is the cause for that designation, not the eyes, etc.

original: de dang mi ldan yang sems can du gdags pa'i tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan yang sems can du gdags pa'i tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: For, even without them, the convention of designating sentient beings is used.

original: rnam par shes pa med na sems can du gdags pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa med do ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na sems can du gdags pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa med do ;
translated: But without consciousness, the convention of designating sentient beings does not exist.

original: / gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor rnam par rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor yongs su gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor rnam par rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor yongs su gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The individual perception of objects such as form is what is meant by the individual determination of form, etc.

original: so sor rnam par rig par byed pa nyid gang yin pa de so sor rnam par rig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig par byed pa nyid gang yin pa de so sor rnam par rig par byed pa ste /
translated: That which individually perceives is the individual perceiver.

original: 'di ltar mig gis bltas nas rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gis bltas nas rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so ;
translated: For, having seen with the eyes, consciousness cognizes.

original: / rnam par shes pa de yang yul gyi bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa de yang yul gyi bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te //
translated: And that consciousness becomes sixfold due to the distinctions of its objects.

original: dper na bung shing gi bye brag gis tha dad de /
analyzed: dper na bung shing gi bye brag gis tha dad de /
translated: For example, they are different due to the specific type of fuel,

original: rtsva dang sog ma'i me zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang sog ma'i me zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: as in the case of a fire of grass or a fire of sticks.🔽The defining characteristics of these are stated by the Lord himself.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ste zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ste zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are stated by the Lord.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sna tshogs shes pas rnam par shes pa'o zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs shes pas rnam par shes pa'o zhes smos pa'o //
translated: They are stated as: consciousness is the awareness of the variety.🔽The statement in the context of the consideration of the characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid bsam pa'i skabs su smos pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid bsam pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bsam pa'i skabs su smos pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid bsam pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: This means in the context of the consideration of the characteristics of arising, etc.

original: ci smos she na /
analyzed: ci smos she na /
translated: What is stated?

original: nang gi yan lag ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag ni skye ba'o //
translated: The internal factor is arising.

original: phyi'i yan lag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams so zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyi'i yan lag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams so zhes smos so //
translated: The external factor is causes and conditions.

original: de la rgyu de dag ni gang /
analyzed: de la rgyu de dag ni gang /
translated: What are those causes?

original: rkyen rnams @295b ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen rnams @295b ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions?

original: de dag brjod pa rgyu ni drug ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag brjod pa rgyu ni drug ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are stated as: the causes are six.

original: mdo las / rkyen bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdo las / rkyen bzhi ste /
translated: In a sutra, the four conditions are stated:

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen te /
translated: The causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.🔽

original: rkyen bzhi ni gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rkyen bzhi ni gsungs kyi /
translated: The four conditions are the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, and the dominant condition.

original: rgyu rnams ni ma gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni ma gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But the causes are not mentioned.

original: 'di ni nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault,

original: drug pa'i skabs su rgyu'i mdo gsungs pa las de ni nub par gyur te lha rnams kyis bsnyad do //
analyzed: drug pa'i skabs su rgyu'i mdo gsungs pa las de ni nub par gyur te lha rnams kyis bsnyad do //
translated: because the causes were taught in the context of the sūtra on causes, but that sūtra has disappeared. The gods have said that it was taught.

original: yang na mdo gzhan dag las rgyu rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na mdo gzhan dag las rgyu rnams gsungs te /
translated: Or else, the causes are mentioned in other sūtras.🔽The associated cause is mentioned in the sūtra that states:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gsungs pa ni mthong ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i dad pa ni rtogs nas shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gsungs pa ni mthong ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i dad pa ni rtogs nas shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Faith that arises from seeing is concomitant with knowledge.

original: de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bstan te /
translated: Similarly, the coemergent cause is taught.

original: gzugs gang ci yang rung de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ces 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs gang ci yang rung de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ces 'byung ba'o //
translated: Whatever form there is, all of it is the four great elements.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang gsungs te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang gsungs te /
translated: The homogeneous cause is also mentioned.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba chung rab tsam dang ldan pa yod de /
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba chung rab tsam dang ldan pa yod de /
translated: There are those who possess a mere trace of roots of virtue.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de las dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de las dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From those roots of virtue, other roots of virtue arise.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang gsungs te /
translated: Universal causes are also mentioned:

original: log par lta ba la sogs pa log par rtog pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba la sogs pa log par rtog pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Wrong views and so on arise from wrong investigation.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang gsungs te /🔽dge slong ngag khyed kyis srog gcod pa'i sems can mthong na de la khyed kyis kye ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang gsungs te / dge slong ngag khyed kyis srog gcod pa'i sems can mthong na de la khyed kyis kye ma'o //
translated: Ripening causes are also mentioned:

original: sems can dmyal ba 'am sems can dmyal ba gang yang rung ba zhig mthong ngo snyam du nges par shes par bya'o //🔽dge slong dag khyed kyis srog gcod pa spangs pa'i sems can mthong na /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba 'am sems can dmyal ba gang yang rung ba zhig mthong ngo snyam du nges par shes par bya'o // dge slong dag khyed kyis srog gcod pa spangs pa'i sems can mthong na /
translated: Monks, when you see a sentient being who kills, you should ascertain that you see a hell being or any other sentient being who is a hell being.

original: de la khyed kyis lha'am lha gang yang rung ba zhig mthong ngo snyam du sems par shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la khyed kyis lha'am lha gang yang rung ba zhig mthong ngo snyam du sems par shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Monks, when you see a sentient being who has abandoned killing, you should ascertain that you see a god or any other sentient being who is a god.

original: byed pa'i rgyu yang gsungs te /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu yang gsungs te /
translated: Active causes are also mentioned:

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni bdag po'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni bdag po'o //
translated: Bhikṣus, in this way, the eye is the dominant condition,

original: gzugs rnams ni dmigs pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ni dmigs pa'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: and forms are the objective condition.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: Among them, the minds and mental factors are the minds and mental factors.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig go //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig go //
translated: Mutually means in relation to each other.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir mnyam du 'jug pas de'i phyir mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir mnyam du 'jug pas de'i phyir mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dag go //
translated: They are concurrent because they grasp the same object, and therefore they are concurrent.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa nyid mtshungs par ldan pa ste /🔽de ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa nyid mtshungs par ldan pa ste / de ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: Concurrent itself is concurrent.

original: rgyu yang yin pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i @296a * //
analyzed: rgyu yang yin pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i @296a * //
translated: That is concurrent and also a cause, so it is a concurrent cause.

original: rgyu'o // dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'o // dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate that, it is said:

original: 'di lta ste sems ni tshor ba nas shes rab kyi bar dag gi'o zhes bya ba smos te mtshungs bar ldan pa'i rgyu'o //🔽bar dag gi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems la sogs pa yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems ni tshor ba nas shes rab kyi bar dag gi'o zhes bya ba smos te mtshungs bar ldan pa'i rgyu'o // bar dag gi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems la sogs pa yongs su sdud do //
translated: The mind is the homogeneous cause of those beginning with feeling and ending with wisdom.🔽The word “etc.” includes the mental factors.

original: char ba la sogs pa de dag kyang sems kyi mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: char ba la sogs pa de dag kyang sems kyi mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Those beginning with feeling are the homogeneous cause of the mind.

original: dper na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni 'od zer dang bral bar mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni 'od zer dang bral bar mi 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, the orb of the sun does not appear without its rays.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang tshor ba la sogs pa dang bral bar mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang tshor ba la sogs pa dang bral bar mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the mind does not appear without feeling, etc.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Mutually, they are the results of each other.

original: gang dag phan tshun du 'bras bu yin pa de dag ni phan tshun 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun du 'bras bu yin pa de dag ni phan tshun 'bras bu ste /
translated: Those that are the results of each other are mutually results.

original: gcig gi 'bras bu gcig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gi 'bras bu gcig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that one is the result of the other.

original: lhan cig 'byung bas lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bas lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
translated: They arise together, so they are co-arisen.

original: lhan cig skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhan cig skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are born together.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba nyid rgyu yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba nyid rgyu yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is a co-existent cause because it is a cause that is co-existent.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says:

original: 'di lta ste 'byung ba rnams gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'byung ba rnams gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: for example, the great elements are the co-existent cause of each other.

original: de la sa'i khams ni chu la sogs pa gsum la ltos te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams ni chu la sogs pa gsum la ltos te 'byung ngo //
translated: Therein, the earth element arises in dependence on the three, i.e. the water element, etc.

original: chu la sogs pa yang sa la ltos nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa yang sa la ltos nas 'byung ste /
translated: The water element, etc. also arise in dependence on the earth element.

original: de dag gi 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: This is the relationship of cause and effect between them.

original: mtshan gyi gzhi ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan gyi gzhi ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of the characteristics is form, etc.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristics are origination, etc.🔽The mind is the co-existent cause of those entities that are concomitant with the mind.

original: sems kyang sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyang sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Those entities that are of the nature of being concomitant with the mind are concomitant with the mind.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu 'dra mod kyi 'on kyang khyad par bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu 'dra mod kyi 'on kyang khyad par bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Although coemergent causes and concomitant causes are similar, he says “by the power of each other” in order to teach their difference.

original: gcig gi stobs kyis gcig go //
analyzed: gcig gi stobs kyis gcig go //
translated: One arises by the power of the other.

original: dper na 'gron po mang po dag gcig la gcig mi ltos par lam gyi dgon pa las 'da' bar mi nus pa de bzhin du chos 'di dag kyang skad cig pa'i phyir gcig la gcig ma ltos par skye mi nus te /
analyzed: dper na 'gron po mang po dag gcig la gcig mi ltos par lam gyi dgon pa las 'da' bar mi nus pa de bzhin du chos 'di dag kyang skad cig pa'i phyir gcig la gcig ma ltos par skye mi nus te /
translated: For example, many travelers cannot cross a desert path without relying on each other. Similarly, these phenomena cannot arise without relying on each other because they are momentary.

original: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: That is the coemergent cause.

original: 'gron po mang po ni lam gyi dgon pa las 'byung bar zhugs pa de dag nyid gcig la gcig lam brgyags kyis mthud pa'i tshul du'o zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig lam brgyags kyis mthud pa dang / gzhan dang gzhan la'o //
analyzed: 'gron po mang po ni lam gyi dgon pa las 'byung bar zhugs pa de dag nyid gcig la gcig lam brgyags kyis mthud pa'i tshul du'o zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig lam brgyags kyis mthud pa dang / gzhan dang gzhan la'o //
translated: Many travelers who have entered the desert path are like each other in the way they are sustained by provisions.

original: de ltar gcig la gcig nye bar sgrub par byed pa lta bus 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar gcig la gcig nye bar sgrub par byed pa lta bus 'byung ba ste /
translated: Thus they arise like mutual accompaniers.

original: de ltar na de dag ni lam brgyags @296b kyis mthud pa'i chos dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni lam brgyags @296b kyis mthud pa'i chos dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Thus, these are the factors that are connected by the provisions of the path.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni phan tshun nye bar gnas pa'i phyir yid gcugs pas lus gcig pa lta bur gyur pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las khong du chud do zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni phan tshun nye bar gnas pa'i phyir yid gcugs pas lus gcig pa lta bur gyur pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las khong du chud do zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: “The mind and mental factors are mutually connected because they are like friends who have the same body. They are understood to be the entities of cause and effect.”

original: de bas na de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes brjod kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes brjod kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are called “associated,” but arising, etc., are not.

original: de dag ni mi ldan pa'i phyir yid gcugs pa ma yin pa ltar gcig la gcig nye bar sgrub cing phan 'dogs pa la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mi ldan pa'i phyir yid gcugs pa ma yin pa ltar gcig la gcig nye bar sgrub cing phan 'dogs pa la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: Because they are not connected, they are not like friends. They do not depend on each other for support and assistance.

original: 'dir ni lhan cig 'byung ba tsam 'ba' zhig gis rgyur khong du chud do //
analyzed: 'dir ni lhan cig 'byung ba tsam 'ba' zhig gis rgyur khong du chud do //
translated: Here, they are understood to be causes by the mere fact of arising together.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams zhes smos pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams zhes smos pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the factors that are called “those that follow the mind”?

original: de'i phyir sems las byung ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems las byung ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, “all mental factors” and so on, which means feelings and so on.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of conditioned phenomena are origination and so on.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba gang dag yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba gang dag yin snyam pa la /
translated: What are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena that are concomitant with the mind?

original: de'i phyir gang dag sems de'i yin ba dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag sems de'i yin ba dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “those that belong to that mind.”

original: gong du brjod ma thag pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnams dang / sems de'i skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gong du brjod ma thag pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnams dang / sems de'i skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mental factors that were just mentioned, the meditative discipline of the dhyanas, the meditative discipline of the formless realms, and the vows that are meditative disciplines, as well as the origination and so on of that mind.

original: gang gi phyir de dag sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya snyam pa la /
translated: Why are they called concomitant with the mind?

original: de dag gi sems dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi sems dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “they are simultaneous with that mind” and so on.

original: dus gcig pa dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig pa dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa'o //
translated: They are simultaneous in terms of the same time, the same arising, the same enduring, and the same ceasing.

original: de la dus gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la dus gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase “at the same time,” etc.,

original: 'das pa'i sems ni 'das pa rnams dang ngo //🔽da ltar byung ba rnams ni da ltar byung ba rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems ni 'das pa rnams dang ngo // da ltar byung ba rnams ni da ltar byung ba rnams dang ngo //
translated: past thought is associated with past thought,🔽present thought is associated with present thought,

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams dang ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams dang ste /
translated: and future thought is associated with future thought.

original: de dag ni dus gzhan na 'jug pa ma yin no //🔽dus gcig tu skye bas skye ba gcig pa dang / dus gcig tu gnas pa dang / dus gcig tu 'gag par dus dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig ste /
analyzed: de dag ni dus gzhan na 'jug pa ma yin no // dus gcig tu skye bas skye ba gcig pa dang / dus gcig tu gnas pa dang / dus gcig tu 'gag par dus dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig ste /
translated: They do not occur at different times.🔽They are said to have the same time, origination, duration, and cessation because they are originated, endure, and cease at the same time.

original: de dag gang dag la yod pa de dag dus dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang dag la yod pa de dag dus dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa'o //
translated: Those dharmas that have the same time, origination, duration, and cessation are said to have the same time, origination, duration, and cessation.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa rnams dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa gcig pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa rnams dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa gcig pa rnams te /
translated: They have the same effect, the same out-flow, and the same ripening.

original: de la 'bras bu gcig pa ni sems kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi'o //🔽de dag @297a * //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gcig pa ni sems kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi'o // de dag @297a * //
translated: They have the same effect because whatever is the effect of thought is the effect of those dharmas.

original: gi gang yin pa de nyid sems kyi'o //
analyzed: gi gang yin pa de nyid sems kyi'o //
translated: Whatever is the effect of those dharmas is the effect of thought.🔽They have the same out-flow because whatever is the out-flow of thought is the out-flow of those dharmas.🔽Whatever is the out-flow of those dharmas is the out-flow of thought.🔽They have the same ripening because whatever is the ripening of thought is the ripening of those dharmas.🔽Whatever is the ripening of those dharmas is the ripening of thought.

original: 'di lta ste sems kyi 'bras bu tshor ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems kyi 'bras bu tshor ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The result of the mind is the feeling, etc. that are associated with it.

original: rgyu mthun pa gcig pa gang dag yin pa de dag rgyu mthun pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa gcig pa gang dag yin pa de dag rgyu mthun pa gcig pa ste /
translated: Those that have the same dominant condition are those that have the same dominant condition.

original: 'bras bu 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “having the same result” is having a similar result.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems kyi rgyu mthun pa dge ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems kyi rgyu mthun pa dge ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: The mind and its associated factors have the same virtuous, etc. result.

original: rnam par smin pa gcig pa gang dag yin pa de dag rnam par smin pa gcig pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gcig pa gang dag yin pa de dag rnam par smin pa gcig pa dag ste /
translated: Those that have the same karmic maturation are those that have the same karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa ni mi nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni mi nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The karmic maturation is being a human, etc.

original: sems kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The karmic maturation of the mind is the karmic maturation of its associated factors.

original: skal ba mnyam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is homogeneity?

original: rang gi sa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, “Those that exist in the same realm, etc.”

original: rang gi sa pa rnams ni rang gi sa pa rnams nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa rnams ni rang gi sa pa rnams nyid kyi'o //
translated: Those of the same stage are the causes of those of the same stage.

original: de la gang dag 'dod par gtogs pa'i chos de dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la gang dag 'dod par gtogs pa'i chos de dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The factors belonging to the realm of desire are the causes of those belonging to the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i chos rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i chos rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams nyid kyi'o //
translated: Similarly, the factors belonging to the realms of form and of the formless are the causes of those belonging to the realms of form and of the formless.

original: ris smos pas ni ris lnga yongs su sdud de /
analyzed: ris smos pas ni ris lnga yongs su sdud de /
translated: The word “class” includes the five classes,

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du'o // de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni /
translated: from the class of factors to be abandoned by insight into unsatisfactoriness up to the class of factors to be abandoned by cultivation.🔽The factors to be abandoned by insight into unsatisfactoriness

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas slang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas slang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi ste /
translated: are the causes of the factors to be abandoned by insight into unsatisfactoriness.

original: de dag kyang sngar skyes pa rnams kyi ste skye ba rnams kyi 'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngar skyes pa rnams kyi ste skye ba rnams kyi 'o //
translated: They are the causes of those that have arisen previously and of those that will arise.

original: chos 'dra ba ni dge ba yang dge ba rnams kyi yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'dra ba ni dge ba yang dge ba rnams kyi yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similar factors are the causes of similar factors. Wholesome factors are the causes of wholesome factors, etc.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni dper na 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon las s'a lu'i myu gu nyid 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni dper na 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon las s'a lu'i myu gu nyid 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: The phrase “in the manner of a seed-dharma” means that, for example, a rice sprout arises from a rice seed.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul 'dis 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //🔽skal ba mnyam pa ni skal ba mtshungs pa ste 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul 'dis 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o // skal ba mnyam pa ni skal ba mtshungs pa ste 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should understand that the present topic is similar to the example of a seed-dharma.🔽Homogeneous means similar.

original: de ni skal ba mnyam pa yang yin la rgyu yang yin pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni skal ba mnyam pa yang yin la rgyu yang yin pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The phrase “homogeneous cause” means a cause that is homogeneous.

original: rang gi sa pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “in one’s own stage” means

original: sa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: sa ni dgu ste /
translated: that there are nine stages:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams so //
translated: the desire realm, the four meditative states of absorption, and the four formless states.

original: kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase “pervading cause” means a cause that pervades all.

original: de dag kyang sngar bshad pa yin te /🔽thams cad la dmigs pa'i dngos por 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngar bshad pa yin te / thams cad la dmigs pa'i dngos por 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These were explained above.🔽They are called “pervading” because they extend to all objects.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni @297b 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni @297b 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams nyid kyi'o //
translated: The phrase “defiled cause” means a cause that is defiled.

original: kun du 'gro ba rnams nyid rgyu yin pas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba rnams nyid rgyu yin pas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The universal causes are the causes of all conditioned factors.🔽The homogeneous causes are the causes of factors of their own class.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi ris pa rnams nyid kyi'o //🔽'di ni ris tha dad pa rnams kyi yang yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi ris pa rnams nyid kyi'o // 'di ni ris tha dad pa rnams kyi yang yin te /
translated: They are also the causes of factors of different classes.

original: 'di ni de gnyis kyi bye brag go //🔽mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste mi nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de gnyis kyi bye brag go // mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste mi nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the difference between the two.🔽The cause of the ripened effect is called the ripening cause.

original: de'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The ripening cause is the cause of the ripened effect.

original: de yang mi dge ba rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi dge ba rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ripening cause is unwholesome action, such as killing, etc.

original: dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is wholesome action, such as the practice of the moralities, etc.🔽The cause of the wholesome and unwholesome factors is the wholesome and unwholesome cause.

original: de dag ni dge ba yang yin la zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin pas dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams te /
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba yang yin la zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin pas dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams te /
translated: The cause of the indeterminate factors is the indeterminate cause.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur bas zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur bas zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The cause of the factors of the realm of desire is the cause pertaining to the realm of desire.🔽The cause of the factors of the realm of fine-materiality is the cause pertaining to the realm of fine-materiality.🔽The cause of the factors of the realm of immateriality is the cause pertaining to the realm of immateriality.

original: ci'i phyir lung du mi ston pa rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /🔽mthu chung ba'i phyir te sa bon rul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du mi ston pa rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /🔽mthu chung ba'i phyir te sa bon rul ba bzhin no //
translated: The cause of the factors not pertaining to the realms is the cause not pertaining to the realms.

original: zag pa med pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not uncontaminated?

original: sred pas ma brlan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pas ma brlan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not moistened by craving,

original: sa bon drung po bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon drung po bzhin no //
translated: like seeds that are burned.

original: de dag ces bya ba mi dge ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba mi dge ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those means the unwholesome, etc.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag gi rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos la rnam par smin pa zhes brjod pas rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag gi rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos la rnam par smin pa zhes brjod pas rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: The dharmas that are to be ripened are the dharmas that are to be ripened, since they are called the ripened.

original: chos ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dharmas are the eye consciousness, etc.

original: de dag skye ba na'o //
analyzed: de dag skye ba na'o //
translated: They are born.

original: rang bzhin ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la bdag nyid byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid ma gtogs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la bdag nyid byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for their own nature means except for their own nature, because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: de nyid de'i skyed pa por ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nyid de'i skyed pa por ma mthong ngo //
translated: That itself is not seen as their producer.

original: chos thams cad chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: All dharmas means conditioned and unconditioned.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu zhes bya snyam pa la /
translated: Why are they called causes?

original: de'i phyir skye ba la bgegs mi byed cing mi sgrib pa'i dngos pos zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la bgegs mi byed cing mi sgrib pa'i dngos pos zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by virtue of not obstructing arising and not concealing it.”

original: bgegs ni bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs ni bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: Obstruction is an impediment.

original: bgegs byed pa ma yin pa ni bgags mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs byed pa ma yin pa ni bgags mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not obstructing is not an impediment.

original: sgrib pa ni chod pa ste 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni chod pa ste 'gag pa'o //
translated: Concealment is a cover, a block.

original: sgrib par mi byed pa ni mi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib par mi byed pa ni mi sgrib pa'o //
translated: Not concealing is not a cover.

original: skye ba la sgrib par mi byed pas skye ba la mi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sgrib par mi byed pas skye ba la mi sgrib pa'o //
translated: Since it does not conceal arising, it is not an obstruction to arising.

original: bgegs med par skye zhing sgrib pa med pa ni skye ba la bgegs med cing mi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: bgegs med par skye zhing sgrib pa med pa ni skye ba la bgegs med cing mi sgrib pa ste /
translated: Arising without obstruction and without concealment is arising without obstruction and without concealment.

original: skye ba la bgegs med cing mi sgrib pa'i gnas skabs des so //
analyzed: skye ba la bgegs med cing mi sgrib pa'i gnas skabs des so //
translated: By virtue of that state of not obstructing and not concealing arising,

original: de ni 'di skad du ji snyed chos skye ba'i bgegs mi byed pa de dag thams cad byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ji snyed chos skye ba'i bgegs mi byed pa de dag thams cad byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: this is taught as follows: “All those that do not obstruct the arising of phenomena are called active causes.”

original: gang gi tshe byed pa nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu thams cad kyang byed pa'i rgyu'i sgrar @298a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed pa nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu thams cad kyang byed pa'i rgyu'i sgrar @298a * //
translated: When activity itself is a cause, all causes are called active causes.

original: brjod par 'gyur na ci'i phyir 'di kho na la byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya /
analyzed: brjod par 'gyur na ci'i phyir 'di kho na la byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya /
translated: If it is said to be the cause of that, why is it called the cause of activity?

original: smras pa / de dag ni ming gzhan kyis brjod do //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag ni ming gzhan kyis brjod do //
translated: Reply: Those are expressed by other names.

original: gang la ming gzhan med pa de ni sgra de nyid gyis brjod de /
analyzed: gang la ming gzhan med pa de ni sgra de nyid gyis brjod de /
translated: That which has no other name is expressed by that very sound.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin no //
translated: Like the sense sphere of form.

original: rgyu rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The causes have been explained.

original: 'bras bu de dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: The results of those should be explained.

original: gang gi yin gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gi yin gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the result of what?

original: de'i phyir / de la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mnyam du ldan pa'i rgyu'i ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ste zhes bya ba smos te rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mnyam du ldan pa'i rgyu'i ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ste zhes bya ba smos te rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said: The result of the human action of co-arising and concomitant causes is that which is established.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The word na is stated.

original: na'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word na means for what reason.

original: gang gi phyir gang gi stobs kyi nus pas gang skye ba de de'i ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi stobs kyi nus pas gang skye ba de de'i ste /
translated: That which arises by the power of the capacity of what is that of that.

original: 'jig rten na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes ston to //
translated: In the world, it is taught as the result of human action.

original: dper na 'bras bu la sogs pa ni zhing la rnams kyi skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du sems la sogs pa'i stobs kyis byung ba rnams skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu la sogs pa ni zhing la rnams kyi skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du sems la sogs pa'i stobs kyis byung ba rnams skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag go //
translated: For example, the fruit of a tree is the effect of human action in the field, and so on. In the same way, the things that arise by the power of mind, etc., are established as the effect of human action.

original: mi 'dra ba smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: The effect of a dissimilar type is the effect of evolution.

original: mi 'dra ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is dissimilar?

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu las lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu las lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The effect of a wholesome or unwholesome cause is indeterminate.

original: sems can ni mi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can ni mi la sogs pa ste /
translated: Sentient beings are humans, etc.

original: gang la sems can zhes brjod pa de sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la sems can zhes brjod pa de sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is called a sentient being is a sentient being.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ston to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas ma non zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ston to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas ma non zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is unobscured and indeterminate.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is its nature.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the effect of human action and the effect of dominance?

original: smras pa / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa'i 'o //
analyzed: smras pa / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa'i 'o //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of action.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni byed pa ma yin pa'i yang yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni byed pa ma yin pa'i yang yin no //
translated: The dominant result is also that of the non-agent.

original: dper na bzo bo rnams kyi bzo ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin pa dang / de ma yin pa gzhan ni bdag po'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bzo bo rnams kyi bzo ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin pa dang / de ma yin pa gzhan ni bdag po'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the craft of artisans is the result of the human agent and the dominant result. That which is not that is the dominant result alone.

original: de ltar bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa'i dngos pos rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa'i dngos pos rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the establishment of cause and effect by the relation of that which is to be produced and that which produces has been explained.

original: da ni thob par bya ba dang / thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos 'bras bu gzhan brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni thob par bya ba dang / thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos 'bras bu gzhan brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to state the other results by the relation of that which is to be attained and the cause that attains,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says: Nirvana is called the result of separation.

original: 'bral bas na bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'bral bas na bral ba ste /
translated: Separation is due to separation.

original: nyon mongs pa gtan du mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gtan du mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the non-arising of the afflictions forever, that is the meaning.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu @298b nyid bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu @298b nyid bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of separation itself is the result of separation.

original: de ni thob par bya ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni lam gyis thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thob par bya ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni lam gyis thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be attained, not to be generated, because it is to be attained by the path.

original: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not to be generated, because it is permanent.

original: rkyen brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen brjod par bya ste /
translated: The conditions should be stated,

original: de'i phyir rkyen ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen ni bzhi ste /
translated: therefore, the four conditions are stated:

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: causal condition, immediately preceding condition, objective condition, dominant condition.

original: rtogs par byed pas rkyen te /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas rkyen te /
translated: A condition is that which generates.

original: rang gi dgos pa'i skye ba gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi dgos pa'i skye ba gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the generation of its own effect to be manifest.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnams so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnams so //
translated: The past and present minds and mental factors.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The future are not,

original: ma 'ongs pa ni 'khrugs pa'i phyir snga phyi med do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni 'khrugs pa'i phyir snga phyi med do //
translated: because the future is not sequential.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is stated.

original: de ni de ma thag pa yin pas de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni de ma thag pa yin pas de ma thag pa ste /
translated: It is immediately preceding because it is immediately prior to that.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated in this way:

original: sems la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig las sems la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig 'byung gi du ma ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig las sems la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig 'byung gi du ma ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that one substance of mind, etc. arises from one substance of mind, etc., but not from many.

original: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs gcig pa'i rdzas kyis bar du gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni de dmigs par bya ba yin pas dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs gcig pa'i rdzas kyis bar du gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni de dmigs par bya ba yin pas dmigs pa'o //
translated: The term “immediately preceding” means that a substance of the same type is uninterrupted.🔽The objective condition is that which is observed.

original: dmigs pa nyid rkyen yin pas dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid rkyen yin pas dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The objective condition is that which is observed because it is the condition of that which is observed.

original: de la dmigs nas sems dang sems las byung ba dag byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de la dmigs nas sems dang sems las byung ba dag byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Because mind and mental factors arise in dependence on that.

original: chos thams cad do zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad do zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: All phenomena means conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.🔽The efficient cause is the nature.

original: byed pa'i rgyu rang bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni 'di skad du rgyu'i rkyen gang yin pa de nyid bdag po'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu rang bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni 'di skad du rgyu'i rkyen gang yin pa de nyid bdag po'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that the causal condition is the dominant condition.

original: nam mkha' ni bsags pa'i rdzas kyi go 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni bsags pa'i rdzas kyi go 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid de / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Space is defined as the void that is the opening for the accumulation of matter.

original: bsags pa ni rdul phra mo 'dus pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsags pa ni rdul phra mo 'dus pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The accumulation of matter is the nature of the aggregation of subtle particles.

original: de ni bsags pa yang yin la rdzas kyang yin pas bsags pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: de ni bsags pa yang yin la rdzas kyang yin pas bsags pa'i rdzas so //
translated: It is both an accumulation and matter, and so it is the accumulation of matter.

original: bsags pa'i rdzas kyi go 'byed pas bsags pa'i rdzas kyi go 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa'i rdzas kyi go 'byed pas bsags pa'i rdzas kyi go 'byed pa'o //
translated: The void that is the opening for the accumulation of matter is the void that is the opening for the accumulation of matter.

original: de nyid de'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid de'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: That is its definition.

original: de ni nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called space.

original: de'i nang na dngos po shin tu gsal bas nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de'i nang na dngos po shin tu gsal bas nam mkha'o //
translated: It is space because things are very clear in it.

original: gsal ba ni sal sal po ste /
analyzed: gsal ba ni sal sal po ste /
translated: Clear means clear,

original: mngon no rab tu gsal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon no rab tu gsal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: meaning manifest and very clear.

original: gang gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi mthus dngos po thams cad nam mkha' la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni gang gi mthus dngos po thams cad nam mkha' la gnas pa'o //
translated: By whose power do all things exist in space?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni yul gnon pas gnas so //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni yul gnon pas gnas so //
translated: Those that are impeded exist by occupying a place.

original: thogs pa med pa @299a * //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa @299a * //
translated: Those that are not impeded

original: rnams ni nye bar gnas pa'i dngos po'i gnas so //
analyzed: rnams ni nye bar gnas pa'i dngos po'i gnas so //
translated: exist in the place of the thing that is near.

original: gal te nam mkha' sgrib pa'i bdag nyid du gyur na ni de la thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang thogs pa med pa rnams 'byung ba dang gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' sgrib pa'i bdag nyid du gyur na ni de la thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang thogs pa med pa rnams 'byung ba dang gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If space were to have the nature of obstruction, then those that are obstructed and those that are unobstructed would not occur and would not abide.

original: 'dir bde bar gshegs pas kyang gsungs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lung las 'byung bas ston to //
analyzed: 'dir bde bar gshegs pas kyang gsungs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lung las 'byung bas ston to //
translated: Here, the statement “the Sugata also says” and so on teaches by means of scripture.

original: bram ze rlung ni nam mkha' la brten to zhes bya bas ni nam mkha' yod par brjod de /
analyzed: bram ze rlung ni nam mkha' la brten to zhes bya bas ni nam mkha' yod par brjod de /
translated: The statement “Brahmin, the wind is supported by space” indicates that space exists.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa'i rten du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa'i rten du mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, a nonentity is not suitable as the support of a nonentity.

original: snang ba'i rtags kyis kyang yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i rtags kyis kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the sign of illumination.

original: snang ba yod pas na nam mkha' shes so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba yod pas na nam mkha' shes so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because illumination exists, space is known.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /🔽rlung ni nam mkha' la brten par gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste / rlung ni nam mkha' la brten par gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.🔽The wind is said to be supported by space.

original: nam mkha' ni gnas med par gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gnas med par gsungs so //
translated: Space is said to be without support.

original: de'i phyir bram ze gang rlung brten par brtags pa'i nam mkha' de yod par ci mngon snyam du 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis snang ba yod pas na nam mkha' shes so zhes gsungs te de ni yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bram ze gang rlung brten par brtags pa'i nam mkha' de yod par ci mngon snyam du 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis snang ba yod pas na nam mkha' shes so zhes gsungs te de ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, since it might be thought that the space that the brahmin imagines to be supported on the wind does not exist, the Bhagavān said, “Space is known because light exists.”

original: snang ba ni gzugs can te bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni gzugs can te bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Light is physical, it is demonstrable, and it possesses resistance.

original: gal te nam mkha' de med du zin na de go skabs 'byed pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' de med du zin na de go skabs 'byed pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If space did not exist, it would not open a passage for light.

original: de'i phyir snang ba ni de yod pa'i rtags yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba ni de yod pa'i rtags yin no ;
translated: Therefore light is a sign of its existence.🔽The cessation that is attained through analysis is the abandonment of suffering.

original: / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal spong ba'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin bshad pas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i rim pa la bab pa las go bsnor te /
analyzed: / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal spong ba'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin bshad pas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i rim pa la bab pa las go bsnor te /
translated: Since it is explained in accordance with the way it is taught, the order of the cessation that is not attained through analysis is reversed.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'i 'og tu de dgag pa rnam par spro ba sla bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'i 'og tu de dgag pa rnam par spro ba sla bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa sngar bshad do //
translated: The cessation resulting from deliberation is explained first, because it is easy to elaborate on the cessation of the latter, after one has fully understood the nature of the cessation resulting from deliberation.

original: sdug bsngal 'dor ba ni sdug bsngal spong pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'dor ba ni sdug bsngal spong pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of suffering is the elimination of suffering.

original: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni na ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal rnam pa mang du yod mod kyi thams cad kyang skye ba las byung ba'i phyir mdor na skye ba nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes smos so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni na ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal rnam pa mang du yod mod kyi thams cad kyang skye ba las byung ba'i phyir mdor na skye ba nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes smos so //
translated: In brief, although there are many kinds of suffering, such as sickness, etc., all of them are included in birth, and therefore it is said in brief that birth is suffering.

original: srid pa mngon par 'grub bo zhes bya ba dang / 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa mngon par 'grub bo zhes bya ba dang / 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The expression “the manifestation of existence” and “its engagement” refer to birth.

original: srid pa ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni skye ba'o //
translated: Existence is birth.

original: de mngon par 'grub pa ni mngon par 'grub pa ste /🔽srid pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub pa ni mngon par 'grub pa ste / srid pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: Its manifestation is the manifestation of birth.🔽The occurrence of existence is the engagement of existence.

original: de'i 'jug pa ni 'jug pa ste yang dang yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa ni 'jug pa ste yang dang yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Its engagement is its repeated occurrence.

original: de'i 'jug pa med pa ni skye @299b ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa med pa ni skye @299b ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The non-engagement of existence is the absence of birth.

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni spong ba zhes ming du gdags pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni spong ba zhes ming du gdags pa'o //
translated: “It is called abandonment” means that it is designated by the name “abandonment. ”

original: chu 'bab pa bcad pa lta bu ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: chu 'bab pa bcad pa lta bu ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Like a dam” is a simile.

original: rlung rgyu ba la thogs par byed pa ni rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa ste //
analyzed: rlung rgyu ba la thogs par byed pa ni rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa ste //
translated: “Obstructing the movement of the wind” means obstructing the movement of the wind.

original: 'dis thogs par byed pas thogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis thogs par byed pas thogs par byed pa'o //
translated: “It obstructs” means it is an obstruction.

original: de ni rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa yang yin la brag kyang yin pas rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa'i brag go //
analyzed: de ni rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa yang yin la brag kyang yin pas rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa'i brag go //
translated: It is both an obstruction and a wind-movement, so it is an obstruction to the movement of the wind.

original: dper na brag ni rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na brag ni rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa'o //
translated: For example, a dam is an obstruction to the movement of the wind.

original: de bzhin du skye ba'i rgyud gcod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba'i rgyud gcod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, that which cuts off the continuum of birth is called analytical cessation.

original: 'dis ni rjes su yod pa nyid rab tu ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su yod pa nyid rab tu ston to //
translated: This shows that it exists subsequently.

original: brtags pas 'gog pa ni shes rab ste 'dis rtogs pas brtags pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pas 'gog pa ni shes rab ste 'dis rtogs pas brtags pa'o //
translated: Analytical cessation is wisdom. It is analyzed by this, so it is analyzed.

original: tha dad du yongs su bgrang pas brtags pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad du yongs su bgrang pas brtags pa'o //
translated: It is analyzed by being counted separately.

original: dper na gcig la sogs pa'i grangs kyis dngos po yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab 'dis kyang dngos po yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: dper na gcig la sogs pa'i grangs kyis dngos po yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab 'dis kyang dngos po yongs su gcod do //
translated: For example, just as the number one completely determines a thing, so this wisdom completely determines a thing.

original: ji ltar dngos po yongs su gcod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po yongs su gcod ce na /
translated: How does it completely determine a thing?

original: so sor zhes bya ba'i sgrar khyab par 'dod pa'i tshig gi bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba'i sgrar khyab par 'dod pa'i tshig gi bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa ste /
translated: The word “each” is to be supplied. The four noble truths are apprehended in the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'o /🔽blo'i bye brag dge ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni lam rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'o / blo'i bye brag dge ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni lam rjod par byed de /
translated: Therefore, it is “discernment.”

original: lam gyis 'di 'thob bo //
analyzed: lam gyis 'di 'thob bo //
translated: “The special knowledge is virtuous” indicates the path, because one attains this by means of the path.

original: des zhes bya ba ni blos so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni blos so //
translated: “By it” means by the knowledge.

original: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: “Attainment” means acquisition.

original: de gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is that?

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is cessation.

original: zho'i bum pa bzhin du tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zho'i bum pa bzhin du tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa'o //
translated: The middle term is elided, as in the expression “curd-pot.”

original: rtag pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not something to be produced, because it is permanent.

original: spang bar bya ba mtha' yas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa spang bar bya ba dag mtha' yas pa de bzhin du spong ba'i rdzas de yang mtha' yas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba mtha' yas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa spang bar bya ba dag mtha' yas pa de bzhin du spong ba'i rdzas de yang mtha' yas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Like the infinite objects to be abandoned” means that just as the objects to be abandoned, such as attachment, are infinite, so too should one see that the substance of their abandonment is infinite.

original: gal te gcig pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te gcig pa zhig yin na /
translated: If it were one,

original: spang bar bya ba bzhin du mtha' yas par ma gyur na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba bzhin du mtha' yas par ma gyur na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: what would be wrong with saying that it is not infinite like the objects to be abandoned?

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig snga ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig snga ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “By the previous moment of the noble path alone,”

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nyid kyis @300a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nyid kyis @300a * //
translated: by the forbearance of the dharma of the knowledge of suffering alone.

original: so ; / de zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: so ; / de zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to cessation.

original: mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba ni de'i thob pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba ni de'i thob pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Actualized” means that its attainment is actualized.

original: phyi ma zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun 'byung ba la sogs pa sdud do //
analyzed: phyi ma zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun 'byung ba la sogs pa sdud do //
translated: “The subsequent” includes the origin and so on.

original: 'gog pa gcig pu zhig yod na ni //
analyzed: 'gog pa gcig pu zhig yod na ni //
translated: If there were only one cessation,

original: snga ma nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pas na de spang bar bya ba'i phyir lam bsgoms pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snga ma nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pas na de spang bar bya ba'i phyir lam bsgoms pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is already directly perceived by the former, it would be pointless to cultivate the path in order to abandon it.

original: de bas na du ma nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na du ma nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established as manifold.

original: cung zad ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: A little means nirvana.

original: rdzas gcig pu kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rdzas gcig pu kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: It is indeed a single substance.

original: 'on kyang 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig snga mas ma lus par mngon sum du byed pa ma yin gyi lam bsgom pa phyi ma dag gis ma lus par mngon sum du byed par 'dod na de lta na ni cung zad mngon sum du byed pas mya ngan
analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig snga mas ma lus par mngon sum du byed pa ma yin gyi lam bsgom pa phyi ma dag gis ma lus par mngon sum du byed par 'dod na de lta na ni cung zad mngon sum du byed pas mya ngan
translated: However, if it is asserted that the former moment of the noble path does not directly perceive it in its entirety, but the later cultivations of the path directly perceive it in its entirety, then in that case, since a little is directly perceived,

original: las 'das pa yan lag dang bcas par 'gyur te //
analyzed: las 'das pa yan lag dang bcas par 'gyur te //
translated: nirvana would have parts.

original: rtag pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa yin pas yan lag med par 'dod do //
analyzed: rtag pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa yin pas yan lag med par 'dod do //
translated: But it is asserted to be partless, because it is permanent, undemonstrable, and unimpeded.

original: 'bras bu'i bye brag zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bye brag zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag gis so //
translated: By the distinction of fruits means by the distinction of fruits such as stream-enterer.

original: spong ba'i khams dang // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: spong ba'i khams dang // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The realm of abandonment, the realm of freedom from passion, and the realm of cessation.

original: de la 'dod chags ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba ni spong ba'i khams so //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba ni spong ba'i khams so //
translated: The realm of abandonment is the abandonment of all the defilements except passion.

original: 'dod chags spong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags spong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams so //
translated: The realm of freedom from passion is the abandonment of passion.

original: sngar bshad pa ma gtogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag spong ba ni 'gog pa'i khams so //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ma gtogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag spong ba ni 'gog pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of cessation is the abandonment of the five appropriative aggregates, except for what has already been explained.

original: bden pa gnyis po spong pa'i bye brag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba spong ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis po spong pa'i bye brag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba spong ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The realm of abandonment is twofold, according to the distinction between the abandonment of the truths of suffering and of the origin of suffering.

original: phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings kyi bye brag gis yang rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings kyi bye brag gis yang rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba de la /
translated: It is twofold, according to the distinction between the realm of the remainder of the aggregates and the realm of the non-remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams so //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams so //
translated: The remainder of the aggregates is the five aggregates.

original: phung po rnams dang ldan te lhag ma lus pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang ldan te lhag ma lus pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the aggregates, but he has a remainder of aggregates.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas phung po tsam zhig lus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas phung po tsam zhig lus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he has abandoned all the defilements, he has a remainder of aggregates.

original: gang dang phung po rnams bral ba de ni phung po'i lhag @300b ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: gang dang phung po rnams bral ba de ni phung po'i lhag @300b ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: He is free from the aggregates, and that is the element of nirvana without a remainder of aggregates.

original: de ni phung po med pa yang yin la lhag ma yang yin pas phung po med pa'i lhag ma ste /
analyzed: de ni phung po med pa yang yin la lhag ma yang yin pas phung po med pa'i lhag ma ste /
translated: He is without aggregates, and he has a remainder, so he is without a remainder of aggregates.

original: phung po dang ni bral la /
analyzed: phung po dang ni bral la /
translated: He is free from the aggregates,

original: de tsam zhig lus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de tsam zhig lus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but he has a remainder. This is what is being taught.

original: mtshams sbyor ba med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is without a connection.

original: so sor mtshams sbyor ba ni mtshams sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: so sor mtshams sbyor ba ni mtshams sbyor ba ste /
translated: A connection is a connection to a particular thing.

original: skye ba yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by “he takes up birth.”

original: 'di la ni mtshams sbyor ba med pas mtshams mi sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: 'di la ni mtshams sbyor ba med pas mtshams mi sbyor ba ste //
translated: He is without a connection, so he is without a connection.

original: mtshams mi sbyor ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams mi sbyor ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
translated: Non-connection is the absence of connection.

original: skye ba 'gag pa ni skye ba 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gag pa ni skye ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of birth is the cessation of birth.

original: de ni mtshams sbyor ba med pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni mtshams sbyor ba med pa yang yin la /
translated: That is the absence of connection and

original: skye ba 'gog pa yang yin pas mtshams sbyor ba med pa ste skye ba 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gog pa yang yin pas mtshams sbyor ba med pa ste skye ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: the cessation of birth.
