original: de rnam par gzhag pas na gcig go zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pas na gcig go zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is one in terms of its establishment. It is one in terms of its aspect.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: du ma yin yang spyir na mtshams sbyor ba med pa skye ba 'gog pa yin pas gcig kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: du ma yin yang spyir na mtshams sbyor ba med pa skye ba 'gog pa yin pas gcig kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Although there are many, in general, it is said to be one because it is the absence of connection and the cessation of birth.

original: de la zad pa ni skye ba mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la zad pa ni skye ba mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: In this regard, exhaustion is the non-occurrence of birth.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rga ba mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rga ba mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Freedom from attachment is the non-occurrence of aging.

original: 'gog pa ni nad rnams bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni nad rnams bcom pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the destruction of diseases.

original: rnam par zhi ba ni 'chi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba ni 'chi ba med pa'o //
translated: Complete peace is immortality.

original: nub pa ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nub pa ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Disappearance is the absence of suffering and so on.

original: yang na 'dul ba'i bye brag gis tshig phyi ma ni snga ma'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dul ba'i bye brag gis tshig phyi ma ni snga ma'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Or else, the latter terms are explanations of the former terms, according to the differences in the disciplines.🔽The terms that are synonyms are “exhaustion,” “dispassion,” “disenchantment,” and so on.

original: de'i rnam grangs kyi sgra ni zad pa dang // 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag nyi tshe rnam grangs su gtogs pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs kyi sgra ni zad pa dang // 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag nyi tshe rnam grangs su gtogs pa yin gyi //
translated: But the terms that are synonyms are not only those that are taught in this sūtra;

original: mdo gzhan las ji snyed bstan pa'o //🔽de bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ji snyed bstan pa'o // de bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: there are also those that are taught in other sūtras.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: de skad du zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de skad du zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: “It is said in a sūtra:

original: phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four non-material aggregates are feeling, etc.

original: mig gi dbang po gzugs can ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gzugs can ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The material eye faculty is what is called the form aggregate.

original: 'di la 'di ni dam bca' ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la 'di ni dam bca' ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, this is the thesis:

original: phung po lnga po de dag la bdag gis mthong ngo zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag la bdag gis mthong ngo zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: “In regard to those five aggregates, it is said, ‘I see with this.’”

original: tshe dang ldan pa de'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa de'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The venerable one

original: phung po lnga yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: phung po lnga yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: holds the five aggregates.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Monks, thus this is merely a name.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas @301a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas @301a * //
translated: As such, the meaning of the term “vajra” is as follows.🔽

original: ni bdag bsal ba ston to //
analyzed: ni bdag bsal ba ston to //
translated: Thus, the self is refuted.

original: dge slong dag chos 'di thams cad ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos 'di thams cad ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Monks, all this is impermanent”

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is subject to arising.

original: sems pas 'phangs pa ni las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pas 'phangs pa ni las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is suffering” because it is projected by karma and the afflictions.

original: 'dus byas ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is conditioned” because it is endowed with the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni rgyu dang / rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni rgyu dang / rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is dependently arisen” because it arises from causes and conditions.🔽“It is subject to destruction” because it is subject to cessation.

original: mi rtag pa nas zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal skye ba yang sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus na rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nas zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal skye ba yang sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus na rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is subject to arising” because it arises from a previous nonexistence.

original: gnas pa ni skye ba la sogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni skye ba la sogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is subject to abiding” because it abides after arising.

original: mngon bar grub pa ni mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon bar grub pa ni mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is subject to manifestation” because it is the cause of the moment of conception.🔽“It is subject to origination” because it is the cause of the subsequent continuum.🔽“It is subject to destruction” because it is subject to cessation.🔽“It is subject to arising” because it arises from a previous nonexistence.

original: 'byung ba yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni rgyun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni rgyun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is subject to abiding” because it abides after arising.🔽“It is subject to manifestation” because it is the cause of the moment of conception.🔽“It is subject to origination” because it is the cause of the subsequent continuum.

original: 'di yod na phung po thams cad so sor 'dor te gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yod na phung po thams cad so sor 'dor te gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When it exists, one abandons and gives up all the aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin na /
translated: If nirvana is a non-thing,

original: ci'i phyir rtag pa zhes bstan la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtag pa zhes bstan la /
translated: why is it taught to be permanent?

original: dngos po med pa gzhan ni ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gzhan ni ma yin /
translated: It is not another non-thing.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: As it is said in verse:

original: rtag pa gang yin mya ngan 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa gang yin mya ngan 'das pa'o //
translated: What is permanent is nirvana.

original: mi rtag gang yin 'dus byas chos kun no //
analyzed: mi rtag gang yin 'dus byas chos kun no //
translated: What is impermanent are all conditioned phenomena.

original: drang po gang yin 'phags pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: drang po gang yin 'phags pa'i lam yin no //
translated: What is straight is the noble path.

original: gya gyu gang yin sdig can lta ba'o //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gya gyu gang yin sdig can lta ba'o // zhes gsungs te /
translated: What is crooked is the view of the wicked.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa rtag par grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa rtag par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is established as permanent.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa bshad zin to //
translated: The cessation through deliberation has been explained.

original: da ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the cessation not through deliberation should be stated.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba gang las she na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba gang las she na /
translated: What is other than that?

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa las so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa las so //
translated: From the cessation through deliberation.

original: gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: What is other is cessation.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Future form, etc.

original: / skye ba la shin tu bgegs su gyur pa ni gcod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: / skye ba la shin tu bgegs su gyur pa ni gcod par gyur pa'o //
translated: is that which is an obstacle to the arising of that which is to arise.

original: ma 'ongs pa smos pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa bsal ba ston to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa smos pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa bsal ba ston to //
translated: The mention of the future indicates that cessation due to impermanence is excluded.

original: gtan du zhes bya ba smos pas ni 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba'i 'gog pa bsal ba ston to //
analyzed: gtan du zhes bya ba smos pas ni 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba'i 'gog pa bsal ba ston to //
translated: The mention of “permanently” indicates that cessation due to deliberation and the attainment of non-perception are excluded.

original: de ni ma 'ongs pa mi skye ba'i chos can du nges pa rnams la 'thob bo //
analyzed: de ni ma 'ongs pa mi skye ba'i chos can du nges pa rnams la 'thob bo //
translated: It is obtained in regard to those future entities that are certain to arise.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni dus gsum char las 'thob bo //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni dus gsum char las 'thob bo //
translated: Cessation due to deliberation is obtained in all three times.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du btang ba med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du btang ba med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Cessation due to deliberation is not obtained in regard to those entities that are not to arise, i.e., those that are not preceded by the intellect.

original: rkyen ma tshang bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Due to the incompleteness of the conditions means

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen @301b med pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen @301b med pa'o //
translated: due to the absence of the condition of immediate antecedent.

original: de ni dper byas te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dper byas te bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught by way of example.

original: dper na mig dang yid kyi gzugs zhig la yengs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na mig dang yid kyi gzugs zhig la yengs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, “if one is distracted by a form with the eye and the mind. ”

original: mig dang yid ces bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig dang yid ces bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, “eye” and “mind” are synonymous with “eye consciousness” and “mental consciousness. ”

original: de ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ Not that” refers to

original: gzugs de las gzhan du gyur pa ni de ma thag pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan no //
analyzed: gzugs de las gzhan du gyur pa ni de ma thag pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan no //
translated: “other than that form. ” The immediately preceding is “other than that. ”

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Phenomena” refers to feelings, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag la dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni de la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag la dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni de la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Those that have that as their object are “those that have that as their object. ”

original: dmigs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba ni yul nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba ni yul nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: “ The generation of those minds and mental factors that have that as their object” means that the object is ascertained.

original: de dag gis de thob na zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob na'o //
analyzed: de dag gis de thob na zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob na'o //
translated: “ When they obtain that” means when they obtain non-analytical cessation.

original: mi skye ba ste des de dag 'gag par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni bgegs su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi skye ba ste des de dag 'gag par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni bgegs su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ It is non-arising” means that by that, they cease. This means that it is an obstruction.

original: de'i tshor ba gnyi ga 'gag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshor ba gnyi ga 'gag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cessation of two feelings is stated in this verse.

original: 'di la bde ba la sogs pa tshor ba gsum po de dag mi mthun pas cig car mngon du gyur par mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bde ba la sogs pa tshor ba gsum po de dag mi mthun pas cig car mngon du gyur par mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The three feelings of pleasure, etc., are incompatible, and therefore do not occur simultaneously.

original: de la gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba da ltar byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pas tshor ba gnyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba da ltar byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pas tshor ba gnyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the feeling of pleasure is present, the cessation of two feelings is obtained, because the non-analytical cessation is obtained.

original: ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ci mngon zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence for this?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: 'gog pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of cessation:

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: cessation due to impermanence, cessation not due to analytical means, and cessation due to analytical means.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gog pa ni byung ba'i chos rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gog pa ni byung ba'i chos rnams kyi ste /
translated: Cessation due to impermanence is of those dharmas that have arisen.

original: byung nas mi rtag pas rnam par 'jig gi / ma byung ba rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: byung nas mi rtag pas rnam par 'jig gi / ma byung ba rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: Having arisen, they are destroyed by impermanence, but not those that have not arisen.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni dus gsum char gyi zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni dus gsum char gyi zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation through deliberation is the cessation of all that is defiled in the three times.

original: de bas na de lta bu gnyis med pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa nyid 'dir gzung bar rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu gnyis med pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa nyid 'dir gzung bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to accept that cessation not through deliberation is just that, since it is not like that, i.e., not a cessation through deliberation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga nyi tshe so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga nyi tshe so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The five collections of consciousness are not just cessation not through deliberation.

original: phung po lnga po de dag kyang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag kyang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob bo //
translated: Those five aggregates also attain cessation not through deliberation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong 'di'i sems can dmyal ba rnams zad do //🔽dud 'gro rnams zad do //
analyzed: dge slong 'di'i sems can dmyal ba rnams zad do // dud 'gro rnams zad do //
translated: “The monk’s hell beings are exhausted.🔽Animal births are exhausted.

original: yi dags rnams zad do zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: yi dags rnams zad do zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Hungry ghost births are exhausted.”

original: bzod pa thob pas rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa'i dbang du byas te @302a * //
analyzed: bzod pa thob pas rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa'i dbang du byas te @302a * //
translated: This is said from the perspective of one who has attained patience and has become a stream-enterer.

original: gsungs kyi / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir de sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ma spangs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs kyi / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir de sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ma spangs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But because he is not free from attachment to the desire realm, he has not abandoned the hell beings, etc.

original: de'i 'dod chags dang bral nas ngan song rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags dang bral nas ngan song rnams spong ngo //
translated: Having become free from attachment to that, one abandons the miserable realms.

original: de la ma skyes pa'i phyir yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pas zad pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de la ma skyes pa'i phyir yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pas zad pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not that they are exhausted by the cessation of impermanence.

original: / de bas na chos gang la la thob pas ngan song rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: / de bas na chos gang la la thob pas ngan song rnams spong ngo //
translated: Therefore, by obtaining some dharma, one abandons the miserable realms.

original: de la ma skyes pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pas zad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ma skyes pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pas zad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they are exhausted by the cessation of impermanence.

original: de bas na chos gang la la thob pas ngan song rnams mi skye ba'i chos nyid du chos de yod de /
analyzed: de bas na chos gang la la thob pas ngan song rnams mi skye ba'i chos nyid du chos de yod de /
translated: Therefore, by obtaining some dharma, one obtains the non-arising of the miserable realms.

original: de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: That is non-analytical cessation.

original: ci'i phyir der ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba zlos bur bstan zhe na /🔽ngan song zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtshams med pa lnga mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir der ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba zlos bur bstan zhe na / ngan song zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtshams med pa lnga mi byed pa'o //
translated: Why are the miserable realms, bad destinies, and bad migrations taught as synonyms?🔽The term “miserable realms” refers to not committing the five heinous actions.

original: ngan 'gro zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lta ba lnga kun du mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lta ba lnga kun du mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The term “bad destinies” refers to not giving rise to the five views.

original: log par ltung ba'i sgras ni za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang ; bud med dang / srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i sgras ni za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang ; bud med dang / srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: The term “fallen into error” refers to the abandonment of the eight states of existence, namely, the eunuch, the neuter, the hermaphrodite, the female, and the male.

original: 'dir mtha' bzhi par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir mtha' bzhi par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are four alternatives:

original: chos gang dag so sor brtags pas 'gog pa nyid thob pa de dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: chos gang dag so sor brtags pas 'gog pa nyid thob pa de dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are those dharmas that are attained through the cessation that is due to deliberation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'byung ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'byung ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: the past, present, and future dharmas that are associated with the outflows.

original: gang dag so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa nyid yang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa nyid yang yod de /
translated: There are those that are attained through the cessation that is not due to deliberation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: mi 'byung ba'i chos zag pa med pa'i 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba'i chos zag pa med pa'i 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: the unconditioned dharmas that are not associated with the outflows and that are not subject to appearance.

original: gang dag gnyi gar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag gnyi gar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: There are those that are attained through both.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la skye ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la skye ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: the dharmas that are associated with the outflows and that are subject to appearance.

original: gang dag gnyi ga ma yin pa yang yod de /
